["If you had to make an educated guess as to what year/time period Bloodborne takes place in, when do you think it would be? 
 Because of the recurring key themes of the Gothic Genre, I want to believe that it takes place in the 1800s, namely the 1860s-1890s. Obviously Bloodborne is not based on real life in the slightest, so obviously time and the date aren't going to work the same way as they do in real life. But I just wanted to see what you guys thought.", 'Discussion of Irreverent Izzy, the creator of the Beast Claws and the Beast Roar 
 We know very little about this man. All we know is that we encounter someone in the Chalice Dungeons wielding them (along with the Beast Claws hidden inside a chest), and someone in the Hunter's Nightmare who wields them as well, that has also transformed into a beast (like we do with the Beast's Embrace Rune).

From the definition of 'Irreverent',

"showing a lack of respect for people or things that are generally taken seriously"

This suggests that Izzy was quite rebellious and had his own motives. He didn't listen to instructions and didn't respect other people, didn't respect the traditions of Yharnam, maybe of the Hunters, maybe of the Healing Church. In the context of Bloodborne, perhaps Izzy was a Hunter or member of the Healing Church, that went against the norm of hunting  beasts and the worship of the Old Blood, by making forbidden weapons. Perhaps he was a White Church member? After all, the White Church garb states that those men and women believed in exposing themselves to the sickness firsthand, to learn more about it. Maybe Izzy wanted to learn more about how the beasts worked, what fuelled their ferocity and wild strength. Maybe Izzy wanted this power for himself, power that he was strictly told to not use, to NEVER even think about. 

Locations of items and hunter gear throughout are important to us as lore enthusiasts. Where are the Beast Claws found? In a large chest in the Chalice Dungeons. Why could this be? Perhaps Izzy had placed them there so no one could find them. Perhaps he had them taken off him? 

Where is the Beast Roar found? In the Forbidden Woods. Why could this be? Izzy may have been on the run from a Beast or crazed man, and dropped the tool without knowing. 

Analysing the locations of these pieces of Hunter gear will help us to understand this man, along with every other character shrouded in mystery. 

What are your thoughts on this?', 'If you have stealed your fate is sealed', 'Since when did the Hoarfrost Reach get an Aurora borealis']

["Jeanne de Arc, Joan's little sister who took up her banner. (Its the same name as the daughter of the arms dealer in NCIS that Tony dates and falls in love with. I've always loved that name.)

Edit to add: Oh you meant the actual name, not name ideas lmao!! Sorry!", 'Tennis shoes sounds like ten issues. Just a pun.', 'Dont compliment me or give me a pet name until we have known each other for at least 2 weeks. 
 Can I just say how fucking annoying it is to be talking to someone who wants to get to know me for dating and I'm doing the same with them and they immediately start complimenting me?? Like bitch you dont know a thing about me except how I look. We have talked for 30 seconds, dont call me beautiful, pretty, smart, kind, cute, babe, baby, lovely, sexy, hot or anything else!!!

It makes me super self conscious and uncomfortable and I immediately want to get away from the conversation. You want to know what makes me feel special? When someone calls me those things after seeing me at my best AND my worst. It means so much more coming from someone who walked in on me in my pjs with my hair a disaster surrounded by my depression mess than from someone who only saw my facebook profile which is only the pictures that went through 10 levels of approval before being posted.

Compliments or pet names too early are such a turn off. 

I only think this is an unpopular opinion because it happens to me every. single. time. I talk to someone on a dating app or in person who is chatting me up. It comes from all genders and ages and all it tells me is that you are shallow. Beauty is not the only thing I have so fucking stop. Also stop using compliments to soften people up just because you're desperate to have a human pay attention to you.


Tl:dr
Compliments are empty when they come from strangers who just want into your pants asap. If you really want to compliment someone wait until you know them better and make more personal compliments so that they feel more genuine to the person you give them to.


Edit to clarify:
When someone says "hi, nice to meet you beautiful" it's different. 
You dont text your mom "sup sexy babe" 
you dont tell your brother "I'm not doing much sweet cheeks, how about you?"
Like it's obvious which ones are genuinely innocent and something they say all the time and ones that are geared towards buttering you up as fast as possible.', "Road trip crochet projects! Im doing Lost Souls shawl and my mom is doing Sophie's Universe."]

["First apartment I consciously remember living in.  I may have been 4 or 5 when we moved in.

The entire place has an orange hue and it's full of shadow people.  I struggle to run to my room to escape them, like I have spaghetti noodles for legs cause I can barely keep myself upright.

When I get to my room, I can't close the door because the door doesn't fit the frame.  It's too small.  I can't get it to latch properly.

I try the bathroom and my dad's room, every door has the same problem.  It's too small.

I finally decide to just run outside.  Open the front door and it's pitch black.  I try to close the front door behind me and again, it's too small.

The orange hue is bleeding out into the darkness and the shadow people are getting closer.  I end up screaming and then I wake up.

...Started having this dream when I was 7 and we had moved out of that apartment.  I'm 31 now and I still have this dream often.", "They checked my thyroid, ovaries have been looked at, had a laprascopy (spelling?) to make sure my innards were chill cause doctors really are at a loss.

There's really no explanation for it.  It's annoying.", 'Why I (personally) am rendered 100% useless against The Doctor... 
 Doctor is fairly OP...

But I'm not a quitter and do my best...

Problem is, I can't get anything done because I spend the whole game running from him/<BOLD> avoiding shock therapy...

<BOLD> Why?

I have <BOLD> Schizoaffective Disorder.  I am medicated.  Haven't "heard things" in a long while.

But when you hear those <BOLD> auditory voices/sounds after getting hit with madness a bunch...  Yeah...  I'm done.

Messes with my head cause I feel like I'm actually hearing things again/reminded of how bad it was when I did hear them irl...

Still though, I wont disconnect.  It just sucks.

Anybody else struggle with this?  I'm curious.', 'Drugs.  Both my parents were heavily into drugs back then.  Dad was a dealer, mom was an addict.  That's how they met.

Though, my dad was very spiritual.  Liked to think there was a plan in the universe.  So I would probably drop some acid with him and get into a deep conversation about the cosmos giving us very clear signs about what to do and what to avoid.  Knowing how my dad works, I would get his head stuck on this.  I would get him in a years long deep think about heeding the warnings in plain sight.  For example, going to use a vending machine but it keeps spitting your dollar back out = the universe doesn't want you to have a coke right now.  That kind of shit.

All of that for this purpose...  I will not exist.  I know it sounds angsty, but I'm not supposed to be here and it shows.  After my sister was born, my parents were on the decline in their relationship.  I was a "save the relationship baby" and they fully separated by time I was 2.  

In the realm of me being born, they decided to try for me and...  Their first attempt ended in a late term miscarriage of a little girl that shared my name.  The second attempt ended the same way.  Another dead fetus with my name.  The third attempt was the exact same thing.  

The universe said "guys, maybe don't do this" and they ignored it.  Fourth attempt and well...  HERE I AM.

My life has been a never ending shit storm to almost a comical degree.  I literally shouldn't exist.

So yeah.  Drugs and existential/philosophical talks until I start fading away right before his eyes.

...but maybe I've already done this.  Maybe I did travel back and do exactly that.  Because, knowing Dad, the second I fade away in front of him he would assume it was just a bad trip and dismiss all revelations therein.

Ah, the cycle continues.']

['Ohhhhh, yeah, I had to learn how to run a pilot against titans.   

In a Northstar I‚Äôm either the first one dead or the last one dead, there‚Äôs rarely an in between.   I had to find a way to make myself useful when I‚Äôm the first.', 'Agreed, unless you‚Äôve literally put yourself in a corner where you can be body blocked while they‚Äôre shielding you. 

In even the most disadvantageous exchange with a Scorch I‚Äôve come out doomed, at worst, and they‚Äôre down most of their health and in no position to chase after me.  After that it‚Äôs just a game of using mobility to grab batteries and range to get them doomed so it‚Äôs a draw at worst.  

A cluster shot short of their shield will take a bar off of them as they shield through it and a tether will hold them since they burned their shield damaging you and keeping up their advance.   They‚Äôll have to wait for it to recharge to burn it off or waste a thermite shot to shoot it, opens them up to another rail gun shot.', 'I feel some sympathy towards you since you seem to be a Scorch main, you‚Äôre throwing paper against scissors.  It sounds like you need to know when to break off and find somewhere more fitting for your Titan to be. 

There‚Äôs no rule that says you need to chase a NS in circles around the map. 

If it‚Äôs you vs a NS as the last two titans in LTS then yeah, you‚Äôre screwed, but when it‚Äôs me vs a pilot with an Archer, thunderbolt, or laser, I‚Äôm the one that‚Äôs screwed.  

One bad move in positioning or using your last boost at the wrong time and the NS is in the same scenario as you but with no defense and 2/3 of your health.  

Someone specified going against a good pilot which makes a huge difference.  It‚Äôs one of the reasons they can‚Äôt actually balance titans in this game because the difference between an average pilot and a good pilot is so huge.    

The Ronin is a NS‚Äôs natural enemy and there‚Äôs some I‚Äôve never won a match against and there‚Äôs some I kill before they even get in arc wave range of me. You can‚Äôt nerf a Titan for the way 10% play it because it‚Äôs then unplayable for the other 90%.   You just have to adapt your playstyle to account for that 10% when you run into them.', 'I don‚Äôt even have to try, they just keep running into my Flame Shield']

["100%, they're playing a game of chicken with me. They know I'm going to struggle living on my own and I think they thought I wouldn't go through with it. 

I've waited 13 years, I'm not waiting anymore.

They told me they're just going to tell family im at work (I work retail so im usually late to events anyway). 

I do hope they eventually decide I'm worth fighting for.", 'Late to the party Haha, Marie could be changed to Muarry or Matthew or Marley if you wanted to keep it similar. 

Or go completely away like Zachary or Anthony. 

I chose my middle name (not legally yet) after my Grandfather Jakob.', "I've used Minoxidal the day I started T (just happen to come in that day)

3 months of using it (and 3 months on T) almost everyday sometimes once, sometimes twice. I'm not that good at remembering it.

Not a single hair to some nice growth. A lot more than I anticipated.

<LINK>", '3 weeks on T; an update. 
 I'm just over 3 weeks on T patches (Androderm 2.5). Started at 2.5 as I'm sensitive to medications and have some mental health issues. Should be going up to 5 at one month or so. Figured it might be good to share my progress so far. 


Before T I had no hormonal issues, PCOS, or anything that would affect T. 


I am also doing Minoxidil twice a day. (At least once a day for sure)



VOICE


Since the first week my throat has been tight and scratchy. My voice hasn't "dropped" any, but it's a lot easier and more natural to sing lower during car karaoke.

I'm also quite monotonous (thanks autism!) to begin with, so it's hard to tell.



FACE 

I've been using Minoxidil since day 1. Once a day at night on my entire beard are, and I try to do it every morning on just my mustache/chin area.

Moisturizing with Nivea Face moisturizer after 4 hours. Minoxidil dried my oily skin to a peeling desert! Bonus I guess?

Just started noticing results. Peach fuzz is "fuller" meaning there's more coverage of it. Around my lip it's longer. Maybe 1cm max. Still blonde/peach fuzz colour. 

I just noticed on the tops of the corners of my mouth it's the same gentle texture of hair, but dark brown. So my stache is starting! It's not that noticeable unless you look hard and close. 



WARNING BOTTOM TALK

I didn't think I would care about bottom growth, but there has been quite a bit, and I'm ecstatic. It's like a little penis! 
It started the first week.

WARNING OVER




BODY

I'm hot all the time and hungry. I can finally see how my cousins ate all the time. It sucks because I'm trying to lose weight, but despite eating like a teenage boy, I haven't gained any weight. Working on figuring out healthier options and use my new metabolism for good.

I'm not horny or anything. Now I am, if I wanted to put a label on it, technically asexual. Never had any sexual desires. So I'm not surprised on that.

I've gone from needing 6 hours of sleep to not being able to get enough, even 12 hours. I'm functionally tired though, not exhausted.

My urine smells different, and my body odour is changing a bit.


MENTALLY

Placebo effect? Probably.
I struggle with anxiety and depression.
Since being on T my head has cleared. It's like night and day. Any doubt I had about this went away. 

I feel calmer, and more relaxed. Little things don't bother me anymore. 

I can see a future for myself now.

I'm not aggressive, but I'm a bit more assertive. For example I'm arguing back with my parents.

At work (my boss knows but I'm not out yet) they've seen a major difference in my performance.']

["Ya, that's why I abandoned the Black Garden strat. My Rose Dragon deck is still in the works, but I kinda honed in on an Aroma deck that's somewhat okay, at least in a casual setting.", 'We are in desperate need of more grade school Mya-nee', '<QUOTE>

Oh wow, you're right. Never realized it said "original level", probably since it rarely ever becomes something to consider.

<QUOTE>

That's true since Impact setting its DEF to 0 is usually Crystron's answer to Cocytus. A more convoluted workaround is attacking into it with Samurai Destroyer to disable its protection, then using World Legacy Clash to weaken it, but not only does it need those particular cards to work, Cocytus is also mindlessly easy for them to summon again since Aleister gets recycled more than plastic bottles.', "I'd say yes as it gives you a sub-boss monster aside from Quariongandrax (who you want to save for when really needed).

Samurai Destroyer gets around a lot of other sub-bosses like Cat Dancer, Fortune Lady Every, and Chimeratech Overdragon, forcing your opponent to commit to a play and summon their real boss monsters which you then hit with Quariongandrax (or Black Rose). With some back up as well like World Legacy Clash or Forbidden Lance, you might not even need Quariongandrax.

Fun little thing to do against Dark Cavalry is to attack into it with SD, disabling its attack boost and target negation, then using WLC or Lance to weaken it. Also works against Saber Dancer as it negates the target protection <ITALIC> and prevents your opponent from using Crimson Fox during the battle.", "I'm probably gonna skip this box, but Gizmek Yata seems like an interesting pick up for my Crystrons as a Heavy Starter target.

Normal Summon Thystvern, tribute it for Gizmek, then use Thystvern's search. If you also happen to have Recycler, you can get its mill (or if you're feeling spicy, search Sulfefnir then tribute Gizmek for that LP gain).

I mean, it's not much different from using The Tricky in that regard, apart from a whopping 50 more attack (and the type restriction). The LP gain might be useful against stall burn decks since Lava Golem does tribute it, but it only gives you 2 more turns.

Alternatively, throw Gizmek in Aromas, then tribute it for Bergamot/Milfjoram."]

 That's why I get so upset when people say "Gender is fake/Gender is a social contruct" or when I see a bunch of cis girls obsess over gay men because they watch/read Yaoi and they wanna pretend to be one. ['No problem, hahaha xD

Watercolors really are a great medium to work with!', '[No Spoilers] A little sketch of my favourite goblin girl by Me', "I'm happy this resonates with you so mucg :)", 'I don't know if there is such a thing as an "aspergirl" hairstyle, mostly because we all deal with differences in sensitivity, comfort and what we think is nice. I was in a therapy group with three other aspergirls, and we all had completely different hair (and dress) styles.

Now, I have very thick, super curly hair. My hairdressers are amazed every time they cut it, because I have on half my head what most people have on their whole head. I love my curls, and I love the fact my hair grows fast, but it is a pain to deal with. Most days I simply don't have the energy to make my hair look pretty (and curls demand a lot of attention). So almost two years ago, I decided to go for an undercut.

Undercuts are amazing, especially if you have very thick hair and are really sensitive to stuff being in your neck or face (it is hell in summer). The hair on the sides is super short, while on top it is pretty long. If I have the energy, I will put in Viking braids and feel cool, if not it still looks awesome! :)']

['Ode to The Mets is definitely my favorite', '20, Brazilian in Miami, architecture student, failed driver‚Äôs license test twice for hitting a parked car.', 'AITA for taking a classmates‚Äô jacket without her knowing? 
 So a little basic knowledge for those who don‚Äôt know: architecture students have studios with large personal tables and people usually feel free to leave personal belongings at those spaces since they can spend a minimum of 20-30hrs there a week. It basically feels like a second home. 

I‚Äôm an architecture student at university, so my work hours can range until late hours of the night. A week ago me and my group mate had to stay in the studio until extremely late. So late that we were only able to leave at 5:30am, and at night it can get extremely cold in the studio. The ac is set at 67 and cannot he changed and the long hours of work make it seem even colder. And I wasn‚Äôt expecting to have to spend that much time working ended up being very under dressed. So I asked my group mate if he had a jacket and he said no, but the girl who sits down from him, who I don‚Äôt talk to that much, leaves her jacket there and he thought it‚Äôd be okay to take for an hour or two. So I put it on and felt a little bit of my life come back to me. I left it back where I found it before I left to go home. 

When I finally got home I saw that I had lost my university ID card that would allow me to get in my dormitory. I couldn‚Äôt find it for the whole weekend, and had to keep asking my roommate to let me in. I was vocal to some of my studio mates around me asking if they had seen my ID card anywhere and nothing. Until I get back Monday morning and I find that it‚Äôs on my desk. I ask the girl who sits across from me who found it and she said it was in the the pocket of the girl of who I borrowed the jacket from. And I was a little shocked and embarrassed so I left that night and tried reaching out to her but she didn‚Äôt reply. She‚Äôs stopped leaving her jacket there and appears to be ignoring me overall. 

I told a couple friends about this and they told me I was an asshole for taking her jacket in the first place and not telling her about it. I know it was wrong, but in the moment I would have done anything to stop freezing.', 'Won the lottery and lived off of it with 5 generations and counting. Multiple houses , cars, boats, and airplanes included.']

Feels great to be my true self.', "Writing things down helped me while in psychosis, so it may help him too. Just be aware that the journal might not make any sense to other people or be helpful to a doctor. My notebook was filled with drawings of eyeballs, lists of words, and random numbers that other people didn't understand. I never showed it to a doctor, but I did show it to my family and I think it helped convey to them some of what I was feeling.

He may not want to show a doctor because some of what he writes down would be very personal, and he could get paranoid it would be used against him. ["Any help on finding a specific song/band? 
 This is going to be vague and I apologize.

A few years ago when I started getting big into Japanese music I came across a video of a music video of a Japanese band that I am pretty sure was all female, but they weren't idols like Babymetal, they were more something like Maximum The Hormone just not as hard(?) Anyways what I remember from the music video it was the band members in a room, maybe their dressing room or something and a guy in the room next to them was being loud then one of the girls broke through the wall. I don't remember how exactly, I want to say by throwing a stool through the wall, but that could be wrong.", "Videos have a jagged quality/texture to them. 
 So I noticed this earlier today when watching something on YouTube. I noticed some text was kind of jagged, kind of like the opposite of anti-aliasing (just aliasing?). I didn't think anything of it since it was really just the text on a YouTube video so I thought the person just messed up the text.

I really started to wonder about it when I started to watch Aggretsuko on Netflix and all the thick lines were all jagged. I didn't think that could be right so I started looking up what it could be and didn't find much. 
I tested it out on Firefox to see if it does it there and it doesn't, it only seems to be a Chrome thing. 


Any idea what might be causing this?", "I have not heard of that one, but I will look into it. That seems like what I'm looking for, thank you.", '"Proceed to checkout" isn't working 
 So the last weekend I bought some pencils and a sketch book and was supposed to get them today on Friday. Everything was looking good, I got an email that Monday saying the sketchbook had shipped and got it Wednesday, but no pencils. I didn't think anything about it since they were supposed to be here until Friday so I waited. Well I never got an email saying they were shipped and they never came. 


I decided to look at Amazon today to see what was up and they had said I never even ordered them which I know is a lie. It's whatever though, I decided to order them again and I couldn't find the "proceed to checkout" button on the Amazon app. I thought this might just he an app thing so I went to Chrome and the same thing happened.
I even added something else to my cart and the button reappeared. 


So any ideas why Amazon isn't letting me buy these pencils?']

["I dont think it's fair to assume that you can use dude as a gender neutral term and wait for an objection to change your language. That's self-absorbed and lazy. That's putting a lot of emotional labour on women to have to not only object, but then vehemently defend their position to so many people that are willing to die on that hill. Its exhausting. I've never objected to anyone using dude if they are comfortable with it, no one is trying to stop use of the word, but it is not gender neutral.

You arguing this nuanced point when you are practically agreeing with me that people should be called what they want to be called tells me that you are not really understanding the point I've made.

Context changes things, yes. It doesn't change everything. No need to go into further explanation of your analogy, it was quite simple to understand. It's just not particularly relevant.", 'Still a long way to go, even in lgbt subs people are dense about this.', 'Big milestone today. Starting spiro today, next month I start estrogen. Smell ya later, testosterone.', 'When my egg first cracked i felt super vulnerable and told my wife that i was questioning my gender identity.

She shuttered in disgust. I was blindsided by how cruel she was. Never expected it for a second. Then the next two questions were about our infant son who wasnt even 12 months at the time. 

"What will our son think of you?"
"What if kids make fun of him in school?"

Flash forward nearly a year, 6 mo on HRT and my son still loves me, nothing has changed with him. I am no longer in a relationship with that sea witch. I have a girlfriend who tells me how beautiful I am every chance she gets. ‚ô•Ô∏è

I'm poor af but life is better. Don't stop yourself from living your truth for someone else. They don't love you, they love the version of you inside their head.']

["Touch starved 
 My (22nb) love language is physical touch. I'm not sure what my partners (22m) love language is. Since our son was born we've had considerably less time for intimacy which is to be expected, and my tolerance for a lack of affection has grown significantly. 

Most of my physical contact day to day is with my son, and obviously that affection is pretty one way. My partner and I will touch a shoulder here and there, maybe holds hands for a couple minutes, but for the most part we're too busy to even think about it. The times I do realize how touch starved I am, and try to initiate some physical affection, my partner is usually very distracted by his phone and only gives me a fraction of his attention. If I ask him to get off, I'll get a few minutes before he pulls away and starts talking about some tik tok, or YouTube video he saw. It's very discouraging and makes me feel like an afterthought. 

I've brought this to his attention multiple times, telling him that I need more focused intimacy, even if it's not for long as long as he's present with me. He tends to argue with me that he gives me plenty of affection but that he'll do more. He doesn't seem to understand that focused affection is so different than an arm over me while he zones out on his phone. It also just feels so crappy to have someone argue the way you feel. 

It's gotten to the point where I feel almost reserved to be touch starved, because I'm tired of the rejection. It's affecting our relationship, and our sex life and I'm just so tired over it.", "He's not a parent. He's a sperm donor. He unilaterally decided not to be a parent, and therefore gets no say about anything regarding the child, including the name.", "Definitely with butter. Otherwise it's just half of a pb&j and that's boring", "Seriously. Especially since a bunch of other people suggested the same thing, but she's only popping off at me for the unwanted advice. And yeah music is stimulating so it's probably not helping baby sleep much better."]

While I might agree about the last one, it's still an extreme convenience to have it.", "Yeah, maybe you're right. No need to go farther, nobody will find the corpses here.", "Is it possible that you realize how much your upbringing affected you only later in life? 
 I hope it's not a stupid question.

I'm 25 and reflecting on the way I feel and react, and how much my upbringing affected me. I'm trying to go deeper in things instead of just taking them for what they are. Now it's time that I know why I am actually afraid of my father, or why I always hid from my roomates.

I've noticed that I'm really sensitive and suffer any kind of scolding, criticisism, anything that has the power of making me feel guilty, ashamed or inferior in some aspect. Sometimes I can't take jokes (but I pretend that I can).

It could be something like a roommate complaining that I leave a hair on the shower, or someone asking me why I parked so far away (meaning that I can't drive)

Deep down I feel like I am scared of people, of the fact that they can hurt me in the aformentioned ways.

Everytime my mother scolds me or even my sister, or everytime she raises her voice, I feel anxiety for the following hours. I also feel a morbid pleasure in telling myself that I will never have a girlfriend because I'm so sensitive and weak. I also feel the instinct to move to a country house and live like a hermit, away from all of these people that want to hurt me.

Is it possible that I realize only later in life that the cause of all this could be neglect or criticisism received when I was an infant? I'm trying to understand if it's because I'm on the spectrum, or if my father is a narcisisst. It's complex man, I don't have the answers."]

["Mod question... 
 Dear FtlGame subreddit...

Which would you say is harder to win?

Captain's Edition on Easy?  Or the standard game on Normal?", 'Mama take this badge from me... What comes after?', "They just do.  It's a fundamental part of particle physics.  Electrons have a negative charge.  Protons are made up of two up and one down quark.  Up quark has a charge of +2/3.  Down quark has -1/3.  So a complete proton has +1.

Sure we could have named the charge on the electron positive and the one on the proton negative but that doesn't change a thing.  They have opposite charges.

And yes they are very different otherwise.  Note that positrons and anti-protons can also exist and those would have positive charge and negative charge respectively.  They are what we call anti-matter.  

Now why is the universe full of matter and not anti-matter?  Figure that one out and you can probably go pick up a Nobel.", "It's easier to set up only encryption between app on the phone and the central server.  But that isn't end to end encryption because the data is unencrypted and re-encrypted on the server."]

["Thanks for the good feedback, I'll keep these changes in mind. I have a multiclass fix planned now which is effectively: <BOLD> this class is incompatible with other casters by nature to prevent that as an issue.

I felt the spellcasting stat might be an issue but I'll have to decide between the value of its theming or making it INT and changing some of the class flavor. I think my current opinion is accepting the natural strength of its spell stat being limited by how seldom it will opt to use spells over arcane rush. You're probably right, but I tend to prefer good flavor making something's balance iffy over neutering the personality of it for balance reasons, at least in DnD.

I personally like mechanics that are unprecedented sometimes, and the unique nature of the heals is what drew me to using it on this class. Keep in mind the heal is 1d4 x arcane rush mod per hit, so at absolute worst you're gonna heal 20hp with your 5th level spell slot in a turn; I don't expect people to miss much with a magic weapon and a +5 to hit. Because of the unique nature of the healing I want its potency to be a little bit situational, and I think it's just my personal preference to have it function this way. Nothing you said about it is wrong, I just enjoy the quirks in it. c:

That's a good point about spell chain. I'll find a way to adjust their damage scaling in response to it.

For rejuvenate, I think it's a DM's job (speaking as someone who DMs) to tell their players to cut that shit out. It's not in the spirit of the game and it's obviously not how it's intended to be used. Also you can only return the spell slot you expended to cast it at most, you can't spam 1st level rushes on rats to get a 5th level back; you'll just replenish the 1st level you used.

I don't think I understand your question about cantrips, but the idea is the nature of their magic (except on  a breaker) cannot be efficiently applied to other people the majority of the time. Their magic is hostile and violent since the whole point is increased martial power, so things like casting water breathing on everyone just isnt thematically correct

Thank you again for the response c:", 'If Horizon 4 is going to have the same base number of races as its predecessor, it needs an actual race creator - not just Horizon Blueprint. 
 I don't have a lot of praise for Playground or T10 because I really don't know them well; they don't communicate with their users <ITALIC> directly and as peers as often as I feel they should, so I'm left to just feeling like I'm playing the product of a studio that's either lazy or crushed by a bi-annual development cycle, so understand I've been left no choice but to make some assumptions. If people have sources to prove something I've claimed about this game or its studio wrong, I am always welcome to be corrected.

Aside from the atrocious instability, extreme lack of structure, lackluster visual customization power compared to other games, and limited online experience personalization in Horizon 3, my biggest take away from it was just genuinely wanting more to do, and when I put that up against my feelings towards the teams behind the game and the criticisms I listed, it means quite a lot that I still really want more of this game - and I'm a self-admitted harsh critic.

Horizon 3 has about 80 total races. Last I counted, it has 13 standard circuits, including the Goliath circuit. That's actually a tiny amount of circuits (and races overall), because 4 of those are all within the same city; one of them, the Skyline View circuit, has strange sloping that forces you to drive over-aggressive or over-defensive and often means losing to the AI where I can otherwise beat them on normal courses on max difficulty, and the Headland and Woodland circuits actually share some track! Moreover, there are no middle-length circuits in Horizon 3. You either get the 1 minute lap quick circuits or the 10 minute lap Goliath circuit, there's no in-between; you have to do a sprint.

The problem with sprints is several share track with each other too! Which, when you consider the size of Horizon 3's world, it's absurd to consider the amount of space on the map you just <ITALIC> never formally race on. You have to get lucky with a head-to-head pathing or a blueprint event which isn't really a proper race to actually try to race on more than the ones covered by the default courses. The street races offer no customization at all, other than loose homologation for your vehicle's class, which means some are <ITALIC> always rainy and some <ITALIC> always aren't, and they're all <ITALIC> always at night. In a game about a very personalized experience, there's a stunning lack of control over your own world!

On top of this, you cannot mirror/reverse any courses - a staple function of racing games that serves as a simple doubling of your race count, to not consider whether or not reversing it counts as a "fully new race."

Other minor complaints as to lack of control is things like not being able to fix a time in free roam, or toggle traffic. I want to grind a drift zone, and it's bad design to make your player fight the rng spawning of vehicles moving in the opposite direction to be able to properly play your game. Other times, I just want a clean, quiet open world to cruise in myself. Set it to night, put traffic to extremely low or off, and truly just enjoy the ride - but I can't do that. A good designer would know to build their game around ideas like that so they wouldn't be difficult to implement, and I find it hard to believe that after 2 iterations of the game prior that this feature hadn't been provided considering the <ITALIC> massive qol increase.

There's just not enough to do. Rivals on sprints is unsatisfying, disjointed, and objectively less rewarding versus circuits unless you want to sit through loading screens every time to get your credits for a failed run, versus going <ITALIC> immediately into another lap on a circuit rivals course. The AI have an extremely sub-optimal driving line on some courses so it's almost impossible to lose even on my max difficulty with no assists, while other times they seem to drive unbelievably well through areas they shouldn't be able to. (Looking at you, Hot Wheels DLC.) Just by providing a way to create my own races, I can at least time trial them myself for the pleasure, or heave a quantity-over-quality race number that means that at the very least the same number of darts will stick and there'll be good, enjoyable courses - because it's very clear that Playground's rigorous playtesting and course creation prcoess was either not rigorous enough, or promptly ignored considering the plethora of issues with the various courses in the game.

Look, whether or not you agree with my assessment of Skyline View or with Headland and Woodland being an issue or my opinions of Playground or any of these things, the larger point is the IMMENSE amount of additional playtime garnered from building a race creation mode that it's just too much to ignore! And fortunately, they don't even have to do the "designing" aspect on their own; it's been done plenty of times before with extreme success: either akin to GTA 5's that lets you place checkpoints across the world with a surprising amount of freedom, or just placing checkpoints on the worldmap (though I would be disappointed if it were that barebones), or even like the arcade kart-racer Modnation Racers that lets you literally sculpt your own tracks and place props around them. The work for Playground is all within building a properly modular and flexible system (which a prideful, ambitious developer would strive to accomplish anyway) because the conceptualization has already been done for them.

If I didn't enjoy the game enough, I just wouldn't make this post or care about the next Horizon game. But I do like Forza's driving a lot; I can't afford a wheel so I play controller, and Forza is the most comfortable game I've found on a controller thus far. I really just can't stress it any more that despite every complaint I've hammered on this game for for the past 5 thousand characters, I enjoyed it enough to <ITALIC> want this much more content. The unharnessed potential of the Horizon franchise is by far the most tragic part of it (to me!) and I would be so much more accepting of its other flaws if it <ITALIC> truly gave me a "Playground" to work in, so to speak. ;P

['Oooh I used to have a hime style cut back when I had long hair! Personally I tended to round brush dry the fringe because my curls there looked a little silly to me at the time, but I left my length & the face framing locks curly & I thought it was really cute! Wish I could find any photos of it down... one tip, though: make sure to cut the face framing locks so that they are chin length when dry & curly, rather than wet & straight. I made that mistake once & wound up straightening those bits for a few months while it grew out because it looked very unflattering to my face when the dried so short.', 'I find just going fucking ham with eyeshadow works well. I especially like smudged very bright or very dark eyeshadow with smoked out eyeliner for a look that‚Äôs very statement & very art-like? Rather than being about beautification.', 'Rainbow hair high five! I‚Äôve been dying my hair for like fifteen years, but this is my first rainbow & I Love It. Definitely have been getting more random compliments out in public, which feels nice. Thank you!', "I'm also 27 & had previously only ever dated men, because, as you said, that's just how it worked out. The only time I'd kissed girls on were my very platonic friends on dares in middle school. But I've known since I was like 14 that I was pan/bi. My crushes just never worked out because they were either straight or taken. I was absolutely terrified that while I love girls & imagine myself eventually marrying one, none would ever want to date me because I had zero experience with anyone other than cis men & I am demisexual. 

Last year I started using OkCupid as sort of a joke, as a way to support my best friend who had just gotten out of a long term, abusive relationship & was looking to start dating again. I mostly wound up talking with men & even dated a couple for short times, but I also talked to a few really cool women & even though those didn't go anywhere, it was a good experience.

Two months ago I got a message from an awesome feminine-leaning genderqueer person & things instantly clicked. We have so much in common & get on so well & she's adorable & funny & talented & smart & just!!! I spent the first month of us dating terrified that she was just interested in me platonically, but since then, we've kissed & she's told me she's referred to me as her girlfriend to other people. We're taking things super slow because of my newness to everything & my demisexuality & it honestly feels so comfortable, with absolutely no pressure. 

The point of my story being, I've 100% been exactly where you are & somehow just recently wound up with an amazing girlfriend who respects my boundaries & makes me feel incredibly happy & comfortable. & if it can happen for me, the oblivious socially awkward disaster, it can totally happen for you. I'd recommend checking out OkCupid. You have to wade through a lot of nonsense, but there's way less of it than you're going to get on Tinder. Plus you can't send photos on OkCupid's messenger, so no surprise dick pics. They also recently changed things so you only see messages from mutual likes, which will also cut down on the weird people contacting you. Just like, put some feelers out there & try to relax & take your mind off it & let the universe do it's thing. Someone awesome is going to find you!"]

['I found a planet with cute little swarming bugs. Managed to snap one in front of my floatycar. : )', 'It feels so perfect! Forgot how my face felt after 14 years of that hell... I know your struggle.

Hang in there! I hope your appointment goes well.', 'Talking to a cis friend from high school about how adult transition is like second puberty.', 'I totally had an image of the cool guy I was going to be. 
I especially felt like I could somehow be a "better" guy because of my different perspective on gender. More empathy, better listener... Things like that.

I guess to be more to the point, yeah, I thought it would be easy to just be a guy. Try to be a good one. People would certainly welcome me that way.
When that identity didn't sit with me despite trying. I called myself genderqueer for quite a while.

Being genderqueer or non-binary is a super awesome consideration, actually. I'm kind of sad I forgot to mention it earlier!']

['Some people arent in a position in their lives where they can just quit their jobs', ':) actually a fucking great idea to save money', "I know, I can't help but feel bad about it any way. Thanks for the reply.", 'I'm asking for support and stories. 
 Hi! I'm suppose I'm just asking for some support. I keep thinking about calling or showing up to a place to get therapy for gender dysphoria so that I can possibly start hormones (testosterone).

I'm just terrified that I will go on it and I will hate how my body has changed or hate how I look all of a sudden. 

I'm AFAB and identify as trans masculine. I like my vagina, which I'm not sure if that's common or not or if it makes me "less trans"(?) Or anything like that. Idk. I'm not out yet, BTW. 

I'm not super dysphoric about much besides my chest. If I were to wear a bra, I would be a cup size DD. I really, really dont ever want to wear anything besides a binder ever again, if I could never get top surgery. Top surgery would be ideal but I feel like I'm unsure about it? Like, idk if I'll like how my nipples look or if I'll be happy with what I can to cant feel.

Anywho, to get to the point, I'm just not sure I want to even bring up gender dysphoria to a gender therapist. I'm afraid I'm just convincing myself that I'm trans and not actually female, (even though that sounds silly when I read it again). 

I feel man-ish. I do not feel female. But I think about it sometimes, and I think im getting my body image in the way of my gender image. I'm seeing my body and gender as one thing, and that's what I want it to be. It's really hard for me to distinguish what are my feelings about my body and what are my feelings about my gender.

So I guess I'm just asking for some support. If yall could share stories about how your lives improved after seeing a gender therapist or after starting hormones that made you feel more confident, I would really appreciate it.

Also, I've been talking about a potential name for myself and scoping it out with some of my friends and they all say stuff like, "can you imagine how terrible it would be to have a name like that?" Or they think it's hilarious that that's even a name. (Samwise. It's what I would have been named had I been born a boy (yes it's from LOTR, my parents are diehard fans)). Its really kind of hurting my self esteem in that because I was really really happy with it. I was even calling myself that in my head. What should I do? Now that I know all my friends think it's a stupid name, I'm worried about choosing it. Idk. Anyone have any similar circumstances?

Thanks!!']

["Never said he didn't, but it wasn't the OPs right to tell him. She could have easily caused a divorce, so yes. Shes a on the verge of being a homewrecker.

Now, is it a lie, or a secret? Because lets be real. Not mentioning a family you up and left is 100% a big deal. But there was absolutely NOWHERE in this post stating she lied to the husband about it.

Again, she should have addressed her mother. She involved someone who didn't need to be because she wanted to ruin her mothers happiness due to resentments.

Letting her think shes the victim is only going to encourage further destructive behaviors. Shes the asshole, her moms a terrible parent to her, and the dad has every right to say what the fuck, karen?

So, ESH. I'm not gonna give her a gold star just because mom ditched her. Shes still a grown woman and knew that dropping a bomb like that was gonna stir someones drama pot, and look what it did? Further damaged her already tattered relationship with her mother.

And so what? Her mom picked up. Maybe her dad was abusive towards her mom? We don't know that information, so we can't formally judge the level of asshole she is. At least shes being a mom now. Im more than aware of the absolute weight of the feeling of abandonment. I have 1 sibling i grew up with and my mom had 2 kids with her new husband, plus i acquired 4 older step brothers, so it was easy to feel forgotten. My mom left that abusive marriage, and has been grinding as a single mom to the two that are my blood. 

I didn't see her a majority of my childhood. I didn't meet my sister until she was a year and a half old. I talked to my mom/saw her, twice, in a matter of 8 years. Now were super close but i hold a lot of those resentments as close and not so fond reminders of the fact that she chose drugs and an asshole over me. 

So i identify with the OP. Trust me. But i won't support childish drama. 

Way to go, OP. You're never going to get closure if you keep acting like this. If you want to hash shit out with her, grow a pair and talk to her. Im so grateful to be able to spend time with my younger siblings, and you know, if they're her kids they're your siblings too. 

Its a matter of what you want from her. 
Do you want a relationship or do you want to disturb her happiness? And if you want her happiness, you might have to just accept that you might not be a part of it.", 'The website is confusing.  Unrelated to anything about sexuality or identity. She broke things off with me, I agreed I wasn't healthy for her at the moment and that I had my own emotional issues I needed to work on. 

I'll be leaving this sub (not that I contributed a whole lot) but I'll miss reading and relating.", 'So... Threesomes? 
 BF (M23) and I (M23) recently had a very deep and detailed conversation. We brought up topics and ideas and kinks neither of us would've just brought up on our own. It led to a lot of future plans and some relieved secret feelings and interests coming out. All in all, a very good and surprising thing. 

One thing that surprised us both is a mutual interest in a threesome. Both of us are Bi, both of us have pretty high libido and are both open to sexual ideas, but I don't think either of us expected to hear the other say "threesome" out loud.

So. Both of us want to potentially add in a third person, man or woman (or an open minded NB person) so long as they are sane and relatively pleasant. The issue is... We have no idea how to find someone. Sure, there's grindr for a guy if we end up going that way, but it's kinda weird using that app (I know from experience). 

Is there any resource or method we can go about finding a man or woman (Women will likely be harder tbh) that would be interested in joining. Asking our more "open" friends would probably not go through, but it isn't out of the realm of possibility.']

['Just long enough for a Legion to Powershot you.', 'Pre-nerf it was possible by using the splash glitch from hitscan rounds, but it‚Äôs not possible anymore.', 'I agree, man, it‚Äôs sad to see a post in a labor skills subreddit complaining about having to work.  What happened to being so proud of being welders?

I work in a gravel quarry and we weren‚Äôt sure we‚Äôd be considered essential.  I was planning out some stuff around the house that I needed to get done just in case, but we got the go ahead and I smiled and went to work the next day to earn my check. 

We were all offered unemployment and PTO if we didn‚Äôt feel safe, but everyone here said they wanted to keep working.   I was very proud of our guys and I was right there there with them. 

Who knows what our country will look like in another generation if people who are usually so proud to post their jobs are now sitting around complaining that they have to work to earn their money.', 'And now back to your regularly scheduled Monarch hate.']

['It‚Äôs not as big as some people‚Äôs collections, but I‚Äôm pretty proud of my Digimon shelf!', '[Request] Very warm coats without polyester outer layers 
 Hi all,

I looked through the coat recommendations on this subreddit, but I‚Äôm very picky, and when I looked up most of them they looked like they had polyester outers, like they might not be appropriate for very cold weather, or they don‚Äôt come in my size (I‚Äôm morbidly obese, usually XXL.)

My hatred of polyester outers is intense enough that I‚Äôve spent much of my life so far wearing two sweaters and an autumnal coat instead of the puffy winter coats that are normal where I live (where it sometimes gets -20 degrees F or colder.) Unfortunately, these coats get shredded and I have to buy a new one every year. And I‚Äôm cold all winter.

It‚Äôs not a moral thing - it can have a polyester inner lining or polyfill. I just hate polyester outers. When the arms rub the body as you walk, it makes such a horrid sound. I can‚Äôt stand it. 

TL;DR - my budget is a flexible 250$ (I‚Äôll go up to 300$ if it‚Äôs truly BIFL), my size is XXL, the temperature where I live during winter gets to -20 F, and I can‚Äôt stand polyester (or nylon) outers. Is there any sturdy, long-lasting coat out there for me?', 'And there you have another prime example of ‚Äúeveryone in America has wildly different definitions of things‚Äù, given that people in my hometown call me a radical leftist communist :V

(For what it‚Äôs worth: I don‚Äôt believe in private healthcare in that I think it‚Äôs a good thing. I believe in private healthcare because in many nations, when the public has turned against transgender people, private healthcare is all we‚Äôve had left, or all that‚Äôs been available to anyone who doesn‚Äôt fit the ‚Äútrue transsexual‚Äù mold. Today I see a doctor who isn‚Äôt covered by my private insurance plan; it‚Äôs very unlikely she would be part of a public healthcare system either. I believe she should continue to be in operations. A lot of my friends in nations with public healthcare still see private doctors to transition. Of course ideally a public system handles everything, but it‚Äôs only natural it will fail a lot of very vulnerable people, and it‚Äôs better to have something, even something ugly and bad, than to have those people be SOL. 

Private healthcare exists outside societal morality, which is bad when society behaves in an ethical matter but good when society‚Äôs behavior is completely aberrant. If the government provides a robust and valuable public healthcare system, private healthcare is likely to whither away anyways, but there should be nothing legally preventing it from existing.)', 'It‚Äôs a short story, not a book, but the recently-published Taylor Johnson‚Äôs Lightning Man is excellent; not particularly fluffy, but not overly grim, though it deals with some difficult topics: <LINK>']

['You were raped. You did not consent (gave a clear ‚Äúno‚Äù). And even if you hadn‚Äôt clearly said ‚Äúno,‚Äù the lack of an enthusiastic/willing/non-coerced ‚Äúyes‚Äù is still not consent.

Please leave her, stay with trusted friends/family. File a police report if that‚Äôs the course of action you wish to take. She violated you and deserves punishment for that.', 'I have depression, anxiety, and I feel I may have another MI but do not want to be quick to self-diagnose (I've done quite a bit of research to be sure). 

Anyway... keeping myself emotionally stable? It's almost unheard of for me. I reach such low lows that I couldn't care about myself even the tiniest bit, which means I don't eat, I don't move, I don't shower, I don't drink water... This can last for a few hours or days but never weeks as my moods fluctuate frequently and it's pretty black and white.

I even make a point of refusing to care for myself when I'm suicidal, so this goes beyond the "I simply do not have the energy and I don't really care" to "I am not worthy of being healthy or happy. I deserve to suffer." I guess it's safe to say that my illnesses have completely taken over, and the only things stopping me from suicide when I'm suicidal are my anxiety, my 7 month old kitten Arya (after Arya Stark, of course), and the thought of devastating my family and longtime boyfriend.', 'Back in 7th/8th grade (mostly 7th), my depression had really set in. My best friend had moved to Colorado, I wasn't good at making new friends, and I was incredibly self-conscious of my appearance, both body and face. I also have an underbite, and at the time my teeth were still really crooked and shit.

Well, I was bullied/verbally harassed because of it. I was called many names, but the ones that stand out are "banana face", "long jaw", "big chin", and, of course, "what is wrong with your face?"

There certainly were some more backhanded comments and names hurled my way. For an insecure, lost, depressed, and confused adolescent, those words/names cut hard and, unfortunately, still affect me to this day.

Thankfully, I now have a wonderful boyfriend who reassures me of my beauty. :')', 'I think my cat Arya is pretty cool... but she owns me.', 'Your first sentence is actually my partner‚Äôs approach lol. She was like ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt give a fuck anymore, make a post about how you‚Äôre so happy our baby has two wonderful moms and see what they have to say!‚Äù (not verbatim)

But yeah. I‚Äôm struggling with just waiting it out because I‚Äôve been wanting to cut them off for years, and now that I have a child it‚Äôs all the more apparent to me that I hate them. I don‚Äôt want there to be even a smidgen of a chance of influencing my son.']

['Matching my exosuit to my starship in the Beyond : )', 'MtF HRT and drinking 
 I've been on HRT for a year now, give or take. Before I started I was moderately abusive with alcohol for a few years... For the obvious reason...

After a few weeks on HRT my urge to drink disappeared almost completely. I still drink occasionally but when I do it seems like my tolerance for the stuff has dropped significantly. I get to a certain point where I know I have to stop... whereas in the past I remember absolutely swilling drink after drink.
Also the taste of beer in particular seems to have changed to me. It's not nearly as enjoyable as it was. I don't wanna go all, "beer is for boys" cause I know that's ridiculous. I just think maybe HRT has coincidentally changed my taste buds a little. Or maybe just cutting back on drinking is responsible for all of it.

Just wondering if anyone else has been through a similar situation? Or if HRT can create this effect?', 'Gawd. If only they could cover my regular bills as well. lol', "Came from my new vet's office. One of the techs is a trans guy, so yeah."]

People are open about struggles and everyone is there to help.', "Well I just recently started finding out that a lot of the problems I have are symptoms; it's difficult to express because it's a long list of little and nuanced things, but I have thought about how to express it. 

I cope by avoidance and its absolutely ruining my life. Its difficult to express though because from the outside I look like I have it together- I just graduated college with a 3.9 GPA, have a job where I can generally stay on top of things, etc. But those things have only happened with immense amounts of frustration and effort to focus and actually start and finish projects. 
But the avoidance runs into my emotional and relational self and leaves me feeling extremely inadequate and like I am never living u pto my potential in ant area of my life. Like I am doing well academically and work wise, but only with immense effort that exhausts me emotionally and mentally and makes me a worse person. 
I also smoke weed, but only because I know I enjoy uppers too much to dabble in them. 
I occassionally take adderall that my prescribed friend gives me, but only one day a week, if that. Those days I feel like I am not fighting myself all day. 
But yes, even those days that I do feel good, I feel the shame of needing a drug to be productive. I have gotten through school well, why can I not just keep going on? Why can't I channel that same determination? I almost feel an obligation to get through without medication because I have in the past.", "It was not as bad as I expected it to be. The advice of everyone here was extremely helpful actually. 

The viewing was about 10 people in a small room. He looked very different from his living self but my grandma broke the ice about it so I dont think anyone felt awkward about noticing that. I did feel kind of guilty for not crying at first but actually very few of the people who came did cry. I said some nice things about him to my grandmother (his wife) and hugged her a lot. 

The funeral was kind of worse- he was a multi millionaire and a lot of his family was there to see what they could get not that he is dead. But there were also a lot of sweet people who had lovely things to say about my grandfather and there was a lot of joy and laughter.

Really though, your advice here was so helpful in making me feel at least somewhat prepared for the viewing. I didn't want to go in with anxiety when I was there to reminisce and support my grandmother. So thank you ‚ù§"]

['I (22F) just found out my estranged long lost father's phone number, should I call him? 
 I grew up thinking that my dad was dead (family gave me the name of my mom's good friend who she took care of because he was sick as being my "Father"). I was told at age 18 that that was a lie, that he wasn't dead, and that he was actually an abusive drug addict so my mom shut him out of her life, though a lot of other people have said he's a nice person. He wanted to be involved.

I hired a private investigator but dead ends, and talking to nasty relatives who didn't want to speak to me.

Today, 5 years later, I decided to look again... and I found... a lot. Phone numbers, current (supposedly) address, email, work history. I had never found anything before.

I'm wondering if I should write a letter explaining everything... but I'm also mildly afraid he will flip and take a plane to NY from FL and kill my family, idk. 

Should I call instead? I really want to speak to him.', 'I feel like a doormat because she constantly tells me that I‚Äôm a bad friend and that I‚Äôm selfish and I‚Äôm questioning if it‚Äôs true or if she‚Äôs blowing things out of proportion. I know that she‚Äôs a little bit right but I also feel like she‚Äôs kind of toxic in some ways', 'Am I giving up on teaching too soon? 
 I (22F) am in my 1st semester of a teaching (7-12 English) graduate program. I was an English major/education minor. I've always loved editing and writing. But I hated my education classes. I decided to go into teaching because I didn't know what else to do. Fast forward...

I enjoyed my hands-on fieldwork at two writing camps this summer but I understand that's very different from the actual classroom. I did two mini lessons that didn‚Äôt go great.

I have anxiety, I don‚Äôt like the same thing over and over again, and I‚Äôm impatient. I also don‚Äôt think teachers value mechanics based on what I‚Äôve been taught in my grad program.

I've visited classes since and have counted down the minutes. Today I cried on my way to my classroom visit because I feel trapped in this program. I cried during it because I didn't feel right. Before I had to present the bell rang. And then I thought, as I left, "This isn't for me. This is a waste of time and money" ... when I looked up, I saw "111" twice on a room, and usually that number (to me) symbolizes being on the right path/train of thought.

I can drop out by tomorrow and apply to masters programs elsewhere on account of mental health reasons (which is a part of this, too). But I have a lease in the town I go to school so I'd be working a menial job for a year. Should I drop out? Does it get better?



TLDR; 1st semester in grad school and my gut feeling is/has been telling me not to be a teacher but I have a lease here, and can drop out by tomorrow with a potential full refund, should I do it?', "<QUOTE>

['It‚Äôs one of those topics which are daunting to research/understand isn‚Äôt it? I‚Äôm glad this AMA can help you out in your decision :) 

Even with all the points listed below (along with my many post operative complications) I can confidently say that I don‚Äôt have a single regret in getting the procedure done. It was medically necessary for me and was my last resort option after attempting all other treatment options for my hypothyroidism/ PCOS/metabolic syndrome/fructose malabsorption. 

Eating food: 

1) the first thing you need to know about eating food and being able to tolerate it well is to FOLLOW YOUR SURGEON/DIETICIANS INSTRUCTIONS RELIGIOUSLY! sorry for the caps lock on that one but it is so damn important and something that most people who don‚Äôt have long term success with this surgery fail to do. Never be afraid to call them if you are concerned about how the food is sitting or how your body is reacting to what you consume. 

2) During the first 8 weeks after surgery, take any food or fluid intake slowly yet regularly - you need to get a solid sense of your new stomach (post-ops call it the pouch) and learn what your bodily signal is for fullness.  For me, my signal of fullness is that my nose will run slightly and I will yawn or sigh mid meal. If I eat too much I will start to feel incredibly u comfortable and ill. Doing this will save you ALOT of heartache and discomfort in the future since the RNY bypass is a kinda permanent change to your body. 

3) The only time you will need to worry about food getting stuck is if you don‚Äôt chew the food thoroughly. I was told that I needed to chew my food until it was the consistency of apple sauce. That being said, there are some foods i just refuse to eat because I am scared of it getting stuck or know I wouldn‚Äôt chew properly (for example: gum & calamari)

4) know what your go to ‚Äòsafe foods‚Äô are because these will make those times when you have illnesses like the flu or some general nausea so much easier. For example, mine is ALDI chicken stock cubes in a mug of water or steamed veggies. 

Vomiting:

1) I do not vomit normally, I don‚Äôt know if this is the same for everyone or just me but it is more like a bird regurgitating. The sounds you make are like an awful frog croaking loudly in a drain pipe combined with the usual dry reaching sound. Sometimes it can take long enough where I have had a bit of blood come out in my vomit. That being said, it is incredibly rare (as in I can count on one hand over the past 6 years) to have acid in the vomit. 

2) vomiting itself is not a regular occurrence by regular standards, if anything you will just have intense nausea and probably have whatever is making you nauseous come out the other end rather rapidly if you know what I mean. 

Blockages:

1) if you chew your food to the correct consistency you won‚Äôt really have to worry about blockages all that much after the first 6-12 months. 

2) Strictures are something to be mindful of in the first 6 months - this is when the joins in the bypass heal a little too well and reduce the diameter of the intestinal passage around the joins in bypass. I had this about 6 times but it isn‚Äôt a big hassle to fix, mine were treated with an endoscope and special inflatable balloon to stretch out the structure while I was under a twilight anaesthetic. Each procedure took around 2 hours including prep time and post procedure anaesthetic wear off time. (Sorry for the lack of technical terms, as I said in disclaimer I‚Äôm not a medical professional but sharing my personal experiences as a patient of the procedure) 

3) Should you ever feel like something doesn‚Äôt feel right in your bypass then as always, call your surgeon and let them check it out. Most surgeons will offer post operative care/support for some period of time. 

4) as with any procedure, complications can happen but your surgeon will explain all of them in detail during your consult and before the surgery is performed. If a complication happens, it will be treated and you should ask any questions you feel like asking for your peace of mind.

Sorry for the long wait on my response, had a busy day and wanted to make sure I gave you a information filled answer :) 

<BOLD-ITALIC> EDIT: added apologies to end of reply for delay in posting my response', 'Long story short, there is no guaranteed painless suicide method. It is highly likely you will survive an attempt and any method used will cause permanent damage which will make life even more painful to live through. 

I did month of research on this, the best way to stop feeling the emotional/psychological pain is getting therapy for whatever is at the root cause of your pain. It‚Äôs not an easy path but the bravest thing you can do for yourself - you are worthy of feeling okay with life! 

You don‚Äôt need to feel happy all the time (or even most of the time) but you are worthy enough to allow yourself to not feel pain all the time.', 'That one I didn‚Äôt know!! Always wondered what to do with the fire quartz lol', 'I think the wheat crop has a chance to produce hay but best to check stardew valley wiki on that one.']

['It looks like doomed might win you guys!!', 'Right?? I honestly had to skip the part at the end with May. Just not something I can stomach right now', "Things I didn't notice about victorious when I first watched it (not the adult jokes) 
 So I'm a huge fan of victorious. Watched it a lot because I was at an age where I got a lot of the subtext and adult themes and just found the show to be overall hilarious and filled with a talented cast.
I was at an age where I noticed the a lot of the adult themes and jokes in the show. I was always super convinced that Jade and Tori had feelings for each other and was able to read between the lines with a lot of jokes that weren't geared towards the younger viewers.
But I've been rewatching it lately and there are some things that didn't stick out to me before.. 
I've noticed there's a lot of Asian stereotypes or just jokes that haven't seemed to age well since 2010-2013. I also noticed there was a lot of people kissing each other or doing strange things without their consent and then adding a laughing track like it's hilarious. I also noticed that Tori's parents were very neglectful and careless when it came to supporting their daughters. 
Obviously this was a different time and I didn't notice a lot of it back then but it's definitely sticking out to me now! Still love the show and all the songs but some of the scenes just hit different now is all! Anybody else feel this way?", 'Thank you so much! (Also I think people in germany are more chill about alternative fashion, since the punk/goth scene here is pretty big, even many adults are still goths and work normal jobs, I think were like... desensitized)", 'Im also a student! but Im from Germany, and here you can use public transit to go practically everywhere', 'Oh, I forget to answer one of your Questions: I get most of my dresses from <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', '(Rant) This Sub is for all Pagan religions 
 This Sub should be for all Pagan religions, teachings and practices.

Yet I see so many posts that addresses everyone on here as "Witches" or "Wiccans" 

I mean there are so many Wiccan subs, why not post there if you're going to address just Witches anyway? 

It makes me (and many of my friends who are on here) just feel left out.

I know that Wicca is the biggest pagan religion out there, so most posts here will be about Wicca.
But it's still annoying to see everyone here addressed as Witches, or when Wicca specific questions are asked that have nothing to do with other Pagan Religions and thus can only be answered by other Witches. 
If other Religions get mentioned, they're always mentioned as kind of an afterthought.

It really bothers me, it makes me feel bad for not being a Witch, like I'm not part of this community.

So if you have a Question that only other Witches can answer, and has absolutely nothing to do with other Pagan religions please post them in a Wicca subreddit.
And stop addressing everyone in here as Witches or Wiccans. 

Thank you.']

['I'm pretty certain Oscar's name is just a simple Oz reference: the Wizard's real name is "Oscar Diggs".

On Tip, that's a retcon. The Marvelous Land of Oz makes it clear that the Wizard usurped the throne from King Pastoria, stole his daughter, gave her to a witch that he taught, and had Ozma raised as a farmboy. L. Frank Baum apparently didn't realize that this made the Wizard into a totally terrible person and subsequently tried to retcon it. According to the fourth book (iirc), the Wizard has apparently never even <ITALIC> met Ozma.', "Why are some pets get allergic to meat? 
 I've heard about cats, dogs, and ferrets who are allergic to specific types of meat like chicken or beef. How come? That's an exceedingly rare human allergy yet is common in pets.", 'I wish the series would make their religions more in-depth 
 The first time we have any clear references to gods, besides a few characters saying "oh my God", and it gets largely sweeped under the rug. We know that the Brothers exist but we don't know much about their religion or any other religion on Remnant. 

How widely are the Brothers worshipped? What are their religious practices? Did any of the characters believe in them? How did the characters react to learning that the Brothers were proven fact? None of these are specified.

Fantasy religion isn't hard to make up and it adds a lot of fleshing out to fantasy worlds. I've seen it even in kid's works like Warriors Cats and Survivor Dogs, even in Pokemon to a degree.

I've seen interesting versions of religion in a few fan-works I follow:

- In "Let Us Be Your Poison", Weiss is a worshipper of  the "Faith of Decum Luna," which is a religion practiced in Atlas. It consists of ten gods and Atlasian families believe that one of the gods watchs over them. Families only marry into families who have the same religious beliefs as them. Weiss' family defied this belief, which gives her internalized angst. There are also some other religions like the "True Faith of Vale "and "Mistran Gods of Arillystos".
- In "RWBY Scars" there are three main religions: Dustism, the Brothers Church, and Ishvara. Dustists worship Dust, the Brothers Church worships the Two Brothers, and Faunus worship Mother Devi. You also have more fringe religions like how the Branwen tribe worship the Feathered One (which is a giant bird) and there's a cult dedicated to Salem. The characters are shown to be varying degrees of religious such as the atheistic Yang and Nora (though Nora later becomes theistic), Brothers worshipping Qrow and Summer, Ishvara worshipping Blake, and Dust worshipping Weiss.
- "RWBY Alternate" is a concept instead of a fic. Most people worship the moon (which they refer to as "Ani") due to dust coming from the moon. The original religion is called "Anicism"  and they believe that the Grimm are the children of Ani. Avanists, however, believe that humans are the children of Ani and that Grimm should be killed. There's also a cult of Grimm worshippers who believe that Ani was killed during the Fall and that two Grimm called the "Brother Grimm" are the new gods.', 'I want a HGSS-style DPPt remake, not an ORAS one 
 I liked ORAS. It was a good game. But, it was also very deviant from the original. The character designers, characterization, and plot were all tweaked to go with the "alternate universe" element.

I prefer more true-to-the-original remakes like the DPPt remake. I think HGSS was the best remake in that regard-- it isn't as nearly as true as FRLG, but it isn't as deviant as ORAS either. It changed enough without changing too much.

Ten bucks we get a Let's Go style remake, though.', "I seem to be in a constant flow of panic for no real reason. I don't feel nervous but my blood pressure is often 150-175, instead of a normal 100-120. My heart beats all the time too.

Listening to music, playing video games, exercising, and relaxing helps, but I think the best thing I could do is see a therapist."]

['Hey, my middle name is Anthony! My grandmother chose it. So, +5 for Anthony!', "This BS is Starting Another War, and I'm Afraid It's Going to Win 
 The BPD hasn't been a big issue since I was 18, almost 19, and I'm 22. I did pretty intensive DBT for about two years. It kept the major issues with the BPD in check. The other shit came to be a bigger problem.

My poor boyfriend is taking the brunt of it. I'm trying to tell it to shut the hell up, to not let it get in the way. LDR, seven hours behind, so the timing is weird. He's still around, still in the video call. Just muted to play shit on Steam in TeamSpeak with other friends. That's okay. I understand.

I get frustrated because he doesn't fucking tell me when he's going and just mutes suddenly sometimes, but he does pop in to tell me he loves me or ask if I'm okay if he can see that I look upset or unhappy in the video call. 

Even as I'm typing this, he popped into to tell me he loved me. It's not like he's not watching. It's just been one of those days where he's been away from 9-10 hours without telling me that he was muting. I came back from getting food to take meds, and he was on TeamSpeak.

I know I'm a handful with this, four other disorders, and two ridiculous phobias.
 
He's a sweetheart‚Äîincredibly loving, patient. He deals with my dumbass in the morning, wakes me up when my alarm doesn't to make sure I'm not late for class and motivates me to go when the depressive cycles are bad. He's there for every manic episode, breakdown, every anxiety attack, every anything that he can be, and if he finds out later that he wasn't there, he apologizes and says he wishes he was despite that not being his fault.

He's a wonderful man. Yes, there is a bit of fault on his end, but it's mostly me. 

This is mostly a rant about being 1000% done with this and being pissed that it's becoming an issue again. Getting into a DBT group or seeing a DBT therapist again is unlikely. I'll have to work on it myself, but it only resurfaced because of the external stressors and all of the other shit I have to do with school, finding a job, mental health management. I'm tired. He's got to be tired despite denying it. Fucking hell.", "Fuck emetophobia. For real. Still can't eat scallops or at 54th Street anymore. 54th Street was one of my favorite restaurants, too. :/ Same reason I avoid Gatorade like the plague. Even seeing it makes me uncomfortable. Especially the white Gatorade. I really liked that flavor, too.", 'Bruh, that was my first thought. One of our common hosts is a AFAB transman, and he's always like, "OH MY GOD, BUT WHAT IF-"

Like... Jamie, chill. xD']

Thanks for doing this giveaway!', 'Hello! I‚Äôm a third year student of Kinesiology (the study of the human body, specifically movement)! 

How it works is that you can‚Äôt control where you lose fat, you can at least direct where you gain muscle. If you exercise your arms more than your legs, it will seem like fat is coming off your arms faster because of the work. What you‚Äôre actually seeing is increased muscle tone in that area! Areas with a higher ratio of fat (e.g. often the stomach (especially in people with female anatomy since the uterus sits within the pouch on the lower abdomen), upper thighs, and under chin) will take longer to show results than places that started with a lower ratio of fat (often the calves and upper arms). However, you also want to make sure that you work all muscle groups in your body in order to prevent atrophy (break down) as well as to maintain bone strength.', 'Thanks!
