['Untangling knots, I can do it in seconds but that means everyone around me loves to hand me tangled earphones or knotted necklaces.', "Passed some of my final exams in school while my dad was dying of lung cancer and pneumonia(thankfully, he survived this time). Spent most of my days studying in his hospital room while he slept, still managed to show up to classes and spent my 16th birthday in hospital with him. I showed up to my final drama exam the day after I was told he had two weeks to live and sat in exam halls for all the rest of my exams (13 total) not knowing if he would still be alive by the time I left.

Managed to get 5 As and 3 Bs in the end, as well as getting 100% on one of my exams.

Toughest thing I've ever done, I don't know how I managed to keep going this whole time but it helps me remember how strong I really am whenever I'm struggling with anything.", 'Holy shit, I can take paracetamol for physical AND existential headaches??', 'Yes. when I started a new school with my best friend girls and guys from older years would come up to her and tell her how pretty she was (and she is, she's gorgeous) while I stood next to her either being ignored or, in some cases, being told "oh, and you're fine too". I was only about 12 when this was happening and gave me some pretty gnarly insecurities for years.

Edit: typo']

['ELI5: Why do the back wheels of a cart go over a bump easier than the front wheels?', "I can't do this anymore 
 We have been taking care of my father in law for several years. It first started as home visits and as he started getting worse and worse eventually he has ended up living in with us. His dementia is so bad now he doesn't remember who I am despite caring for him for the better part of a decade. He still recognizes my wife, but often thinks she is his mother or cousin. 

We live in the US and can bot afford assisted living. My wife is in school (which is incredibly expensive in it's own right) and I work a job as a technician in a pharmacy making a very modest wage. We have been in the process of applying for government assistance for well over a year, and even after we get it nowhere in our area accepts medicaid for memory care.

I have gone on leave from work. My days are now 16 hours of the exact same 1 hour routine repeated 16 times a day until he either goes to sleep or my wife returns home from class.

My wife will be 26 this year. She didn't ask for this. She hasn't even got her own life started yet. We intentionally haven't had children. She has no other family. She feels bad for not helping more, but especially this week she has midterms and her school has to come first. She has worked way too hard up to this point to have her father take this away from her. 

I am now going in to my third day of no or barely any sleep. My life is a living hell. There is now presumably less than 90 days left of dealing with this, and that is 90 days too long. 

I can't do this anymore. 
I can't do this anymore. 
I can't do this anymore.", "Look at the Pikalytics page for gen 1. It'll give good insight", 'Wanted to buy this ring, but was unsure if the symbol meant anything. Can anyone identify it?']

["Anybody else had this realization? 
 For a lot of my life I've been questioning about my sexuality/gender stuff and I've always ended up denying it after some time thinking about it. I've always come to the conclusion that I probably wouldn't be happy if I were the other gender (MTF if that's relevant).

But now, I realize, it didn't have to do with myself at all. It really all had to do with that I was just worried to the point of repression how my family would react and how our relationships would change. I'm very close with my family, much more so than with friends, and if something were to change there, I would be very unhappy and disappointed in myself for making that happen (by me being trans).

Now picturing myself and if I could just completely start over, I would absolutely be the other gender, but obviously I can't just do that so I don't know how to deal with that...

My bad.

Also yes, he was part of a band, which makes me wish they released a Yugioh 5D's character song album, or at least got him to sing 1 ending or opening.", "<QUOTE>

If it's worth mentioning, the reason why others, including me, want to run 2 is to almost always guarantee that you can use your Skill to discard Thystvern with and search Sulfefnir.

For reference, the probability of opening <BOLD> all your Crystal Beasts <BOLD> and Thystvern <BOLD> without either Recycler nor Sulfefnir (aka you completely bricked) is as follows:

 | 24 Card Deck (which is what you're running) | 30 Card Deck
---|---|----
Running 1 CB | 2.97% (3.27% going 2nd) | 2.30% (2.81% going 2nd)
Running 2 CB | 0.40% (0.64% going 2nd) | 0.22% (0.40% going 2nd)

As you can see, while it is already quite unlikely with only 1 CB (roughly only every 3/100 games), having a 2nd one greatly reduces the risk of a total brick happening by at least a factor of 5 (i.e. you're at least 5x less likely to brick, so 3/500 instead of 3/100).

Now I'm not really saying running 2 is objectively better because it has lower brick rates, not just because these are only probabilities and do not immediately mean if you brick now you won't brick for another 97 games or something, but also because it comes down to your usage/preference. If you're not really aiming to use it for a gauntlet or something where you need to win consecutively as much as possible (e.g. KC Cup Stage 2), and would rather respond to opposing matchups with more tech options, then running 1 and packing an extra tech card is fine.

Additionally, even with the feared brick hand, it's still possible to summon Ametrix and survive a turn then hopefully draw into Sulfefnir/Recycler the next (summon Thystvern, destroy itself to summon Citree; next turn, use Citree's effect pulling Thystvern and make Ametrix). Who knows, the additional tech card you put in place of the 2nd CB might even cripple your opponent harder than you bricked, doing more good than bad."]

["This one goes out to all the 27-35 year olds that played the original browser version of the game! Y'all know whats up!", 'Some advice I just gave to a fellow single mother on FB who posted a long rant about her "baby daddy"... Figured I'd also pass it along here. 
 <BOLD> Context:  She posted a long, detailed rant about how much she hates her ex and why she hates her ex (mostly because he is a shit father who isn't around much) and I recognized my past self in her post.  Decided to tell her some things I've figured out in my time as a single mother...

<BOLD-ITALIC> <ITALIC> <BOLD-ITALIC> <BOLD-ITALIC> <BOLD> _

<BOLD> My response to her post:

Ugh... Wow. If this isn't me years ago I don't know what is. I used to be angry and hateful and bitter towards my ex because of ALL the reasons you have listed here. The plight of a single mother is a rough story to tell and there's a lot of emotion behind it. But, I'd like to offer you my experience and what I've learned and how I've grown because I see my past self in this post...

First off, know this: Yes, you are your child's hero. She may not show you appreciation for it yet, but she's still a toddler. She's not ready or mentally equipped to understand who is putting more work into her right now. For her, as a toddler, the world is sunshine and unicorns and everyone in this world, including your ex, is merely there to make her smile... But she WILL get older. She WILL start to grasp the inequality in parenting here. 

For example, my daughter went for a visit with my ex two years ago when she was 6. During that visit my ex and his girlfriend were driving somewhere with my daughter in the back seat. They had a car accident. A mostly minor one, but it was scary for my daughter and it bruised her up a bit. Do you know what my ex told me? When they crashed and she was hurt, even though she had her Dad RIGHT THERE, she cried for me. She wanted me to pick her up and save her and make her all better. Why? Because she had become old enough and mature enough to know Dad, who has been absent a lot in her life, wasn't her rock. Dad wasn't the parent that held her when she was sick or cared for her when she got injured. Dad didn't have the magic kisses for boo boos and Dad didn't know her favorite jokes and stories to calm her down... My daughter knew that I HAVE ALWAYS been the one to provide those things. She cried for ME.

So yes, you ARE your daughter's hero and though she may act like her Dad is still the greatest now, as she ages she'll understand and show that YOU are her parent. You are who she needs. He's just a nice little bonus that doesn't know what he's doing half the time due to lack of experience.

Secondly, and this is going to sound really blunt: CALM DOWN! There came a time for me after quite a while of being a single mother that I realized the hate, the myspace and FB posts, the fights, the bitterness... It was all a waste of time and energy.

Fact of the matter is, he chose to leave. Maybe it was entirely his fault, maybe it was your fault, maybe it was both of you... But he has made his choice not to be with you or in your kid's life full time. Let me be the one to tell you, NO AMOUNT OF bitching and moaning or fighting or calling him out or stressed out tears is going to change that and it's all A WASTE OF EFFORT AND ENERGY. 

You have been and are a single mom. Accept it, embrace it, let go of the hate and move forward. I'm not saying this without fault here. You know the "on this day" function here on FB? I look at my old posts and there's always one or two from years ago EVERY DAY bitching about how my ex just wasn't in my daughter's life. You know what I do when I see those now that I've grown and moved past all the anger? I cringe. I honestly can't believe how bitter and enraged I was over something that happens all the time in this world. Many fathers leave, it happens, there's reasons, and we as single mothers have to take on the new duty of accepting it and just doing the best we can without them. It's a lot of work, yes. It's a lot of self sacrifice, yes. But, God Damn It [NAME], take this opportunity to be the best mother you can be all on your own, let go of all the poisonous feelings, embrace your circumstances and just be SUPER MOM. 

You know what will piss your ex off the most in years to come? It will piss him off when you obviously don't care about his choices anymore. It will piss him off that you accept the fact he made a losers and cowards choice. But what will piss him off above all, is that your kid LOVES her MOMMY MORE. That will be his fault, he'll come to that realization, and he'll be the one suffering because of it.

Another example from my situation... My ex has started trying to be more of a father now more than ever and my daughter is nearly 9. Why all of the sudden? I moved on from the hate, I ended up with a great guy, and (without my ex involved most of the time) us three here have a pretty happy family life. My ex sees that his daughter is having a great family life with a strong mother who has done everything and a father figure that is better than him and HE CAN'T STAND IT. My ex and his girlfriend have suddenly demanded that they get my daughter for two weekends every month. Why? Because (and it took him a while) he finally realized HE could have had a kid that adores him and doesn't. He realized that HE could be having family meals and outings and doesn't. It took him years, but he realized that he fucked up, he's missing out, and now he's trying to make up for it...

Let that time come. Let this time pass. Things will be easier and different if you just stop harboring hatred and anger and just accept that he will never fully step up to the plate and if he does, it will be too late because you succeeded in being the calm, rational, super parent that I know you really are. Your ex will realized his mistakes one day and try to change things. When that day comes you just get to sit back and laugh and laugh and laugh because his mistakes can't be erased. 

And my final thoughts: You know how people say, "You just do you."

Seriously [NAME], JUST DO YOU. Be Mom, be [NAME]. Don't be "hateful, bitter, enraged bitch" because I chose to be that for a while and NOBODY liked me for it. Let it all go, accept the way it is, move forward, and JUST DO YOU. Who cares about your ex and his shitty choices? When someone asks where her Dad is the answer should be, "He's not around much" and that's it. People will know just from that how great YOU are and how shitty HE IS.

Alright, I think I'm done here. If I upset you in any way I truly apologize. I just know how agonizing your mind set is right now because I WAS THERE. Just please, either take what I said to heart or disregard it, but please remember... YOU are the hero here. There's no need to be upset because YOU are the better person and you are on high and THAT is all that matters.', "Not an interview, but I quit Goodwill after 3 days for that reason.  Processing clothing is soul crushing.  

They have all these crazy rules.  It may be a hardly used christmas gown for a toddler, but if it has a bow it goes in the trash cause a kid could chew the bow off and choke on it.  Perfect condition hoodie?  If it's smaller than an XL you have to cut the strings off of it because a kid might wear it and strangle themselves.  Does that shirt right there have a button?!?!  Is it a size small or medium?  Trash it, someone might let their kid borrow it.  They'll die.  Very obviously brand new socks?  Not in their original packaging?  Garbage.

I've been homeless before.  Some of the clothes I had to throw away could literally be lifesaving to someone.  But no, send it to the incinerator.

Fuck that.  I quit.", "I think you're assuming too much about how I see the situation and that's totally understandable.  If you ask my SO, I have a knack for not arranging my thoughts and points in the most clear way in relation to how I actually feel.

I'm not saying that all men do this, I'm not saying you need to police the ones that do.  I'm saying that if the opportunity arises, let a guy know that's not the way to strike up a conversation nor is it helpful to men that want to be respected and understood, additionally unhelpful to men that want to end this weird social dumpster fire where men are being mistreated just because they are men.

I apologize for not making this clear.  I just needed to vent my experience here because I definitely see this as detrimental to how men are perceived.

Like you said, the guys who do this have more light on them than the guys who don't.  It sucks because it DOES create a generalization of how women see men.  That breeds a blanket behavior in how men are treated across the board.  It's a shame and I can openly admit I don't know what originally compels any man to open conversations <ITALIC> that way but I wanted to shed light on how it makes me feel because hopefully it starts a dialogue...

Which it certainly has here.  Apologies again for not being organized and direct in my intentions with this post.  Heat of the moment, not enough coffee, whatever the reason...  My bad."]

['I agree with you, though I do think that the story and dialogue could have been written to better separate the two for the audience, such as in volume 5 instead of Weiss saying "there's no such thing as magic", she could have said "Semblances can't alter your body like that" or "There's no way that could be your semblance".

I also think that the show would do well to thematically harden Aura and Semblances- meaning to set down specific rules for how they operate and keep consistent to them. They don't have to actually tell us these rules, of course, just keep things consistent; which is hard to do with the much softer early volumes, which mostly used them as a way to explain the cool stuff that was happening. Going into the future however they could certainly harden things up though, especially considering how important these powers are being for the plot.', "Though dysphoria is a very common effect and problem caused by someone being trans, the two don't have to mutually exist. There are multiple different kinds of dysphoria; social, physical, and emotional. In this case we're mostly talking about physical dysphoria, which is a sense of discomfort caused by a person's body not feeling that it reflects their gender identity.  


Also as mentioned by TheManyDeathsOfYou, there is gender euphoria, which is a feeling of happiness (i.e. euphoria) that someone feels when something does match with their gender identity. This euphoric feeling doesn't have to have a negative counterpart to exist, either.", "\*confused noises\*  
Pretty sure you're lost here; I don't see how this is an egg meme", 'The ubiquity of this problem is staggering and annoying']

['Might not be relevant to you, but my grandad always made his Land Rover available to me and my mum for snow days. Could get through anything that could.

When I finally get my license, I plan on getting an ex-army one. Comes with some quality of life modifications and is usually well maintained.', 'My experience switching to a higher volume program from SS, and returning. 
 Hi there,

I started the SS program in October to aid in the recovery from my bus crash accident in April of last year. Since then, starting strength has had me increase my weights at least double what they were and sometimes trebble. I started with an empty bar and am now managed 60KG on my bench

My progression was slow because I was still screwed up all over from my accident and worked on form with light weights for a month before starting to climb, but took a good few deloads to prevent pain when it appeared in my post op areas.

Come a couple weeks ago, I was persuaded by my weightlifting club at university to try out the Candito powerlifting program. I have to say, that was the worst mistake of my life. Doing the first two weeks at 5 days per week as prescribed, aggravated every injury from my accident and my past rugby injuries.

After this tortuous experience, I am going to return back to Starting Strength good and proper. Starting from day one and take it from there, as Rip says "do the program properly". Although, in contrast to Rip, I am going to do a couple treadmill sessions a week because as a nurse, I feel like doing a little bit of endurance and sprint training may help me respond to emergencies.', "Spam. Ain't met anyone so far that likes spam.", "soon to be Student in need of laptop advice 
 Hey there, 

I am about to become a student at a university and I am looking for a cheap, bang for your buck laptop to get me through my course. I'm looking for a Windows 10 laptop as I currently have a chromebook but its constant need for an online connection is becoming irritating, so I want to switch.

Budget: ¬£300 at a maximum (UK prices if possible).

Studying: Medicine

Any help is appreciated

Ownard

[Edit: Budget was raised. ]"]

["I am non-binary [coming out] 
 I am non-binary, I finally accepted it yesterday. I was so excited that i spent yesterday evening dancing around in my room because i couldn't sit still. I felt so euphoric and i couldnt stop smiling. I have started telling my close friends and it feels so good every single time. I am so fucking happy I can't contain myself. when I start doubting myself again I can always look back to how amazing I felt last night because that wasn't made up in my head.  Anyway that the post, I am so excited to hear someone refer to me with they/them pronouns for the first time lmao.


Edit: I know this is cliche as shit to do but thank you everyone for all the amazing and kind comments. I couldn't sleep so I decided to check Reddit and I was overwhelmed by support so truly thank you all so much", "Fucking 4:17am spinning outta control 
 In the past week I have
Taken 10mg Lorazepam then gone to school, got found out by concerned friend who told a teacher. Teacher called an ambulance cause OD and then I had my psyco emotionally, verbally and previously physically abusive mother storm the emergency waiting room after following the ambulance I was in. When at the hospital I explained everything my mum has done and the fact that my dad is away for a month. Because I'm 16 I don't have the right to choose where I stay once child services decided that I needed to be separated from my mum, my enabling dad got to choose. The family friends he chose are actually good people but I know I will not be comfortable around them due to my lack of control and their connection to my mum thus I have incredible anxiety going back to their place in the afternoon. I have spent the past four days trying not to cry. Luckily my friends have been letting me crash at their places but today I have to go back to my family friends and idk how to get there from my friends house.

Also I forgot my phone charger and I'm on 14%", 'Ok I love Lil Peeps music, like I have an emotional association with it because I found his music when I was going through a really traumatic time in my life. I understand it's not for everyone but you have to remember that this guy was really revolutionary for the emo rap scene. He was unque and talented at what he did. In saying that, it's definitely not for everyone, but if u want to get a good feel for peep listen to the album's "crybaby" and "hellboy". So basically yes there are people who genuinely enjoy his music, I am one of them but I can see why some people wouldn't enjoy it.', "Well I did it, I cut my hair and I could'nt be happier. I feel so much more like myself and so much more confident. I wish I did it sooner"]

['Well, after years and years of fighting myself, I spoke with my therapist today, and have an appointment for a consult with my new doctor! 
 I honestly don't know how to feel. My appointment is in July just to set up as primary care, but I have a follow-up for a consult if I "feel I need it" and my therapist urged me to go ahead. So the consult is in September.

I feel... Weird? Like it's a dream. Like it won't be real tomorrow somehow? I know it's a ways off due to the Covid-19 stuff going on, but I feel an odd mix of ecstatic, peaceful, and afraid. Is this normal? 

Anyways... I did it! So there. The future will come, but for now I've faced my fears and I'm on my way. Wish me luck!', "I did buy mace! I'll make sure to bring it with me. 

Thank you for the advice ‚ù§Ô∏è", 'According to my wife, even cis girls can feel that way. Hoping things get a little clearer for you ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Thank you. I'm at a crossroads where I'm losing one identity, but starting to embrace another. I've just gotten so comfortable being "Peter Priesthood", and I was always taught that being transgender was a perversion with no scientific backing. Well, it has scientific backing. I was born this way. The fact the church has such exclusionary and honestly offensive policies doesn't help. 

I could do everything they expect the women to do, and I'd have been fine with that. Would've relinquished my priesthood, gone to relief society, anything to be NORMAL and accepted... But obviously that's not an option. 

I'm struggling now with knowing I was born this way and doing something to alleviate the inner turmoil with how I was created, and my faith. Starting to realize my faith was false is scary and honestly heart-breaking because it's been so much a part of who I am and was. Finding a new path is unimaginable, but I'm going to have to. And I don't know if I'm ready.']

["I used to put them in a draw in the bathroom because there was no bin until my step dad yelled at me. To this day I don't know why they didn't just put a bin in the bathroom? I know it seems silly and a bit gross that I left them there but I didn't know what to do.", "The mental gymnastics I'm going through right now", 'Yell across the house rather than finding whoever you need to talk to', "23, pregnant, bipolar, and just lost my job. 
 My partner (22M Brazilian on student visa) and I (23F Australian) have been together for two years now and for the most part our relationship has been pretty solid, we had discussed getting married and applying for a relationship visa. Despite that, we were not planning for a child and though we both want to go through with the pregnancy we are really not financially ready for this kind of commitment. 

I am half way through a double degree in psychology and creative writing, but took time off from university when I was diagnosed with type 2 bipolar at the beginning of the year. I got a really good job that was related to my field but since becoming pregnant I have experienced pretty severe nausea, faintness and fatigue that has led to me being late, taking a lot of sick days, and at one point almost falling asleep during a work meeting, and on top of that I had to change some of my medications to be safe for the pregnancy, so my mental health has been pretty poor - all this has resulted in me losing my job. 

My partner works at a bar and is looking for a second job, but there is a limit to how many hours he can work while on a student visa. His parents have offered to help out however they can, including paying the full expense of the relationship visa and to help us put a deposit on a house. 

At the moment my plan is to get whatever job I can over the busy holiday season (I have experience in hospitality and retail), then try to find some kind of work I can do from home, so that the pregnancy will have less of an effect on my capacity to work. My partner is encouraging me to finish my course after we have the baby, and I'm hoping that I can get some kind of freelance writing work, or maybe transcribing, proofreading or translating that I can juggle with uni and taking care of the baby. 

I've read a few books on personal finance and I've tried using various different budgeting apps, but nothing seems to stick. I really need help so that I can be financially ready for this really really big next step in my life, and I don't really know where to start."]

Edit: shipped to 60135 (Chicago area)', 'I announced my bisexuality over social media, just basically said ‚ÄúI like girls too and it isn‚Äôt a phase‚Äù, and my mom is PISSED. 
 My mom. Who always supported gay/bisexual people before. She told me to delete every family member from FB (which I promptly did, because fuck them i guess if they can‚Äôt handle it).

I literally went on a date with a girl today for the first time in forever, and she was livid then too. She said angrily ‚Äúoh so you‚Äôre a LESBIAN NOW?‚Äù

She‚Äôs known I‚Äôm bi since I was 15, 8 years ago, so it‚Äôs not a shock.

She went off on me telling me I was immature for ‚Äúannouncing my private life to everyone‚Äù. She said ‚Äúis nothing sacred‚Äù and there are no other status messages I made that are, well, inflammatory in any way, so I know that my ‚Äúhappy pride, I like girls, it‚Äôs not a phase‚Äù message is the one

I just feel incredibly shit on right now.', "He gets out of rehab in two days. 
 I have \*some\* hope.




He's learned A LOT in there, and he seems to genuinely want to turn his life around. He says he doesn't want to do this again at 35 or 45. And I believe him, although I know that's not necessarily enough to STOP the drinking, but he knows what he has to do. He'll be living in a sober living/halfway house for the next 6+ months.




I'm being CAUTIOUSLY optimistic. People relapse all the time. But people get sober all the time. He kicked heroin. He can kick alcohol too.

['For admission into psych honours they are still looking at the underlying grade of credits you designate as pass/fail in average calculation 
 Got an email back about it today. Rip my dreams

edit// This is does not apply to discovery credits, just credits Western said you could designate as pass or fail due to COVID-19.

edit2// This is from the psychology undergraduate program advisor and is in regards to admission into the program, not progression.', "That's the dream! I will be careful probably, but I do have ear-buds. The headphones would be for school mainly.", ":0 That's my first time hearing that I remind someone of someone else! You are correct, I am ftm :)", "You are already doing great work! I'm glad you are keeping up with good habits and are building your supports. Looking at your other conditions with a trauma history lense may be helpful. I found that my diagnoses did not have lasting improvement until I did that.

I wouldn't say I was completely stable when I started trauma therapy, but I wasn't in a crisis. I managed to keep myself out of the hospital for a year before starting. Physically I was healthy. I sought out a therapist specifically for trauma work. I was motivated to start because I kind of realized a lot of my conditions can be linked to a trauma history, and I was just going to keep doing well for a year and then relapsing if I didn't do something different. 

I am almost a year in but only started seeing benefits 5 months after starting. I'm not sure if that is slow, but I had to juggle school and try not to relapse in my eating disorder (which would be used to divert attention fron the trauma). I had a psychiatrist and a counsellor at school as well.

I don't think I'm perfectly stable, but I don't think I am feeling as bad as I did when I first started. I've been working hard in my various treatments, and find I am responding better to therapy. Right now I am taking a break from trauma therapy to build my supports up again and to get in a better spot with my other diagnoses. It's okay to go slow and take breaks. Trauma therapy doesn't really have a set timeline, especially for cptsd. It is a lot of ongoing work."]

['"I'm not transphobic"

"Trans people are the problem in your world, not society."

Okay pal. \U0001f937‍‚ôÄÔ∏è', "Let's chat: Filters and Photoshop 
 I want to talk a little about filters and photoshopping. I'd like to preface this by saying I'm not here to criticize how anyone chooses to present themselves here. You are valid.

A filter is a preset templated overlay you apply to a photo to alter its appearance. By it's very definition, doing something as simple as adjusting brightness can be considered a filter.

 <BOLD> A photo from a camera is just an interpretation of how you look, it's just taking information in and assembling pixels based on its instructions, the strengths and limitations of its technology, and the environment you are in.

There's nothing wrong with using Photoshop/Snapseed to touch up photos, balance colours, dodge and burn, bringing out highlights and shadows. That information is already in the photo. If you went to get a photo done from a professional, they would do the same thing. I've never met a photographer willing to give their unedited raw photos to a client without a large price tag attached.

Over my years as a graphic designer and a photographer, this is one thing that I've learned. People really underestimate what wonders a proper face and head angle can do when coupled with inexpensive lighting. It can transform the face and body. This is not something you have to do or should feel pressured to do, but anyone who is feeling self conscious about how they look in a photo, take some time to google portrait photography posing techniques and diy lighting techniques.

Here's a great example: <LINK>

<BOLD> A photo is not the sum of who you are. It is a fraction of a second taken from one perspective. Be happy with yourself. You are beautiful. You are valid. You are a child of the universe, like the trees and stars, you deserve to be here. You are welcome and encouraged to share the best version of yourself.

Whether that's slapping a filter over a photo that makes your eyes pop, using lighting, dodge and burn techniques, camera RAW adjustments, all or none of the above. Simply putting yourself out there and having the courage to do that, you'll always get my upvote.

Thank you for coming to my TEDxx Talk.", 'You always get downvoted in my comments babe \U0001f923', 'My wife complimented my fashion taste, saying she was going to steal this dress i bought for myself and wear it with a Jean jacket. So i stole her outfit idea instead, and her jacket.']

['I lucid dream often but lately I've been put through a sort of mental test simulation while dreaming. 
 <SUMMARY> I've been dreaming of being in different simulated trials.

So, last night I dreamt that I was put into a simulation where i was in a classroom and the teacher was super strict and was yelling at us. And I remember mouthing "help me" to a guy behind me as she yelled at me. I remember feeling so terrified of her. I felt genuinely panicked. So, when the class was lining up to go to another room, I saw the chance to escape. Me and this other girl who I guess were self aware of being in the simulation started talking and were planning to escape. I usually lucid dream so I knew I had to wake up. Then I woke up. And just now. I dreamt that my friend A and I were sitting in a room with a rectangle of tables and there were people at each table. And basically we were all doing paper work that was basically doctor's office paper work where you list health conditions and stuff. But it also had actual assignment work on it. Anyway, A was sitting to my right and she was super nervous but I kept calming her down. And then there was this lady there who was moderating the event and she went around collecting everyone's papers. The papers were graded immediately and I got a 68. And the class mocked me. Then she collected all of our phones and I had an apple watch and she took it. So, we couldn't cheat in the simulation I guess. Anyways, A was freaking out so I rubbed her back and then gestured with my eyes for her to look under the table. And when she did, we held hands. Then I kept saying "everything's gonna be okay". And the lady said "let's begin".Then the room faded to black before slowly starting to turn white. It was warped and fuzzy like Virtual Reality video games but A was still next to me. Everyone was still in the same positions at the rectangle of tables. But there was this funky little music in the background with a clicking (it had the vibe of like lofi ambient funky music but also the negative emotion associated with the demon and "tip toe through the tulips" from Insidious) and it made me feel so sketched out. I was thinking "good thing I ate that salami sandwich" (because before we entered the room with the rectangle of tables, I ate a sandwich). I immediately started to feel woozy and I shut my eyes hoping it would all be over. Then I woke up and I panicked for a bit. But it was so trippy and I can still hear the clicking and the music and it's so freaky in my head. Just gives me chills. I wonder what we would've had to do but I know it would've been sinister. I wonder if over the next few days, I'll keep dreaming of trials like these.', 'No. It was just really random and sinister. He was towering over me. (I'm 5'8) and he was still so much taller than me. My head was at his belly button level and he just stared down at me with a very devilish smile. His eyes were devoid of any life. Just a very doll-like overly cheery grin. I simply uttered "hello?" And he replied "hello..." like he was going to kidnap me or rape me or something. It was all very unsettling and I ended up running away from him as he chased me through the store. All the while, getting larger and larger. It doesn't have any significance in my life so I was wondering why I had this dream.', 'Parents of reddit, how have you explained human anatomy to your children? ["You're missin' a P there, lol. But hell, maybe you <BOLD-ITALIC> want to be missin' a p, I know I do.", 'I don't hate you for saying, but instead offer up question to your question:

What genes cause dysphoria? As far as I'm aware, we still don't know <BOLD-ITALIC> why trans people feel the way they do. Sure there are lots of theories, but no hard facts.

Yeah, some scientists <ITALIC> are lazy. But I feel like developing something with pre-established foundations and proof of concept would be far easier than finding the needle of "What causes transness" in the haystack of "Human biology."', "I'm a MtF, just recently came out, and everything I've read says binding can seriously inhibit or damage breast growth. Everything has pointed to sports bras and baggy clothing.", "Chatrooms.

No, seriously. It's not a guarantee, but like with a lot of things, humans tend to mirror IRL emotions that they are expressing through a medium. It helps us to more accurately portray the emotions in said medium.

Now, I'm not sure whether you can draw, but just from this post I know you have at least passable writing skills. Join an RP chatroom, or Discord Server. Or a D&D one.

When something makes you feel a certain way, write it out. Why it makes you feel that way, how the emotion <BOLD-ITALIC> physically makes you feel. The memories and/or experiences it may have made you remember.

The more you analyze it, the closer to the surface it gets. Once you get to a point where you can really feel the emotion you want, let your face naturally emote it. Don't hold back."]

(Brought to you by a solo Nea + Trapper Main)", 'My fiance and I are announcing our engagement on Halloween with our costume theme for this year (my 9 year old was the star and yes she freaked out some hikers).', 'Help! My original cat is changing and I'm not sure what to do. 
 So about a week ago we brought home a new kitten, Siku (female, 9 weeks old), because we wanted an indoor family cat that we could raise and train.

My original, resident cat, Eko (female, 5 years old), was not happy about this.  A little bit about Eko:  We adopted her when she was 2.5 years old.  She's an indoor/outdoor cat.  She goes outside multiple times a day to hunt and even brings us "gifts" on occasion.  She comes home during the day to eat and nap and get love.  She'll sleep on the piano, behind the TV, in a dresser drawer, on the bed, sometimes she'll just plop down in the middle of the living room.  She loves being pet around her neck and on the head.  She especially loves the way my daughter pets her.  She never growls or hisses at us and she's never used her claws on us once.  She spends her nights inside making sure the house stays mouse free.

Since bringing home the new kitten Eko has changed...  She's spending most of her time outdoors.  She comes in to eat maybe 6 or 7 bites of food, then our curious little kitten goes to see her and Eko hisses and bats at her and goes outside again.  When Eko comes inside and we manage to keep the kitten away for a while, we give Eko tons of love but she doesn't purr anymore, she doesn't want to stay anymore.  She gets burs (little plants) stuck in her fur and she used to let us pick them out for her but now she growls and hisses at us if we try and that's going to become a problem.  I've tried to have her in overnight like usual but she just whines up a storm at the back door...  If she does stay in she hides behind the TV all night and then as soon as we're awake she wants to leave.  I've tried to make things positive for her like showing her more love, giving her treats, buying her catnip...  But she doesn't purr when we pet her now, when <ITALIC> I try to give her a treat she ignores it, and she wants nothing to do with the catnip which is so out of character for her....  The biggest thing I'm worried about is she's spending ALL of her time outside avoiding the kitten and what little time she does see the kitten she spends hissing at her and bopping her on the head.  Everybody I talk to keeps telling me, "She'll get used to the kitten, don't worry about it" but how is that going to happen when she's just avoiding contact...  and on top of that all her behavioral changes are really worrying me.

I know it's only been a week but I'm a very concerned pet mommy right now.  Can anyone offer any advice?']

["Nope! I'm a fully modern in terms of my mindset, just big into vintage fashion", 'It's a pagan religion, we try to reconstruct the ancient religion of northern bronze age europe

Meaning we believe in 3 entities, you can choose if you believe in all of them, or just one, or 2, whatever you like, they are:
- the gods (norse like Odin, thor)
- your ancestors
- the house wights (basically like spirits that guard your house)

We pray by giving offerings, an offering can be anything that you worked on, food you made, flowers you picked, woodwork that you made, anything
We give offerings at an altar, which we make ourselves, it usually consists of a small table with stuff that represents who were praying to, pictures of ancestors, small statues of the gods etc.

Sadly it often gets associated with Nazis, because a while ago some people hijacked the religion because.... northern europe, ancestor worship... you know

But real Heathens are not racist, and not Nazis, heck you dont even need to be European to believe in it, just like I could be muslim even if I'm white.

Contrary to other pagan religions, like Wicca, most heathens dont believe in "magick" but only the power of prayer (some people, not many, also pray to the runes, which sometimes gets compared to magick, but it's also just through the power of prayer kind of stuff), most Heathens also dont believe in new-age energy stuff, like magic crystals and healing power and that sort of stuff', 'AITA for ending a friendship when "I should know that he overreacts sometimes" ? 
 So I (f, 20) had a bad fight with my (now ex) best friend (m, 20).

It essentially boils down to him saying that I was studying wrong, and trying to force me to change what I was doing, I said no, we didnt speak for a few weeks and then he sent me a LONG message (it took 45 minutes to read it to someone) where he was essentially insulting me without being obvious that they're insults. I ghosted him after that.

 (example: "I can still come over and help you study so that you'll atleast pass" and "I know you've lost someone important and now you're confused" I havent lost anyone though, so he probabaly means himself) 

Anyway, now I talked to an old friend of mine and want to reconnect with him, we talked and had fun and then we talked about the fight, he is still friends with my ex best friend and he said something like "you know that he sends these messages when hes upset, that's just him, he overreacts, why havent you responded and forgiven him? You know he always does that it's just in the heat of the moment" my answer was "cause when someone thinks about me like that, that I'm stupid and that I NEED their help to pass, essentially looking down on me, I dont want them in my life, and that he thinks about me like that was clear after that message."

He just responded with "yeah, after all this time I forget that you were a bit "socially weird" (english isn't my first language and this sentence is hard to translate, it meant that I'm awkward, and dont know how to act in certain situations)


But now I'm wondering... maybe I should've forgiven him, cause I know he tends to act out and send these long texts (the friend I reconnected with has gotten multiple of those in the past too), but I was also really offended.

I made multiple AITAs about this before for example if it was okay for me to ghost him, for more in depth stuff about what he said specifically, look at those.

Thank you.', 'I speak german and english fluently/very well and very very very very shitty spanish lol, just had it for like 3 years in school 

I live in North Rhine-Westphalia (NRW)']

["I think there's no way someone wouldn't recognize it, they definitely heard it many times", "This is the second time 
 It's the second time I find a big grasshopper in my little courtyard. Actually the third, because the first one was a green thing but smaller.

I am extremely scared of these bugs, and everytime I see them I need to run or get as far aways as possible. I start breathing fast and then feeling shame and anger.

I have been scared of them since I can remember.

Since the courtyard is near the kitchen, I made lunch and brought it upstairs. Now I am still hungry but don't feel like going to the kitchen, because there's a window which opens to the courtyard and I might see that thing.

I start thinking about people from my past who whould have frowned upon this fear of mine, and I start having dark thoughts towards them.

Also as a man I feel I shouldn't have this phobia. I consider myself a good person but I am capable of having really dark thoughts towards people who judge me or frown upon my flaws.

Now I feel so vulnerable. Every small movement, every thing that moves, a feather from the bed or a itch in the body,makes me cringe, because I think about those insects.

I am laying in my bed feeling angry and hungry. And feeling shame, guilt, sadness", 'Add an interesting title 
 Add your text...', 'Do not go gentle into that good <BOLD> _']

(That straight up came out of my prediction bar so idk if that says more about Joe Biden or me)', "Friends too quickly after break up? 
 My(20F) and my girlfriend(19F) were best friends for over a year in high school before we graduated and started dating. We dated for almost 2 years. Most of it was long distance because of her college, but we spent the odd week or month together here and there when things settled down on breaks.  We got through a lot of shit together, battling past trauma,  working through individual complexes, overcoming addiction. Things that I feel brought us closer than most. We fought a lot too though, there were issues much bigger than us. And eventually we just fell out of love in the traditional romantic sense, things shifted towards this sort of all encompassing friendship that feels bigger than our relationship ever was. And it still hurts more than anything, but i know shes not going anywhere. Is it bad to become such close friends so quickly, only after a week we've been broken up? It saddens me to lose this one side of her that i knew so well, but now without the pressure of being each other's only one I feel like we fight less and we are more honest.", 'Only realized that my wife and ex wife were the same person after I reincarnated as my son']

['I love this message, and this creative use of a broken pot!', "So this is to my dog, Charlie. It's on my phone so please forgive any typos.

Then we met in person and something clicked. No more searching you were coming home with us. 

You blew your coat on the drive home but that was fine! You humped your bed at first and only slept on a sheepskin rug in my room. We bonded - and you brought me out of a shell. 

I trained you to help me, as much as you trained me in what to look for to alert to an incoming seizure.

['Not my moment...  But my Dad's story.

He was in a shitty bar in Philly, PA and they had a condom dispenser in the bathroom.  He had no intention of using it but something caught his eye when he looked at it.

There were two options and one was labeled "REGULAR" while the other was labeled "FRENCH TICKLER."  Keep in mind that this was back in the late 80s / early 90s.

He said he was at the urinal trying to reason what would make a condom a <ITALIC> french tickler and as he finished up, he decided he would shell out 50 cents for a condom to find out.

He washed his hands, put two quarters in the dispenser, and got a small brass colored condom package.  He ripped it open and it just looked like a normal condom.  Confused, he started to unroll it and along the shaft section of the condom were repeating images of a fancy mustached frenchman holding a feather and looking coy.  

That was it.  He spent 50 cents to find out it was just a goofy printed image on a condom...  But that's not what made this moment golden.

He went to leave the bathroom and when he tossed the condom in the trash he saw at least ten more unused but unrolled French Tickler condoms in the bin.

He exited the bathroom laughing because he wasn't the only guy with 50 cents worth of curiosity in Philly.', '[TOMT] WORD - (very easy, I'm sure) Related to addiction...

HELP!  LOL!

['Person avoids nicking their undercarriage while climbing up a wall Gecko Style', 'Hammerhead God Roll 
 I hope nobody else has done this before, but here I go. (Note: The perks are based off of <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> stats and partially my own opinion.)

Hammerhead is currently one of the most dominant machine guns around, being easily farmable and having some of the best rolls available on a machine gun. The most optimal way to get it is to farm it multiple times a week, as it is available for modulus reports instead of a ballistics log after the first frame purchase every week.

It can roll with 9 different barrels. However, <BOLD> 8 out of the 9 upgrade either range or stability, the best perks on this weapon.

It can roll with 8 different magazine mods, with <BOLD> 4 out of the 8 being optimal and upgrading range.

It can roll with 6 different first perks, with <BOLD> 1 out of the 6 being extremely helpful for PvP and another  <BOLD> 1 out of the 6 being really helpful for PvE. This is where you begin to split paths.

It can roll with 6 different second perks, with <BOLD> 3 out of the 6 being helpful in PvP and <BOLD> 5 out of the 6 being helpful for PvE.

And of course, there are the masterworks range, stability, handling, and reload speed. In PvE, <BOLD> all 4 can be helpful, while in PvP <BOLD> only 2 are the most helpful.

This leaves us to determine the odds for getting an optimal roll for PvE and PvP.

The PvE optimal roll is much more likely, having odds of 5/63, or 7.9% of Hammerheads having an optimal roll. This means 1 in every 13 Hammerheads should have a good roll.

However, when it comes to PvP, the optimal roll chance becomes much slimmer, with a much longer time required. The odds are only 1/42, or only 2.3% of Hammerheads having an optimal PvP roll. This means you would have to complete about 42 forges in order to get it if you had bad RNG, or even more if you have horrible RNG.

When you end up with the final optimal perk sets, you get something like this.

PvP:

Barrel Perk: Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore.

Magazine Perk: Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Light Mag

Perk 1: Quickdraw

Perk 2: Surrounded, Rampage, High-Impact Reserves

MW: Range, Stability

PvE:

Barrel Perk: Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore.

Magazine Perk: Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Light Mag

Perk 1: Feeding Frenzy

Perk 2: Surrounded, Rampage, High-Impact Reserves, Amibitous Assassin, Genesis.

MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed

Edit: Already screwed up math had to rework because REE two barrel and magazine perks at once.', 'This is the fucking shit. Nice one OP.', 'This little guy I found at a humane shelter. His name was Fisher, and he was the goodest boi I have met. (Referring the cat)', "Probably the best conversation I've had on this site."]

What are your thoughts?', "Anyone interested in casual riverside group bike rides for the less-than-fit crowd in June? 
 I'm starting to really getting into cycling as a hobby, and I've joined the Great Cycle Challenge in June to ride for charity this June - good for me and the world! I usually ride by myself (or with my dog via the WalkyDog bike leash that he loves) but I'm wondering if any other casual, out of shape wannabe cyclers want to join me for a ~5k ride or two in June on a riverbank trail? I'm quite obese from an eating disorder, but making a lot of sustainable lifestyle changes now - so we'll be going slow and steady on the ride (8-10km/hr average), but if you're more fit and the relaxed type you're welcome to come. The best time for me is Tuesday and Thursday evenings, and maybe some of us can meet at the Reddit Meetup at the Legislature (see the group sticky post), chat, and then ride?

EDIT: Paved bike paths, suitable for cruisers!

If you feel like I'm a scary internet stranger, you already have the getaway vehicle. :D

Also, cyclists, what are your favourite bike trails, while I have your attention? =)

['So I won‚Äôt forget to call them what they are', 'I wish this sub was a website with full ass warehouse and shipping setup', 'Have you heard of the fork model?

So like the spoon model is this way to track energy mental-health wise, on a 0-5 scale. If I have four spoons, I‚Äôm a bit off but doing pretty good. If I have 0 spoons, I‚Äôm in hell. 

The fork model is the inverse kinda. A fork is an annoying thing happening now (theres a loud fan on, your bra is too tight, your bladder is full, you‚Äôre hosting and have to monitor everyone‚Äôs mood the whole time, you‚Äôre underslept, that kinda stuff). A person can walk around fine with a few small forks in them, but things get wack when you have too many forks. 

Dysphoria is for sure a nice thicc fork.', 'Well, given that bass isn‚Äôt going to be your primary instrument, there are two paths to consider. 

Since you won‚Äôt be investing a primary-instrument amount of time into it, it could be nice to make things a little easier on yourself (after a tough time shopping) and just grab the 5/8. 

On the other hand, if you‚Äôre going to be playing the other instruments more, it‚Äôs possible that other musicians will be playing your bass to jam or track with you, and for this case it would be helpful to have a standard 3/4.']

then the corona virus happened

i do like trying new things more with quarantine tho. i bleached a part of my hair, i‚Äôm trying new things with make up, i can‚Äôt believe i‚Äôm saying this but i‚Äôm making tiktoks!

the only problem with that is i‚Äôm falling behind in school work, <ITALIC> again. i don‚Äôt know if i can do college. i have no idea if it‚Äôs that‚Äôs the depression or if it‚Äôs a genuine concern. i‚Äôd love to talk to my therapist but they‚Äôre not doing like regular appointments, it‚Äôs over the phone and it‚Äôs only check ins :/.

<SUMMARY> im trans and i used sex to avoid my mental issues and now there‚Äôs quarantine so i have to actually deal with them.', 'if you‚Äôre having trouble you could try practicing calling him by the correct pronouns by telling stories about him. the don‚Äôt need to be to anyone in particular, or even need to have really happened. ie a story about how he became king/president/prime minister/whatever of a Bahraini colony on mars by befriending a dragon and slaying the evil wizard, idk use your imagination. you‚Äôve probably heard of this before but i thought i‚Äôd mention it.

['NAH. Something my doctor explained to me and it makes so much sense: the reason people have PMS is because during the rest of the month you keep going through situations that make you stressed, but you need to repress feelings of sadness or anger and you dont allow yourself to feel them. When you are on your period, PMS is a biological response to all that repressed stress, and you are  ‚Äúforced‚Äú to experience it.

Ofc it depends on the person, some people have it worse and some dont have it as much, but it definetly depends on how you manage your sadness/anger during the rest of the month too. If you are saying you have an anger disorder it, must be much worse for you, because the amount of anger you are repressing is probably way bigger. 

But this is something that happens naturally and you have absolutely no control over, and you should not treat it as if you were being an asshole to people because it is not something you do on purpose.', "I (20F) want to provide emotional support for my girlfriend (21F), who lives in an abusive household, but it is draining me emotionally so much 
  

(posted this somewhere else but reposting here because I need more suggestions I think. English not my first language, sorry for any mistakes).

For the last 5 months or so, my girlfriend has been going through this huge fight with her parents, who she currently lives with. It has gotten to the point where they argue everyday, her parents got physically abusive twice, practically kicked her out of the house, and she attempted suicide twice (which made them even more mad and the situation even worse).

I've been there trying to support her since the whole thing started but I am so emotionally tired. There is no time to recover between one incident and the next, and it doesn't help that her parents hate me for not taking their side and keep insulting her by saying crap about me.

Problem is, I have nobody to talk about this to. Of course I can't talk to her - her situation is obviously far worse than mine, and I'd be an asshole if i basically told that her suffering makes me suffer and expect her to do something about it. Can't talk to my friends, cause all of them either know her or are mutual friends with her, and I don't want to expose her situation to them without permission. My family also doesn't really help; they always try to find excuses for her parents' awful behaviour and then tell me that if the situation is making me feel so bad then I should just break up with her.

But I don't wanna do it??? I just love her so much and I'd suck if I left her just cause this whole thing is making ME uncomfortable. I just wish I could give the support she needs without it making me so exhausted. I am not the most emotionally stable person in the world, and I still have a lot of stuff from work and college (yes even in the middle of this pandemic thing) to take care of. I also need to be well to be there for her. How do I keep myself from breaking down like i am right now?", 'NTA. Also, I think your bf had that reaction because he doesn't have any problems with the guy hinself, and his "instinct" was to want to protect his friend. I think it is wrong for him to think it isn't his problem and it has nothing to do with him, because if it's about a friend of HIS then it obviously does.

But if you and his friend are close enough, maybe you could try talking to him instead?', 'Thanks! I prefer with bangs too, but I think they make me look a lot younger?']

['Alright. Let me put my two cents in on three main points you seemed to bring up, as a non binary person with a trans ex gf and several others of non gender conforming identities as close friends. 

1. Annoying trans obsessed people

Same thing as with people who hate ‚Äúoverly gay‚Äù gay people. They‚Äôre likely unable to express their identity anywhere else due to social pressure and assume you or wherever you two are at the time is a safe place to be openly trans. Plus, it is a big aspect of their life. Arguably bigger than others in the lgbt community because it deals with a physical and behavioral expression and not just romantic or sexual. They aren‚Äôt trying to be annoying, and the fact that they‚Äôre so expressive around you means they‚Äôre comfortable doing so. 

2. Kids on early hormone and surgery

Let‚Äôs nip this in the bud right now, no one is suggesting minors get surgery. No one. No. One. It‚Äôs a fear tactic used by people who want the trans community to up and die, and I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôve been convinced of it. As for puberty blockers, while they are available to minors they only delay puberty. It isn‚Äôt a permanent restriction, just something to ease the dysphoria until they‚Äôre of legal age to make the transition themselves or with parental guidance. Yes they should have some level of psychological understanding before getting the blockers but you said yourself that a person knows inherently their full gender. They‚Äôd know as well as anyone.  

3. Gender as a social construct

It is. It absolutely is. Other cultures have had concepts for gender neutral identities and trans identities and genderfluidity long before America was a thing and long before anyone had an issue with them. Gender itself is a spectrum. And while yes, trans people often fall into a binary due to brain structure, this is mostly a signal of how genetics end to sort themselves out. Very few things that are ‚Äúgendered‚Äù traits are inherently assigned to that sex, and the few that are are broad and useless in the modern perception. What‚Äôs more, why would the complexity of a human brain be required to be 100% male or 100% female? Couldn‚Äôt it be a little of both? Couldn‚Äôt it be a bit changing and shifting, as a brain would be liable to do?

In short, I‚Äôm sorry you feel this way about other trans people. I‚Äôm sorry you seem to find vitriol against those who live their life and have no ill will towards you. I wish you the best, and I hope in the future you can talk to the other gender nonconforming people around you to get their perspective. There‚Äôs a lot of good people you seem to dismiss on little basis, and it‚Äôs a shame you‚Äôre cutting them out so easily.', 'I have been metagaming to help them so far. I‚Äôve been adjusting spellsaves and enemy counts and abilities this entire time. But this is the final boss of the first campaign I‚Äôve run ever. It‚Äôs a one shot, it‚Äôs a premade campaign, and I want to end it on a really dramatic and high note. And a final boss who has no actual damaging magical spells that work is not gonna work for me', 'Apparently it‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Most Dangerous Game‚Äù but you‚Äôre not supposed to know if it‚Äôs actually murder or an elaborate thrill prank. 

At least that‚Äôs what I got out of it. Could just be rich people thinking poor people are subhuman. Who knows?', 'Oh the usual. For anyone wondering about <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>, it's called "Houdou Tamashii" which is roughly "Press/News Soul", or maybe "Soul of the Reporter" or something. Does this make the art any more related to its effect? Probably not.

Before anyone asks, no, there's still no subbed version as of my typing this comment. Been waiting for it since yesterday, but I got impatient enough to just watch the raws. Fortunately, there isn't anything particularly deep going on, and my limited knowledge of the Japanese language let me understand most of what they said regarding the story. I also have no issue with understanding card effects since reading card texts was what helped me learn some Japanese in the first place.', "<QUOTE>

<QUOTE>

DID SOMEONE CALL

Putting my enthusiasm for the deck aside, I personally don't think they'll get hit, at least not their cards directly. The main deck cards are all HOPT, do next to nothing when it comes to interacting with/disrupting your opponent, and are not splashable into other decks. The Synchros, namely Quariongandrax and Ametrix, aren't particularly busted either as they only banish 3 and switch monsters to defense, respectively. Even if they're <ITALIC> kinda generic, you still don't see them run in every other Synchro deck due to how tight the ED is. While the deck as a whole is seeing some representation in the ladder, they aren't particularly dominating nor make up a huge chunk of the player base.

As for the more likely targets:

* The other Synchros, like Black Rose, Samurai Destroyer, Inzektron, Dolphin, etc.: I also doubt any of them will get hit as they aren't absolutely broken. However, even if they were to get hit, considering the lowest a card has ever gone to was only Limited, it'd make no difference as you only run 1 of each anyway.

* The Skills: Transcendent Crystals is actually the most possible target for a nerf, especially since it's seeing additional rise in Black Salvo decks for the GY setup. I still don't think it'll get hit because you do need to run 2 Garnets that usually do not synergize with the deck at all to use it, unlike a certain other Skill that completely shuts down several decks for the measly cost of a Cosmic Cyclone, which can actually result in advantage if you banish an opponent's backrow. Even if it did get hit, there's still the SSA variant, and I'm sure there'll be other ways to work around it since we have Undine.

I don't think there's anything wrong with waiting as you don't have much to lose if you're really unsure. You can always hold onto your Gems for the new box in case you find something else there you want even more, and if you don't, then that's when you go all-in with Crystrons. For the most part, though, as long as new Synchros keep coming out, Crystrons can indirectly get better.", "Undine is usually run in the SSA variant since it can dump Citadel Whale in addition to the Crystron monsters, making SSA more searchable.

With Rion at 2 now, Controller <ITALIC> might be more useful now as the LV3 Tuner you use for Synchro plays during your turn so you can conserve your Rions. Mid-to-late game, assuming Sulfefnir's in the GY, Crystrons don't really need their Normal Summon anyway, so summoning Controller shouldn't be a huge problem.", "Three is ideal, but 2 Sulfefnirs should be enough to get started. It should be good enough for casual or climbing up to Platinum/Legend in my opinion, but for the most part, you'll likely need the 3rd copy if you're aiming for KoG.

I assume you're using the SSA variant since you're planning to use Undine, and for that, 2 Undines and 1 Controller should also be workable. You might wanna run an extra Citadel Whale temporarily, though, but it's not super necessary.

In either case, I'd suggest running a smaller deck to compensate for the slightly lowered consistency, but you can also choose some good staple/tech cards to disrupt your opponent instead to buy you time until you do draw them.

Another workaround is to play the Heavy Starter build with Machina Fortress; Fortress can make for a decent sub-boss that can also keep you alive until you do draw/mill Sulfefnir."]

['Well he likes this album amongst a bunch of other ones so I‚Äôm not sure what you mean by that lol', 'I can‚Äôt believe hospital for souls is getting so many votes. It‚Äôs honestly the best song on the album in my opinion', 'Is Jordan‚Äôs vocals in a few of the tracks on Amo? 
 I can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs him or not in some of them but I feel like I hear him in I apologise if you feel something, nihilist blues, and mother tongue maybe? I‚Äôd love to hear him in more of the studio tracks he has a great voice!', 'Therapist told me everything I wanted sounded like I was a man but I'm beginning to think I was right from the beginning that I don't quite fit the binary 
 I should probably start off by saying that I first started having issues with therapists in regards to my gender when I was sent to a therapeutic boarding school when I was a teenager. I'm assigned female at birth and I never felt right living my life as a woman. The boarding school I was sent to didn't allow me to explore my sexuality or the issues I was having with my gender. 

When I got home I got another therapist who was and is a lot better. I immediately started unpacking my gender dysphoria with my new therapist and was presenting as genderqueer a lot of the time. I initially wanted to do a partial transition with hormones but was told that was not possible. I remember crying to my therapist and they told me that a lot of the things I wanted sounded like I was a man. I kind of just went with it because it sounded right at the time and I just wanted to get as far as possible from my experience as a woman. 

Fast forward to now, I've been on testosterone for almost six years and got top surgery. I use he/him pronouns and I'm so much more comfortable with my body, my name, and my pronouns. All of that's fine. I no longer pack because I don't think I actually have bottom dysphoria.. I don't want bottom surgery and I almost feel like I packed because I felt like I was supposed to have bottom dysphoria because I felt lopsided. I've also been exploring my femininity because I no longer feel threatened by it. People definitely experience me as a man, which is better than being experienced as a woman but something still doesn't feel quite right about calling myself a man.. It feels like I was being pushed into the binary no matter who I asked for help, whether it was to be a woman or be a man. I've told my therapist a few times that it feels like at my core I don't identify with being a man and was wondering if I was nonbinary and was told there was no way I was nonbinary which was difficult to hear because it gave me no room to explore it with my therapist.. and I think they feel that way because after transitioning, I look like a cisgender man.

This is something I'm definitely going to try to sit with and explore. I don't want to make any big decisions right now but it does seem like I've known for a long time that I have felt and do feel a bit of disconnect from identifying as a woman or a man. Would love to hear if anyone has had experiences like this before though. I regret nothing about physically transitioning or changing my name and pronouns but it definitely feels like somethings going on inside me that's telling me that somethings not quite right about identifying as a "man".']

['Effie and her Husbando 
 <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

Zelgius' build is much more standard so we can go over that first

Zelgius 5*40 +2

HP: 47 

ATK: 59

SPD: 34

DEF: 42

RES: 24

Alondite

Reposition

Aether

Fury

Vengeful Fighter 3

Hone Armor

Distant Defence 3

Nothing too special with this build, the only thing that makes it interesting is the Vengeful Fighter/Aether. With Fury to boost his stats with summoner support, I like having him stay healthier, and I happened to have a spare W!Tharja to let him charge Aether faster. Also Aether helps with Arena points and Vengeful doesn't hurt them either.

Now for the main event:

"Every brick makes me a better wall!"

Effie 5*40 +7 

HP: 66

ATK: 59

SPD: 24

DEF: 42

RES: 27

Carrot Lance + (+ Def)

Swap (Rip Repo fodder)

Aether

Close Defense 3

Wary Fighter 3

Hone Armor/Fortify Armor/Panic Ploy

Close Defense 3

Here she is. She started off as a little 5 star Effie I rolled way back in the day, Pre-SI days. I had no clue what I was doing, but I saw her stats and free Death Blow and I said "Oh wow she's super good. Let's get her to level 40!". Then SI comes out and I see a 5 star Cordy that I'm never going to use, and that Brave Lance + looked mighty tempting on my girl here. And for a long time that build worked and it still works well, but I wanted something crazier. Something sillier. Something tankier. Legendary Heroes Banner comes around with Spring Xander on it. And when I saw that Carrot Lance I knew that THAT was the weapon I needed. Stops any chip damage and helps her feed everyone some Vitamins. As soon as I rolled him I didn't even check IVs I went straight to Effie and fed her the lance. Worked up some refining stones and got her that defense boost along with summoner support and I made this monster. Her only big weakness is green mages, which is what makes Zelgius such a good pair up for her. Distant Counter and not terrible RES allows him to clear the way for anybody else who might come her way. The double Close Defense gives her an effective 52 DEF and 39 RES, which allows her to tank almost every melee unit, save for some dragons, even up to +10 merges in some cases. When that free Ike comes in she might grab Warding Breath too, but we'll have to see.', 'Make the problem that his liver is shitty and he cant drink without dying. ["In my group, since we're all pretty forgetfully folks, we usually do a quick recap at the start and end of the session to make sure everyone is on the same page.", 'For those who don\'t understand the deep gnome feat thing: its called Svirfneblin Magic, found on page 114 of Mordenkainen\'s Tome of Foes, it allows you to cast Nondetection (a 3rd level abjuration spell) on yourself at will, allowing you to restore 6HP to your adjuration wizard ward every 6 seconds at no cost. Said ward has max HP equal to twice your wizard level+your int mod, so, in this case, 17hp ward, restory 6 per \'round\' out of combat to really take some bite out of traps, and at a high enough level to protect other party members with it, too. Pretty good build in my opinion.\r\n\r\nAs for the situation at hand... Okay. So. A GM should always talk to the player before applying any kind of permanent or semi-permanent debuff to a player character. Hell, in my own games I had a player aquire a strange, glowing wound after some bullshit with an alien god I wont go into cause it would open up layers of lore I\'d need to explain, and it was meant to just be an aestetic thing, I offered him a means to fix it and then he thought for a moment and basicly said to me "Okay, but what if this wound slowly corrupted my character into part of the campaign\'s final boss?"', "Lizard threatened to GET ALL THE PLAYERS NOT TO PLAY THE GAME if he couldn't have a ton of extra xp, money and a broken ability. did you even read the story?", 'Whenever you pause a youtube video, its always on a frame where someone is making a dumb face, even if there would otherwise not be a face anywhere in the video.']

["New DM looking for help with challenging my players 
 First off, I have been a DM for two sessions now, and I am loving every bit of it!

I am running the 5e starter set, The Lost Mine of Phandelver, with five players \(who are also new to the game\).

I was afraid that I would suck, because I don't know all the rules yet, but that was totally unnecessary! So far, even if I did get confused here and there, things have been going really well. The players are enjoying themselves \(last session they mostly went about the town and then hung about the tavern to drink, which is totally fine with me. We got some great roleplaying out of it\), I am enjoying myself. It's a fucking amazing game!

However, up until now, my players haven't had much trouble with defeating enemies or reaching other goals. It was mostly easy\-peasy\-lemon\-squeezy. The first session I was okay with that, as I just wanted to introduce us all to the game and the basic rules \(and the dice\). After the second session, though, I feel like I could be challenging them a bit more. 

I don't necessarily want them to die, but I do want them to know, that death is very much an option \(even though death is most likely not permanent, and doesn't happen immediately unless they are very stupid\).

Up until now, that threat hasn't really reached them yet, I think \(they still think splitting up the party is good idea, for example\). Maybe I have been too careful or kind for them, by not throwing as much at them as I could.

Does anyone have advice on how I can challenge them more, while still also making sure they are enjoying themselves?

\(Also, can anybody with a bit more knowledge tell me if torturing a 'bad' NPC, could possibly have consequences for a lawful good or lawful neutral character? Because a couple of my players totally did that, and even though they can torture whoever they want to, I do want it to have in game consequences for them \(as I don't want it to become option number one to get information\)!\)", "Beginning my journey into Witchcraft. Again. 
 When I was a very young teenager, ten or eleven, I was obsessed with witchcraft and wicca. It was when Charmed was very popular, and when I still thought maybe Hogwarts would send a letter my way.

I had a collection of books on witchcraft, collected stones and crystals, even had a little altar in my bedroom. I bought tarot cards, because the idea of them intrigued me (even though I never actually learned how to use them). Some of my friends were also interested and we tried to do some spells together. Nothing big, just asking for blessings, calling on the elements. Even then I took the idea of harming none very seriously, and I didn't want to call on the wrong spirits or magic. 

Anyway. Life happened. I grew away from witchcraft, even got a bit ashamed about it and threw most of my books away. I wanted to be normal (even though that wish never truly came true). Yet, somehow, somewhere, witchcraft always remained in the back of my mind. And now, over a decade later, I think I am ready to answer the call again.

In the last few years a lot of things have happened to me and around me. I lost my way once or twice, learning some things the hard way. I have matured. And I long for a deeper connection with the world, with nature, with my ancestors. I've been to church with my mother a few times, and even though she finds a lot of comfort there, I cannot share the feeling. The stories being told there, I can appreciate. But they are just stories to me. And I greatly miss the feminine aspect and perspective.

So. I have decided to listen to that little inner voice that has called out to me since my early adolescence. And actually, when I really think about it. Even though I thought I had left the craft behind me, I've always remained a witch. I put love and intention in to everything I cook and bake, I knit warm intention into my shawls and gloves, I burn candles for my late grandma and cat. And usually, when I go to goodwill, I find exactly what I asked the universe for.

This turned in to a very long post, when I basically wanted to ask for some tips, or some reading material. I know a lot of things are only a Google away, but I would greatly appreciate it if anyone could point me to some resources they like and/or use. As I didn't come into this entirely new, I do know some of the basics, though they have gone a bit rusty. At the moment I am very much interested in runes and their uses, learning how to actually use my gorgeous tarot cards and I am just very interested in hearing how other witches found their personal paths.

Also, I would love to celebrate Yule this year, as my first official witchy holiday. I have never done so before, so I would love to know what rituals, spells, food, activities others do on this day. I will probably be celebrating it with my mother, who is a very open minded christian and would love to celebrate the feasts of the year with me.", "After months of joblessness, I finally have a job interview! 
 I'm so happy right now, and still a bit nervous from the phone call I just had to make.

The last few months, I tried almost everywhere, but couldn't get a job. Having no disposable income, and still living with my parents, I just didn't feel like a grown up. It did not help my self esteem issues at all.

The lady on the phone was very friendly, and almost certain I would do great in the job interview next week. I also got to pick my own work times, so if I get hired, I won't have to work more than 24 hours (which is great, because pretty soon I'll start with some serious therapy).

I've already told all my friends and family, because I just can't keep this happiness contained. It finally feels like I'm getting somewhere again! :)", 'Oh, I am definitely preparing for the worst. Or- you know, I generally try to not have too many expectations about anything!

This for me, does feel like a step in the right direction though, as this is the first job interview I've gotten in literal months (my email inbox is full of very polite 'no thank you's")']
