['The little girl who scared me half to death 
 When I was 14 a new family moved onto my small dead end street I go to meet the mom and her three daughters ages 0, 4 and 8 I start to babysit the 4 and 8 year old. This story happens and I am about 16 to 17 the youngest girl is 2 and a half ish, by this time I had started to babysit her that night it was just me and her.

Mom and the other two girls are out from 4-10 but the mom ran late, it was about 8 pm bed time for her, now I have put this girl to bed a lot of times we had a routine I would read her one or two stories and than sing her to sleep, but this night she didn‚Äôt want to go to her room she didn‚Äôt want to get changed and she especially didn‚Äôt want me to put her in her bed after the stories. After 4 books I ask her what‚Äôs wrong and she says to be ‚Äúhe goes round he goes round‚Äù now this scared me but I have to try and calm her down and settle her so I ask

‚Äúwho is he‚Äù 

she than says ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚Äù

I try to stay calm and ask ‚Äúis he bad?‚Äù

She shakes her head ‚Äúno he watches, round and round‚Äù she mentioned him going round constantly, by now mom had called and said that she would be late. The next thing the little girl said is what truly scared me, I don‚Äôt remember word for word what she said so I will not but it in quotes, she says something along the lines of ‚Äòwhere is mom somethings wrong she‚Äôs not coming back!‚Äô But I promised her that I will never let him hurt her and that I will protect her and that her mom will be back. I don‚Äôt mention that now I am scared but even if her mom doesn‚Äôt come back I will take care of her, I had called my mom and told her that if the mom isn‚Äôt back by dawn I will bring the girl and some supplies of hers home with me and we will take care of her. she nods and goes to sleep.

A few hours later and it‚Äôs almost midnight and I hear footsteps in the house I run up to the little girl and say again and again ‚Äúyou are not welcome here you need to leave‚Äù I calm this over and over but it doesn‚Äôt stop and just like she said the steps go in circles a Roth‚Äôs house, eventually it stopped. shortly after this the mom came and I told her I was worried something might be going on she ignored me and I went home. 

For months I watched as this little girl was scared of everything and she was so scared I did what I could but she never did get better I have left for college now and the few times I‚Äôve seen her she looked alright but still I worry.', 'Yes as someone who has two of the same breed you can tell them apart no one else can but you most definitely can', 'I feel extremely comfortable when I‚Äôm mute but I know how much of a problem it can be', 'Luckily for me it‚Äôs minor and I didn‚Äôt get diagnosed till I was 12 and in school as long as I was comfortable i could talk when I wasn‚Äôt I wouldn‚Äôt raise my hand and if I was called on I‚Äôd use my phone to talk']

['Been loving my new flowery smelly body wash!', 'Me after I call someone "she" but then he corrects me:', 'I'm definitely not a standard type of plural. 
 I don't consider myself a plural at all. Or a "system" or a, what was it... "member"? But the about section said this was for all forms of multiple people in one head, which I guess this counts as, so I'll share anyway. I only just found out about this sub, and it seems a tad strange to me, to be honest, but if this is the situation you're in, I won't judge. 

I love bullshit meta writing. Characters aware that they're characters, stories interacting with the reader, pushing the boundaries between the reader and an observer, self referential writing, omnipotent self inserts, you name it. I read homestuck, it was confusing as hell, I ate that shit up and begged for more. I wrote my own. I wrote a dialogue for school. Two characters speaking, the thoughtful one and the optimistic one, both aware of the fragile and dubious state of their existence, or perhaps nonexistence. They spoke to eachother, developed for a while, interacted with metatextual concepts. After a while, the thoughtful one switched the document to single spacing to conserve space. They abandoned their quotation marks when they spoke, and at one point, I let the thoughtful one write a section of the narrative. But they weren't really seperate people. All the thoughtful one is is me pretending to be her. A character like any other. I consider what she'd do and I type it out as if I were her. Right before she wrote the part of the story, she told me "Of course, you'll still be writing it, like you've written everything I've done, but you'll be writing it as if you were me. Entirely me, like you're writing right now, as I say this, as opposed to you being you, and me being a part of you."

So that's what they are. Segments of my consciousness I can pull up to figure out what I think they'd say. I'm not sure I'm right though. I might not be writing them well and consistently. So, some time passes, I make a writing portfolio for class, and I put the dialogue in it. In the reflection portion of the portfolio, I let them out and do some self analysis through them. Come next year, I'm writing my college essay. Not one I'll actually be submitting to colleges, I just had to write one for English class. I write it with them, having a conversation throughout. I realize I haven't been treating them properly. I gave them self awareness, and even though they're less complex, less sentient than I am, I should still let them out. So I wrote them an ending. I placed them in a fictional instance of Earth. The thoughtful one chose the name Callie, and the Optimistic one chose the name Eliza. Or really, I chose for them. Because that's the only thing I can do. Callie becomes an author, and she does <ITALIC> not write metafiction because she knows better than anyone that's a whole can of worms. We still talk. I can write a conversation with them any time I want. On their end, It's written as the phone in their house ringing, and I'm on the other end. In the final draft of my essay, I did something absolutely bullshit. I shared the essay with them. The one that they're in. It was weird, and confusing, and it just wouldn't work. Callie told me this couldn't be my college essay. It's too bullshit, too confusing. I told her I thought I could fix it. That this was me. This was what I was like. It finished off with: 

‚ÄúPatch, this is really important, college is going to affect your entire life. Just once, can you suck it up and just write something normal about the time your pet died or something?‚Äù

I can‚Äôt

So that's basically the whole thing. I guess AMA? You can also ask Callie and Eliza anything I guess, too. I'll try to answer as well as I can. Hey, are you two ok with that?

E: "Yeah, alright. I guess we're in a unique situation. Shoot."

Nice. Callie, you?

C: "Yeah. I think this is all unnecessary and you're overplaying this with people with no real relation to this, but sure. Whatever."

Were you always this cynical?

C: "I don't think I was, really. I was very emotionally supportive. That's just kind of what you've boiled my personality down to. You've been doing me pretty wrong. I guess there's one thing you got right, even in the ending. I love Eliza."

Fuck, I have, haven't I? Oh, shit I'm so sorry.

C: "doesn't matter. I'm not real, remember?"

But you a... yeah. I guess you're right. By which I mean I'm right, of course. Even when I'm wrong I can't bear to let myself not be right.

==========================================

Edit: They're not the only ones either. But most of the others are more "short lived". And they're usually versions of me, quick dips into a hypothetical world. For example, for a long time now, my Nintendo 3ds has been suffering touch screen issues because if sand that got inside it. I've been asking my dad if we could try taking it apart to clean it out for a while. Recently, I'd had enough and asked him if we could please open it up and fix it now. He said ok, and we took it apart, put it back together, and it wouldn't turn on. I was pretty upset, but my parents ended up giving me a new one that they already had because they were saving it for Christmas because they knew I'd been having touch screen troubles. But, if I couldn't turn my old one on, I couldn't transfer my data. I'd basically have to start over on all downloadable games. So we were all feeling a lot of regret. Me, for being so desperate to do something so stupid and reckless, and them for not just giving it to me when I asked to fix my old one and being able to transfer my data. So, I thought, "If I had just asked them, this whole thing would have been avoided." So I placed myself in a hypothetical situation, in my mind:


I walked into my parents room. "Hey, I've really been having problems with my 3ds," I said. "Can we handle that?"
"Uh, yeah." My dad said. "I'll get the tools."
"Hey, uh, you know, this might actually make it worse. If we end up breaking it, I might lose my data permanently. Can you just give me the one you're saving for Christmas now to avoid a whole mess?"
"How did you know about that?" My mom asked. <ITALIC> Fuck. How did <ITALIC> I know about that? Well, they showed me. Right after I broke my- "Oh goddamnit I put myself in a hypothetical situation again, didn't I? I'm sorry, mom and dad, but none of this is real. I'm just, or rather my external self, who already broke his, is thinking about what might have happened if I just asked for the new one now." "What? Come on, that's rediculous." They said. "Yeah, I'm so sorry, but now that I've realized this, our universe is about to break down and we're all going to stop existing."

Outside, I thought, "oh my God, this is getting too meta. I gotta stop." I made myself stop thinking about it. 

And this happens <ITALIC> all the time I'm constantly making other versions of myself, and then they become aware of their confinement and the metanarrative structure breaks down. I'm like Dirk fucking Strider with all these splinters. I've constantly got little brain ghosts running around in my head.

Recently, while questioning if I was trans, but still undecided, I wrote a conversation between myself and my impression of what a potential, future, trans version of myself might be like. She had self awareness, she knew she was just my guess at a hypothetical future. After she told me her story, which I made up, and we finished our conversation, I asked her if she wanted to go live with Callie and Eliza now that she has self awareness. She turned me down. The way I think, the way I keep making versions of myself, they're used to not being the real me, and then fading away back into my greater self. Here's the dialogue, I guess. 

"No, I think I'm gonna stay here."

What do you mean? Where even is "here"?

"In the future, I guess. It's hardly the first time you've thought like this. You'll always have potential future selves, you've even wondered before what they'd say to you if you could talk to them. I'll be ok."

Heh, alright. See ya around.\xa0

I guess she's still with me. Every time I look ahead. But, the future she told me about has already proven to be slightly untrue. Does that mean she's dead, and other, future selves are all different people?

I even tried writing porn for the first time recently. I thought it was good, but apparently I can't even resist making my porn meta.', "Put your real gender, and if you haven't figured that out yet, put questioning or something like that."]

Looking good! \^.^', "I don't know setting numbers.  Probably depends on the specific machine they are using. Could maybe check the make/model next time and Google it.

Switching sides back and forth is pretty normal for pain management on sensitive areas.  I'm not sure of a good way to know everything was covered.  My skin and hair follicles are usually a bit red for a day after, it's probably noticeable enough to the technician during that they can tell what they have hit.

Chin has also been the most sensitive for me.  That's where my hair is the thickest. 

I've noticed results after one session, but it wasn't like everything was gone. It's more like 30% of remaining hair doesn't grow back.  So your remaining hair will be something like 100%->70%->49%->34%->24%->16% etc.  This is why it takes 10+ sessions to clear everything, even on ideal hair and skin colors.

My experience is that about 1.5 weeks after a session all the damaged hair starts falling out and that's when I feel the best about it, but a lot of it will grow back around 4-5 weeks after."]

["hell, I didn't know that was a racial slur until right now.", 'Looking for a fellow recovering bulimic to keep me on track. 
 I‚Äôm writing this now because I‚Äôm scared I‚Äôm going to hurt myself or purge if I don‚Äôt do something with my mind. 

I‚Äôm 14, but my eating disorder started when I was about 12, maybe a bit younger. I‚Äôm a bit underweight, but I‚Äôm bloated now from all the purging and dietary changes. 

At first, it was skipping meals, but now food is too comforting and so I purge instead. I don‚Äôt even insane amounts, but I still eat more than I should, especially when I‚Äôm stressed or upset. 

I also have depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, and PMDD, none of which are helping my case. 

Yes, I‚Äôm seeking treatment, but I think it would be really nice to have somebody going through something similar. 

But please, don‚Äôt contact me if you aren‚Äôt looking for recovery. I wish you the best, but right now my best friend is going through something similar without trying to recover and it only pulls me down farther. Again, I wish you the best but I have to be responsible enough to watch out for myself. 

I can talk through Reddit, WhatsApp, texting, email, Google Hangouts, or Snapchat. 

Thank you and I really do hope the best for all of you.', "Kelsey (she/her) or Casey (they/them)

["Could someone give me an anarchist perspective of Czechoslovakia's Velvet Revolution? 
 So I had read through the first chapter of <ITALIC> How Nonviolence Protects the State and while I thought it did a good job of illustrating the failings of some nonviolent protests, I felt that it wasn't quite comprehensive enough. Namely, I feel like it left out some important comments about nonviolent revolutions that <ITALIC> were successful, the first one coming to my mind being the <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> that happened in Czechoslovakia in 1989.

I can already imagine what some anarchists may have to say about it, such as that it can't be a true revolution because it was merely transferring power from one head of state to another. However, if such a massive political upheaval was achieved seemingly without the use of violence, then I don't think it's too untruthful to say that nonviolence can be effective in political struggle. Is this correct at all?

(For the record, I'm not completely against violence, and think it is 1000% justified against violent oppressors. ["for the people downvoting: 

they mean technically men don't have genitalia on their chest. not that women do.", "While I agree that you should be allowed to defend your property, you also have to keep in mind that the looters are still people and don't deserve to die for their poor actions. I know the chaos makes it difficult to get police involved because they're already stretched so thin but there are still other options other than a gun (tasers, pepper spray, et cetera). Nobody deserves to die without fair trial.", "me too, man, me too. we've been on here too long.", "Tales of a Broom Closet Witch 
 Sorry if this is kind of a rant. I'm just really upset right now and I process things best when I write them out. 

Let's start from the beginning. I suffer from severe depression and anxiety. I recently converted to Wicca because the mindfulness techniques and meditations help me to feel more at one with myself and the Earth. But conversely, I know how much trouble I would be in if my mother found out, so I'm constantly paranoid. 

Today my dad saw me taking candles downstairs for my meditation. It's just about the only way I can sleep at night anymore and I've had a really shit day so I just needed some time to reflect. He told me I wasn't allowed to use candles. I am sixteen fucking years old. I think I know how to light a fucking candle. 

So now, I'm stressed from school, stressed about social drama, stressed about family drama, stressed that my mom's gonna find out I've been practicing Wicca, stressed about the screaming I hear upstairs where my parents are surely fighting. And though I could meditate without a candle, I feel like I've already sacrificed so much of this religion just to avoid being found out. 

I guess it's just frustrating because this always happens. I always have to give up the things I'm passionate about to please my parents. And I know that sounds dumb and angsty, but it's true. I'm so, so tired of being their puppet. I just want to be eighteen already."]

["Huntsville radio stations that play Christmas music? 
 I only ever listen to one radio station so I don't really know any others. What are some stations that play Christmas music?", "Personally I only have one every few years, I know I have them and they never bother me. The most annoying thing about it is being taken to the hospital and having time taken from my day I could be doing something else. 
Personally I don't see me any different than anyone else other than my brain poops out sometimes and I can't legally drive a taxi. Other than that, what's there to accept?

I've always looked at it as someone with a hurt arm, which is ironic for me since my seizures have actually messed up my shoulder so much I've had to get surgery. Either way it's no different than that. I'm still just as functional as the next guy, so i never felt any different than anyone else.", "When your feet are hurting from being on them all day, why do they hurt more when you get off of them? 
 I've been wondering this for awhile. I've worked jobs where I'm on my feet all right hours and my feet are killing me, but then I come home and lay down and they hurt more. 
I just think it's strange.", "How can I get a proof of residence? 
 Sorry if this is the wrong sub, I'm not sure where else to post it.

I live in Alabama and currently in the process of changing my name. In order to, I am required to show my proof of residence. I am still living with my parents and their names are on all of the utility bills so I wouldn't be able to use those.

['He needs some spirit gum, that will STICK. Probably hurt super bad trying to get it out tho.', 'The elegantly draped bedsheet did it for me', 'Monochromatic copper makeup to match my nails! Feeling genderqueer AF', 'How to dispose of used T vials / How to get rid of empty T bottles 
 I volunteered with syringe exchange programs for many years now. At syringe exchange programs, we learn the proper way to dispose of used needles, syringes and biohazards. I also have a degree in public health. Putting empty glass vials of used medications in syringe containers is an appropriate way to get rid of some thing that A: will be sharp if it breaks and B: should not be put in a regular landfill where the medication can get into the ground water.

Again, glass vials of testosterone will be sharp if they break in a regular trashcan. This puts waste management workers at risk of injury. Do not throw your empty small breakable glass vials of testosterone in the garbage.

Additionally, testosterone can be absorbed through the skin if you come in contact with it. It is also an environmental pollutant that can affect wildlife. Do not put it in a landfill where it can get into the soil/groundwater. Putting it in your sharps container where it can be safely incinerated with other medical waste is appropriate.

You can also use alternate containers than sharps containers if you have no other option and are looking for a way to safely get rid of your used sharps. Look for a bottle made of thick plastic that cannot be punctured by needles. I would recommend laundry detergent bottles because they are large, easy to find, and very sturdy. I have also heard of others using thick plastic milk cartons. Make sure to duct tape the lid shut when you are done using it. Write biohazard on the container in large letters so that others know not to open it. Dispose of it in the same locations as you would a regular sharps container.

Edit: source <LINK>/']

['TIL: Euthymia is the psychological big word for a neutral mood.', 'Why I Chose Catholicism - from a former Evangelical 
 I just wrote a short love song for Catholicism for an obscure post in the bottom of AskReddit, and I thought I'd also share it here. The question was: "Why do you feel like your religion is right?"

As a former evangelical protestant who converted to being a Catholic over a ton of issues, there's a lot of things that make me very pleased with my choice. The fact that there is a massive amount of writing and history behind the vast majority of church ideas (No, "because, that's why" which I got all the time as a protestant) and many "rites" or varieties of worship, all with the same essential center point in Christ.

The fact that questions and dialogue were welcomed even on divisive matters, far more than I thought they would be, and that the average priest I encountered had acceptable and even profound answers, not to mention other devoted Catholics. There was an abundance of studied belief among devout practicing Catholics, not just blind acceptance.

I was pleased by the time and financial commitment to the social good so many Catholics have - a ton of devoted Catholics are in service and helping professions. The majority of us love science, rhetoric, and logic and use it in discussion, which often surprises people without a faith system who haven't met someone in a religious system that welcomes these things, though it's not as uncommon even in other religious systems as people with no religious background may have experienced. Devout Catholics take after Jewish people in their interest in discussions without easy answers.

The encouragement to care for the earth and each other and even ourselves with self-worth, and the acknowledgement that we are not naturally good.

Honestly, the list is pretty long.

All of these things suited me, but above all, I do believe in the God of the Bible, and that the Bible is an anthology of works that pertain to his acts and presence in the world, and the records of people in history that can help us today - and that there are thousands more saints throughout history whose record is added to that. If it were just the Bible, that would be one thing. But the record of many who like I do today, worshipped and strived to become the human they were created to be... That's inspiring. The Catholicism I chose makes me strive to be better, kinder, more aware of the needs and desires of others - not just Jesus. 

I had Jesus before Catholicism. He made me want to be better, but I didn't feel like I had a great path. Catholicism gave me the path to walk on. And I am grateful to the many thousands who packed it down. 

And to all of you on the journey with me, Peace be with you.', "Whichever side, but always close to the front so the chalice isn't empty before we get there...", "What is the biggest fear that you've completely overcome?"]

['Half-smile and willing hands 
 Does anyone practice these skills as part of Radical Acceptance? How and when do you do it? Do you find half-smile and willing hands helpful?

Personally, I find half-smile quite challenging. I know all the theory, but I am not accepting of half-smile as a skill. The name annoys me, my facial muscles get sore from lifting the corners of my mouth. This idea of forcing myself to smile feels uncomfortable. 

With my reasonable mind I tell myself about being willing to accept (and I think I am willing), however my emotion mind is not cooperative when it comes to half-smile or willing hands.

Has anyone else had difficulty applying these skills into practice? How did you cope?', 'Can you take a few days off work?', 'Are these famous sockies comfy? Do they let you keep them?', 'Your psychiatrist has probably seen many patients who have not been 100% compliant, and knows how to deal with it.

 It was not in the US so the price would not tell you much. Let's say it was a price of restaurant meal for 3-4 people.

['Liam during a performance in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, December 1999', 'Nah this is from the Wish You Were Here Immersion Box Seat. This version has actually been on YouTube for years.', 'Daily Song Discussion - Crazy Beat (Think Tank) 
 Next song we‚Äôre looking in the discussions is Crazy Beat, the second single released from the album and one of the more divisive songs in Blur‚Äôs discography. Lyrically I have no idea what the song is about. They seem to draw inspiration from the off-the-wall lyricism of Song 2, as Damon sings about giving the president ecstasy amongst other bizarre statements. 

Musically the song also seems to borrow greatly from Song 2, being a loud rock song that is completely different from the trip hop of Ambulance or the acoustic tranquility of Out Of Time. Dave gives a spirited performance on the drums and Damon does a serviceable job emulating Graham‚Äôs fast and heavy riffing on Song 2. Perhaps the most infamous element of the song however is the electronic voice that repeats the song‚Äôs title throughout the song. We have heard something similar to this in B.L.U.R.E.M.I, but the duck-like voice is part of the reason why the song isn‚Äôt one of Blur‚Äôs more universally liked tunes.

Lyrical highlight: N/A

Musical highlight: Drum work, guitar work

Best performers: Dave

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', 'Sort of sad that a song this amazing only got to no. 26 in the charts.']

Mine then casts a curse on yours and it becomes a race against time for yours.

["I think this is a generational thing (no offense, OP). My grandma always kept the Aunt Jemima in the pantry. ['That is an amazing explanation, but I have to admit, no judgment, I did a double take at "My boyfriend and his wife."', 'A lot of people seem to be focusing on the Discord Server part, so I just wanted to pipe up.

Having doubts is okay. It's natural. There isn't exactly a guide for this, and because of what it is, it's different for everyone. Things make me doubt myself all the time. It feels like every time I have a thought that isn't what someone could consider "girly" a spike a doubt lances through me. 

Like a few weeks ago, I was helping my grandparents with stuff. I cut up some wood for my grandma, and helped my grandpa work on his car, and I felt good doing it, lifting heavy stuff, and doing dirty jobs, and working with my hands, but it seemed like every time I wasn't thinking about whatever I was doing, I was racked with "Does the fact that I'm enjoying myself while doing typically male activities mean I'm not trans? Does the fact that lifting heavy things doesn't make me dysphoric mean I've just been fooling myself this whole time?"

Ultimately, no one can tell you whether you're trans or not, <ITALIC> you have to decide it for <ITALIC> yourself. Even if you're doubting yourself, even if you aren't feeling super dysphoric, the fact that you're even wondering means something. I don't think you'd be lying if you just didn't bring it up because it's frankly no one else's business if you're doubting yourself.

I hope you find your answer though. You deserve to be comfortable in your own skin.', "Question Time, Lilies and Lillies! What kind of Lily/Lilly are you? 
 There are so many different kinds of Lilies (the flower,) and I'm suuuuuuper duper curious what kind of lily you think you are!

Personally, I think I'm either a Flame Lily, because I'm a redhead, or a Stargazer Lily, because I love love <BOLD-ITALIC> LOVE Space and Astronomy!", "I'm not an egg <STRIKE> anymore, but I need to do this, and this is exactly what I'm worried about."]

["I'm actually not cis but thank you for thinking so! Guess I'm doing well! FTM 23 :)", "Don't spread yourself too thin. I took on way too much in extracurriculars and I burned myself out. I wanted to do my best in my organization and help others as much as I could, but my academics suffered because I couldn't manage everything. I also wasn't taking good care of myself, so my mental health suffered too. This year I am focusing only on academics and self-care, as well as working on time management strategies. Maybe I'll be more involved in the future, but I would need to put myself first.", 'Thank you so much. It helps to hear about others who took their time, makes me feel like it is okay to go at my own pace. Financially I worry about things, but I have my first four years covered at least.', "Besides taking part in PrideWestern's or Spectrum's events I found it difficult to meet other queer students on campus if I didn't already know them. I'm taking a step back from those organizations though for personal reasons, so I totally get wanting to meet people outside of that. I've had some success in Women's Studies courses.\r\n\r\nIf you ever wanna chat I'm very gay but like to keep a low profile. It'd be nice if there was a queer chat room/discord/subreddit for Western students.", 'My pup Vincent, happy in his muzzle and in the sun. Hope to get him a new one with more pant room.']

["Toplane main looking to pick up Rengar for top. Is it worth it? 
 Seeing how the kitty seems to do well in toplane, and how I got a bit tired of the same bruisers every game that I play, I figures I could try something new.

I never played Rengar in my life, too. I'm not even sure if it's worth learning Rengar right now.

And another note -- I might move to jg soon too, so I wouldn't mind starting playing Rengar in jg at first if necessary. And yet another note -- <ITALIC> I'm low elo, silver/low-gold.

Anyways, I have multiple questions. A lot, actually.

<ITALIC>  <BOLD> Is it worth it right now? Or should I just look for something else?
 <BOLD> Is he good into ranged top overall? I saw matchup charts so I know the worst matchups. Oh, and <BOLD> how hard is it to play safe as him?
<ITALIC>  <BOLD> Is he hard to pick up? He seems a bit confusing so far to me with the ferocity mechanic. I think I'll figure it out after some time in practice tool, and when I'll look up combos though...
 <BOLD> Is there any special tricks to use in lane as him to use him to full potential? I assume it's abusing bushes, but is there something else besides usual toplane stuff?
<ITALIC>  <BOLD> What's the build and order of buying? I think I figured runes out by browsing this sub. As for summoner spells, I assume it's flash TP like on most of the other toplaners, am I correct<ITALIC> ?
 <BOLD> What's the general focus? What to do, and what's his win condition? What's his role in the team composition?

Huge thanks to anyone who answers at least a few of those.




EDIT: Good Lord is this champ fun toplane! I felt like I actually had impact for once.", "Should I pick up Corki mid? Or someone else? 
 Mid main here, lookin' to play some new champs in mid cuz I got tired of playing Yas, Talon, TF and (sometimes) Pyke. Wonder if Corki is a good idea rn. In pro play he's apparently meta, but is he any good or fun in soloq? Should I pick him up or maybe look for someone else? If so, who?   
I also have idea to try Azir. I've tried him earlier at some point in time and really liked it (plus I absolutely love  this <BOLD-ITALIC> b i r d    d a d d y lore-wise and personality-wise) but I'm not sure if I should try him again for real this time and actually learn him.

['I would love to research stuff, in fact, I‚Äôve had the research station set on level 9 priority all game. The only thing my duplicants are doing are oxygen tasks even though I have everything else on a higher priority.', 'I‚Äôm aggressively nice. 

In high school I had a weird brain tumor and in my sophomore year I dealt with sexual assault followed by a pregnancy that I lost. After I graduated I got kicked out by my parents after they learned that I am a trans man as well, and spent the next couple of years couch surfing around California until I met my partner who has helped me reach at least a little bit of stability. There was a person I knew who flat out refused to believe any of this, and would demand that I show him proof. I was so determined not to be like him that I decided to actively search for ways to give people the benefit of the doubt. That was six years ago.

My partner and I live with a roommate who has been difficult to say the least, refusing to clean up after his dog, insisting that he pay less than his fair share of rent because ‚Äúyou guys can afford it‚Äù (barely, with very little food money left over). I went drinking with him a couple times with another one of my friends and now he‚Äôs paying a third of rent, looking after his dog (and sometimes mine when I‚Äôm feeling depressed), trying to help me get a job, and letting me know when there‚Äôs problems. He also grabs free meal coupons from his work and gives them to us when he knows he‚Äôll be late on rent.

Being nice has helped me more than anything else has. I still get mad, but most people accept late responses over hasty rudeness.', 'Ftm trans man, early 20s. All the men I‚Äôve dated as an adult have turned out to be trans women who just haven‚Äôt realized it yet, but I did date mostly guys in high school. Because of how American culture views platonic affection between men, dating a man is nice because I get to feel like I‚Äôm the only person who gets to publicly show them affection. Dating a woman is nice as well, because I get to feel like I‚Äôm the most important person to her that shows her affection.', 'While that‚Äôs a fair point, I doubt that this particular post, with no information, no context, or anything that might clue you in to any of that doesn‚Äôt seem like the place where you can be 100% sure that this is just someone complaining. For all you know, this is someone who‚Äôs 25 and unable to move out for whatever reason. You don‚Äôt really have the context to say that this is clearly not abuse', 'My BMI, much like your IQ, is a solid 25']

['The exact dosage and effects vary between people and medical histories, so it would be best to speak with a doctor familiar and versed with transitioning. Huge, round dining room with a ballroom in the middle, separated by a 3/4 wall on the top and a curtain on the bottom 1/4. White with gold Damascus print wallpaper, gold trim, and the red curtain. Fancy tables with lamps and candles all around with various people from different historical eras sitting at them. My mother and I were part of the serving staff for some reason. I'm serving a man and woman from probably around 1900-1910, when the man drops his fork and it slides under the curtain. I crawl under the table to get it, and there's a fucking T-Rex in the middle of the ballroom. I back out, and speed-walk back to the kitchen to try to warn somebody. I try to tell my mom, but then screaming starts, and there's fucking velociraptors attacking people in the dining room. The T-Rex roars, everyone runs for the emergency exit. Eventually, we reach this HUGE, dead tree hanging over the cliff. We start climbing it to escape the rex, but it tries to climb after us, and the tree breaks. We all fall down, and somehow during the fall, the rex ends up under me ready to eat me. Then I wake up. Every time."]

Hey folks, I‚Äôve got a wakeup shortcut that takes me through all my comms apps (snap, Gmail, messenger...). Often, I‚Äôll finish reading my emails, pop back over to shortcuts to trigger that sweet sweet wait to return, and find that the shortcut has timed out and I have to start over. I updated my OS last night, and now it feels like I have even less time. Is there some setting for this, tucked away someplace strange? It‚Äôs rather irritating. Thanks!', 'I'm not the first to say this, but I think I'm the first to say only this. 

"Dorian is a major scale that starts and ends on the two" is True, but isn't Helpful. It's more useful to think of modes this way:

Ionian: major

Dorian: minor, warmed by a major 6

Phrygian: minor, spiced with a flat 2

Lydian: major, brightened with a sharp 4

Mixolydian: major, soured with a flat 7

Aolean: minor

Locrian: minor, unsettled by a flat 2 and flat 7

The thinking is more about parallel scales (same root) than relative scales (same pitch collection). So, rather than saying "I want this F<HEADING> - material to be majory, so I'll use A major", you could say something like "I want this F#- material to be warmer, so I'll use F# dorian by highlighting D#". 

Hope that helps!']

Hope you're recovering well from your accident and i'm so happy for you and how well things went for you nonetheless!!", 'I don't see it that way.

"Preference" is when i say i prefer to wear long coats over jackets. Or rather eat bananas over apples.

It's not a "preference" to want nintendo to be more inclusive of their male players, and players who want to express themselves masculine. It's not a "preference" to want an equality wide spectrum of clothes to choose from. This isn't something based on what i prefer, this is something a game should do from the beginning. There's no reason for a game to treat male/more masculine players worse than female/more feminine players - not even if the game is hugely played by female/more feminine players. Sure, it's not as serious in a game like this - but treating minorities worse because "they're the minority" was never a good idea. 

I do however agree on the fact that they shouldn't make masculine clothes cheaper or more expensive than feminine clothes, just because they're more rare or something. Both should have their more expensive ones and their less expensive versions. Though i do not see a problem with this right now. Yes, there are dresses that are more expensive than the coats they sell right now - but there's also options that cost less.

And again overall, it is much easier to get a dress. The gardening event have it, most of the fortune cookies have it. Numerous events have it. 

-

Also, what you might talk about is "priority". My highest priority right now is nintendo giving us more masculine clothes. Your highest priority right now is that they cost less. And yes, in this case, you are right, this is something that arguing about is useless. It doesn't affect anyone, so your priority doesn't have to be mine.', "Yeah, i had my friend code in my flair. I didn't think my post would take off as much as it did and now i had to change my flair because i don't want leave people hanging"]

["I'm 18 months into otr and I'm really curious how you're able to take big chunks of time off for relaxing. My company pays me very well but they only let me leave the truck for 4 days tops. I'd love to work 6 months on, 6 off but I can't seem to find a company that's ok with that. Do you just bounce around btwn companies?", "05 Chevy express making squeaky hamster wheel noise. Hamster runs faster at high rpms. Seems to be coming from this part, which shakes/vibrates a bit when running. What's it called? How urgent/expensive is the fix?", "Probably but I haven't counted lol. There was originally a label covering the whole transparent part of the container", "Stayed in Denver for about 1.5 months. Biggest challenge was having to keep moving. City dwelling typically means never staying in one place longer than ~10 hours. Even if it's just around the block to your other spots it does start to get old. 

It also took at least a week to put together a list of good spots. Some spots are definitely better than others. It can take a while to find enough so that you can rotate through the. without being at the same one(s) too long/too often.

Other big challenge is heat. In the wilderness you can just set up outside in some shade, no problem. In the city you'll be limited to parks, libraries etc, as camp chairs in the Walmart parking lot are generally frowned upon... Vans also heat up quicker when parked on hot asphalt all day. If it gets above 75 where you're at, you should plan on spending almost all your daylight hours either outside the van or driving with the AC on."]

["I also just added a link to the original post I was referring to in this one; there's so many other ways to do this so it might be nice to get more ideas! :)

edit: I'll add it here too:

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", "Deadname magick update 
 Hi guyssss a while back I made a post asking for advice on how to release/banish my dead name. For a little backstory I‚Äôm non-binary and transitioning and I felt like my dead name (trans terminology for birth name that you don‚Äôt use anymore) was dragging behind me; so I decided that I needed to part with my dead name in order to move forward with my new name. 

EDIT: Here's the link to the original post as there are so many great suggestions that might be what aligns with your needs better if you're interested! 

<LINK>/

I‚Äôm gonna talk about how I prepared first but will put a ‚Äú**‚Äù symbol where I actually talk about the ritual if that‚Äôs all you want to read. 

I ended up incorporating a bunch of ideas together to come up with what I ended up doing. BUT FIRST I wanted to say that I didn‚Äôt actually do any sort of ritual until about two months later, and I didn‚Äôt plan on doing the ritual the day I did it, I just woke up and I knew that I was ready. The two months before I actually did the ritual, I started going by my new name (Leo!) and came to all the supportive people in my life and asked them to use that for me including they/them pronouns. I still felt my dead name clinging to my identity, I didn‚Äôt realize it until selkigirl mentioned it, but I‚Äôm pretty sure it was dysphoria. So for me the first step was coming into my new name, creating more space for myself to really fit into the idea and essence that I really identified with in the name Leo, and slowly yet unknowingly created less space for my dead name to have a place in my life. not sure if that sentence made sense but yeah lol. 

I also took a recommendation from another user (can‚Äôt remember who it was but if you‚Äôre reading this THANK YOU SO SO MUCH) to write my dead name on a piece of paper and try to make it beautiful, it was kind of like exposure therapy in a way, but it helped me realize that I did have negative feelings for my dead name and also let me see it and appreciate it in a ‚Äúyou aren‚Äôt my name anymore, but that doesn‚Äôt mean I have to hate you‚Äù kind of way. I meditated on how I wanted to feel when I would be called my new name, and I actually used a crystal to meditate on this with and literally two or three days later it vanished from existence, which for me means that the crystal has served its purpose. That was really encouraging for me and helped me solidify the bond I created with my new name. 

I won‚Äôt lie, I didn‚Äôt meditate on a regular basis, but I did when it felt right and that was enough for me. 

** So, to talk about the actual ritual!! It was actually really nice for me. I did this on May 22nd, which was a new/dark moon in gemini. For me gemini represents rapid change and that energy along with the dark moon energy was super strong and hopeful and I knew I was ready. First I cleansed myself with some deep breathing and a little palo santo. Then I took a white strip of cloth, long enough to tie around my wrist, and wrote my new name on it. I also took the piece of paper that had my beautified dead name on it, left the soon-to-be name tag/strip of cloth on the desk in my room, and headed outside. Since I live in a city it wasn‚Äôt pitch black or perfectly silent, but I looked into the dark-moon-sky and I FELT silent. It was really peaceful and beautiful. It felt like the entire world was in the universes womb. I listened to some Tibetan singing bowl tracks on Spotify and just meditated standing up. I imagined myself as a baby, just floating around, not having any name or label or gender forced on me, not identifying as anything other than a pure, un-stained soul. 

Although I probably should have done this before imagining myself as a unnamed being, I next took the piece of paper with my dead name on it, and started reflecting on it. Thanking it for getting me to where I am, and really really being thankful for it. I made sure to make it clear that the only thing I was releasing was the dead name, not any part of myself that it was attached to, as another person who reached out in my original post told me that their detachment from their old name was so effective they lost all their ID (thank you to you too!!!). Then I took the paper, thanked it out loud, then I burned it. I could have buried it or put it in a jar, but burning it felt like the most effective way to symbolize that it held no power over me anymore. 

For me this was all I had to do to feel like I had released it, since I spent a good amount of time welcoming my new name and connecting to it, my dead name already felt insignificant and letting it go was relatively easy. 

After I went back to meditating on that feeling of not being labelled yet, I went back inside to take a bath. This was sort of suggested by someone as well, I can‚Äôt remember how much of this was their idea and how much was my own but if you suggested this thank you!!! I took a bath in the pitch dark and really put myself in that feeling of not being labelled, like an unborn baby. (Side note: I didn‚Äôt try to actually be a baby in the womb, but emulated that unlabelled feeling that Age regressing was not something that I did, but if it helps others cope then by all means go for it as long as you‚Äôre not hurting yourself or anyone else. Also idk if ‚Äúunborn baby‚Äù is tone deaf but I mean this strictly in the terms of what feeling I was trying to feel. I support reproductive rights!) 

After the bath, I went to my room, and I tied the strip of cloth with my new name on it to my wrist and said ‚ÄúI claim this name for myself. It is done‚Äù and I went to bed. I wore the bracelet for three days straight afterwards. I‚Äôm gonna bury it on the full moon if it feels right :)

I mentioned dysphoria at the beginning, wanted to clarify that even though I have released my dead name, I am still being called by it every day by family. So it still created dysphoria but the difference is now I don‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs coming from myself, the dysphoria is coming from outer circumstances. It obviously isn‚Äôt great but I know in my heart that that is not my name anymore, it has definitely become easier to handle. I do hope my identity can be respected by my family at one point though. <BOLD> ** I‚Äôm also saying all of this for myself, what worked for me won‚Äôt work for everyone and this isn‚Äôt like the cure to dysphoria by any means!!! 

Thank you so so much for everyone that helped, even if I didn‚Äôt use your suggestion the support alone was monumental I‚Äôve never felt so supported in my life thank you thank you thank you. I hope this helps someone that is wanting to transition.", "THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!! It means a lot and I'm so grateful that allies like you exist thank you thank you thank you BLESSED BE <3333", 'Thank you so much, this is the first time I ever heard of the LBRP but I‚Äôm gonna start learning today and start practicing it when I feel like I know enough. Thank you so so much for your support your comment made me cry a little lol thank you thank you thank youüíòüíòüíòüíòüíòüíòüíòüíò']

["ATTN: Ammo damage multis changed (intensified) as of 1/22/18 morning. 
 Basically, everything is super fuckin specialized now. I think it's horrible, because a good player can use their secondaries and primaries intelligently and be way more relevant at both ranges than they ever should be. It's rewarding for skill and clever layout construction, but it's going to break the fuck out of the game.

Also, we still have a few ridiculous guns.

M60 retains its 2-hit with HP, however, it goes down to about 21ish damage at its min. However, it has a 120 stud max damage range.  So fuck that. It's still super overpowered.

The SSR now gets a torso 1shot with AP at around 180 studs, and gets a headshot a bit earlier, and still retains its 2shot to the torso. So fuck that too.

And, perhaps most absurd of all, the 1858, again. This time, with a torso 1shot - out to 75 studs, the 1858 is now a torso 1shot with HP. Fuck that as well. 

I used all of these things, they're all super fucking overpowered. Please try again, Stylis.

E: Thanks for the pin, mods.

E2: I do want to also say that typically I make a point of my criticism being fair and understanding, but deliberate. Unfortunately, this is a case of excessively terrible design and excessively terrible PR. I'm happy to be classy and respectful with Stylis, but that same treatment is very seldom returned. Hypo gets a special mention for trying, but no one dragonman can cover for the apathy and disconnect of the whole studio; proof being that this ammo insanity came way the fuck out of left field.

Don't be cunts, guys, but you've been mistreated by the devs of the game and I don't think it's right to take abuse and be completely saintly in return. Voice your distaste! Just do it tactfully and with reason, please. If a piece of the community handles this properly, maybe Stylis will finally begin to pay attention to a piece of the community in earnest.", 'Mixed speed endurance GP in Edinburgh. Dollar sign for optimization :p (from Greendale Super Sprint, by Goofier Shoes)', "Black and white Diablo; the text isn't my work, but the rest of the lines are. Very painstaking!", "Is Warehouse going to come to the CTE? 
 I'm really enjoying the CTE and I saw Warehouse got added to the base game but not the CTE. With the main game update not coming for a while I'd appreciate the catering to both crowds."]

There are timed safes on amazon that you can buy to lock your phone in for a few hours, you should give that a go if you think you can't resist texting her for a few hours. You could lock your phone in there for say, 2 hours to start with and go paint or play basketball or write or anything you feel like, really. ['She asked if my friends thought she was trans after she met them and I said to my knowledge that they didnt. Im ok with not being open about it if it helps avoid confrontational situations though. 

If my friends ever found out I know they wouldnt care. My family would be a different story.', 'I knew she was trans beforehand so I knew what I was getting myself into. I didnt care. I was attracted to her and I love her personality.  


Now from my perspective as a cis man the rules are pretty straight forward. On dating apps for instance women typically disclose that they are trans in their profiles. So I dont think they should be at fault because some jackass didnt read the fine print because they were too busy swiping left and right on their Tinder account.   


As for meeting trans women in public. I dont think thats anyones business for a trans woman to disclose her trans identity to a man whos hitting on her in the bar. That should be a matter of personal preference and not some affirmed default of responsibility. If youre the person who gos for one night stands then yes rest assure a trans woman would probably tell you about herself before actually getting it on.   


Now if youre the guy that meets a nice girl, you hit it off well, and you get her number I think that would be a good time to for her to tell you that theyre trans just out of courtesy. Its probably best to disclose that before any kissing or intimacy. Thats just me though. I dont claim to have the right answer for this and maybe a trans woman would offer a better perspective.', 'Are you older? Just trying to gauge your age group. I have a brother who is gay (Im 31 and hes pushing 50) so the gay bars I go with him have a more "mature" patronage.   


Bar life in general is more suited to younger audiences. Im just curious if your distaste for the LGBTQ community is more on a generational factor', 'Hey guys. If anyone here plays Mario Maker and has levels that they want to get out. My channel (<LINK>) will gladly collab with anyone here']

["<QUOTE>

Don't worry. If there's one thing Trump does well, it's humility.", "Here in Albuquerque NM the majority of dogs at shelters are pitbulls. I dont think people are assholes for adopting an elderly putbull. My neighbors have a dog like that and shes a sweet thing, shy cuz she was abused by the original asshole. I dont blame the breed, I blame the owners who keep them as weapons.

However, my other neighbors pitbull attacked me like 30 sec after he said it wouldn't. Theres not a 1 bite law here, but i think i have a right to kill that dog if he gets his head over the wall again, the owner knows it and i havent seen the dog since.  We are working together to get fencing in place.", "It's happening because the people who work in the slaughterhouses are getting sick with Covid19. I lived in Iowa for a couple of years, and my neighbors were an older Mexican couple. My wife is Mexican, so they became like family to us the day we moved in. The woman, Benita, worked at a corporate slaughterhouse. Her husband Javier worked at the Tyson food processing plant there in Council Bluffs.

They retired a couple years ago and moved back to Chihuahua. Benita came home from work every day stinking of dead cows and in pain from backbreaking labor. My wife cared for her after surgery and has told me the horror stories.

Those meat processing plants are unsafe under normal circumstances. It's why the industry relies on immigrant labor. Yet, this administration could care less about them. These immigrant workers aren't even entitled to the stimulus payments, and now Trump is giving meat processors an executive order to keep operating, telling them they are exempt from safety liability.

I think this highlights the problems with animal agriculture. Experts believe that the influenza epidemic 100 years ago was started at a hog farm in Kansas.  The antibiotics we give animals to increase meat yield actually create medication-resistant superbugs.

On top of that, add cruelty to animals, greenhouse gas, and habitat loss from all the cropland needed to support our meat habit. And our tax dollars pay for that.

Perhaps this is a good time to look at plant-based meat substitutes instead.", "She just said it would be hard to get anything from it. The landlord wont tell me his insurance policy and won't give me the lease that says he's not responsible. Also I have homeowners insurance and my policy does not cover pitbulls. I think I would have to go to small claims court get the outcome i want. Money would be great but I don't think I'll be seeing much from these guys. I go to the VA and all my medical is free. Theirs is a shitty house, tenant makes glass weed pipes for a living.  However I would like that dog gone, and make sure he doesn't have any more like that."]

She replied with ‚Äúevidence‚Äù which was an article from the Federalist that basically just said ‚ÄòXYZ reported that there was teargas and people were forced away from the church but that‚Äôs not true‚Äô over and over with each major station listed but no real additional evidence. I pointed out that the author was a Fox News correspondent and all her articles were about Fake News Conspiracy BS, and that there‚Äôs no reason to believe that the bishop of the church would lie.  She then went on to say that MAYBE THE CHURCH WAS BEING PAID OFF TO LIE ABOUT BEING TEARGASSED AND NOT PRE-WARNED THAT TRUMP WAS COMING.  Because apparently she thinks THAT is more than Trump making a speech calling for ‚Äúdominating‚Äù protestors and then showing the media how he can force protesters out of his way.', 'What happens when my chonker Spyro thinks I‚Äôve been paying more attention to my phone than him.', 'My husband has ARFID, not me, but since no one else has commented yet, I‚Äôll jump in. When I get there I will decide if I‚Äôm going to eat or not.‚Äù  Then if/when you get to the table and if/when you‚Äôre feeling like you want to eat the chicken thinking ‚Äúokay now I‚Äôm going to try a bite, but just that one bite for now, I don‚Äôt have to worry about eating all of it, I can always stop after this bite if I want to.‚Äù  For him it‚Äôs more getting started eating that‚Äôs the hardest and once he‚Äôs there with a safe food he‚Äôs usually fine, but it‚Äôs a battle to get to the table and take the first bite. ['Totally interested in licorice basil. Thank you so much for your kindness!', 'It seems like they're encountering their weaknesses a lot more than they are facing their strengths. No one likes to face their weaknesses. I think you need to go on the opposite end of the spectrum and allow your players (depending on the level) to be the champions-- the showstoppers. The heroes that they are supposed to be. Highlight their strengths, throw mobs that might be underleveled for them and watch them goomba stomp them to the ground. 

I think you should also reconsider how you select your monsters. I go for terrain/vibe/theme first, throw in things that seem interesting and make sense, and then look at stats and stuff later. If my monster is say, a very smart lich that is very proficient in spells, naturally they would figure out that the party isn't the smartest or wisest... after 3-4 turns of observation. It's a balancing act.

Also if all else fails, ask your players what they want, and then look into what you want. If they wanna brave the world, RP with no challenges whatsoever, that's their wants, BUT if you don't want to do that there is no disgrace in saying "I'm sorry, but I simply do not want to run that kind of campaign". Good luck!', 'Idk, maybe? The direct eye contact (from cat) and rather stiff posture leads me to think otherwise .... when cats knead and suckle blankets, they‚Äôre slowly blinking, very gentle and uh... not trying to rearrange dog faces... ['I'm definitely not a born natural and I wouldn't say I was "<ITALIC> bad" either. I definitely stumbled up. 

As a teenager I was very shy and reserved and slowly broke out of my shell by my late teens. Though even at twenty I was still somewhat socially awkward and reserved but a bit more outgoing. When I was 20 (and moreso at 21) I forced myself into seeking a wide variety of different social situations. From meet-up groups, parties, clubs, and even <ITALIC> karaoke. 

Honestly karaoke definitely helped build a solid foundation for me to build off of. 

I put myself out there, interacted with a ton of different people, and took different and even unique opportunities to learn and grow socially. I paid attention to behaviors, ticks, facial expressions to better read others and made myself initiate a lot of conversation.

["Stocks while they're at low low prices thanks to the current climate.", "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. 

Releasing a bunch of dinosaurs out into the world <ITALIC> should be a bad ending. But they're portraying it as a good thing that all the dinosaurs were set free to run wild on an unsuspecting world.

Bringing dinosaurs back to life was never portrayed as ever having been right thing. Things go wrong and have always gone wrong when trying to defy nature's will and wrest away a modicum of control from her. Letting them die was supposed to be seen as the responsible thing to have done. Brutal consequences for messing with nature's plan. Brutal methods to rectify things.", "20% of my social anxiety for 10% social skills. 

Hey you didn't mention if they had to be good or bad attributes.", "Being a utility clerk. Which is a catch all for people who bag groceries, clean up messes and gather carts. 

It was very monotonous work, staying in one place to bag groceries in an expedient manner. I'm not a people person by any means, so dealing with so many people trying to make small talk, direct me on how to do my job, talking to me on a first name basis. It was very taxing. Not to mention how haphazardly they'd leave carts everywhere, with their garbage inside them and the child seats locked in place. 

You want to loose faith in humanity? Work in retail."]

This is blessed.', "A Thank You to everyone who came before us 
 I'm a relatively new DnD player, and finding a game online or nearby has never been a huge struggle for me (besides my own anxieties). I cant imagine growing up during the Satanic Panic, or even as recently as 5ish years ago, when DnD wasnt as much a part of the mainstream as it is now. So this is just a short thank you letter, to everyone who stuck to their guns and played anyway. From the people playing First Edition with Gygax, the game at its infancy, to the people who helped pioneer 5th edition. From the small content creators on youtube, to the larger shows like Crit Role and The Adventure Zone. Every single one of you, no matter whether you're a player who inspired a friend to join, or a DM in a shop helping people learn, you're all incredible, and you've all paved the way for us, the people who are able to join campaigns at the snap of a finger nowadays. Thank you all"]

["That's terrible, I'm glad you're healing now though. Was it spontaneous or did it like build up over time?", "For one, when family members/aunties/uncles talk about LGBTQ issues, it would help to educate them and plant in them the idea that we're human and not just rebellious freaks.

When I came out to my parents for the first time, I quickly realized that this is probably the only exposure they've had to queer people. It would have helped if one of their (desi) friends had mentioned someone in their family who's gay and was accepted by their family (or some other occurrence like that) in casual conversation. That way, they would have been more receptive to the fact that their daughter is the same and that she can be accepted by her family.

If you have any queer friends who are accepted by their family, ASK THEM FIRST OBVIOUSLY, and maybe have a conversation with your family. Hopefully they'll walk away with the idea that if anyone in your family decides to come out, your family is also capable of accepting and loving them.", 'That's something I've noticed too as a gay woman. ['Tfw you bite the finger that feeds you', 'Onsens and medical tattoo? 
 I have a small (3√ó6cm) medical tattoo on my wrist that states my allergies and condition. Will any onsens make an exception or am I out of luck?', "Best way to paint a plastic doll w/o an airbrush? 
 I have 2 of the Voltageous Ghouls Monster High dolls. But they have hard plastic heads instead of vinyl, and their makeup will NOT come off with non-acetone remover. I want to change their skin tones anyway, so I was thinking I could just paint over it. Problem is, I don't have an airbrush. Is there another way to paint them that won't be streaky or too textured?

Sidenote: Anyone know a good dupe for Mr Superclear? Would spray-on matte Mod Podge work? I have pets and would prefer not to use toxic material.", "Starting my own GURPS campaign out of spite; need pointers 
 (Tl;Dr at bottom)

WHY:
I joined a GURPS campaign a few months ago, hadn't played before, but I HAVE played a LOT of DnD. I play my character, as one is SUPPOSED to do. The other players, though, clearly make decisions based on meta knowledge and have other issues, such as one not having any clear-cut motives at all. Lately, they've all been shitting on me, because my character has different morals and ideas, and its pissing me off. Ex. Said I wasn't worth much as a party member even though I was crucial in a huge fight where at least 2 of them probably would have died. They've also been ignoring story elements in favor of shitting on me. Ex. Said we were attacked because of something I did, when the attackers said they had been told to attack us before I even did the thing. They don't even try to understand my character, they just hate her. I thought that at least the GM was cool until tonight. Basically just railroaded me several times, and pulled some bullshit concerning one of my rolls.

NOW WHAT?:
So now I'm pissed af and I'm gonna read more of the books to devide world and such and try to find players to GM my own campaign on Roll20, because I KNOW it can be done better than this. People shit on GURPS a lot, but it's pretty clear once you get the hang of the basics.

Why GURPS and not DnD? I honestly like GURPS's system and think it's easier for beginner players who've never played an RPG before. And, simply to prove that the game CAN be run properly.

What I need now is campaign ideas and pointers. I know most things; which rolls default to what, etc. What are some things that I should know, that you might not think of at first.

<SUMMARY> Tried GURPS. Group is jerks. GMing my own game, because I want to try to have fun. Need advice.

Thanks!"]

["Pronouns/gender neutral terms \n I have recently realised I am non binary. Because of this I don't want to use she/her he/him pronouns. Most other enbys seem to use they/them however I don't particularly feel like they suit me if you get what I mean?? I am wondering if there are any other sets of pronouns that people use. As well as this what are some gender neutral terms for things like aunt/uncle, mother/father etc? Thanks!", "I'm non binary, for me it wasn't really a sense of looking in a mirror and not being happy with what's there (like I know a lot of peoples is), it was more seeing other people and thinking 'thats who I want to be'. I'm AFAB and I first I knew I was bi. Then I saw mlm gay couples and I would think 'i want that to be me', whilst also often liking being a girl. Dysphoria is different for everyone though, so you may be different. In general, it is when you think there something missing/something that should be there. Hope that helps!", "Everyone on here thinks it's correct APART from you... Maybe you are wrong. For future reference it is 'you're' when the sentence can be said with 'you are' instead of 'your' and it's 'your' when it's personal and possessive.", "You don't have to have had a relationship or anything to consider your self bisexual. LUC - 9", "Being referred for accutane. Frankly, I'm scared

I wanted to just go scorched earth on my acne and just get rid of it since last winter it really hurt, especially in the cold winds of my native Scotland. ["As someone who has epilepsy and just ordered a VR headset this is a legitimate fear of mine. I'm just glad the guy is ok though. 

This made me happy though, to see everyone actually stop what they were doing and try to help even if you couldn't really do much.

Also the guy was possibly on the floor for most of the time he was talking to all of you guys because seizures make you incredibly weak. Whenever I have one I the hardest time lifting myself up and I have to have help even walking. ", "She's half Chihuahua and half something else, or possibly just a Chihuahua I'm not too sure. Either way she's had four puppies so far.", "I have my license now, I was just wondering if there were any other people with epilepsy that would risk riding. 

As I get closer to buying the gear it starts freaking me out more. I don't fear having a seizure in a car because I have more of a chance of being safe (unless I fly off a mountain), but with a bike it's a bit different.


As you said though, I'm less likely to hurt someone on a bike though. I never thought about it that way.", "If Godzilla couldn't live in real life due to his weight/mass then why can big buildings like the Burj Khalifa? 
 So the other day I heard something about how they think the Brachiosaurus couldn't have lived on land due to it's massive mass and weight and that got me thinking about Godzilla and a video Vsauce made saying that he would collapse under his weight.



Me and a coworker we're talking about this and he mentioned how that doesn't make sens because we have big buildings like the Empire State Building and the Eiffel Tower that should collapse then with that logic. 


So how exactly does this work?"]

["Daily Song Discussion - No Distance Left To Run (13) 
 After spacey, extended jams and violent noise rock, we‚Äôre just about at the end of 13, with the penultimate track No Distance Left To Run being the song we‚Äôre looking at today. The song‚Äôs lyrics again address the breakdown in Damon‚Äôs and Justine Frischmann‚Äôs relationship, but they serve to act as a final statement on the break up. Damon is ultimately not bitter, but rather wishes for Frischmann to find someone better who can give more of their time to her than Damon could. Damon later said ‚ÄúIt upsets me, that song. It upset me singing it. Doing that vocal upset me greatly‚Äù.

Musically the song is quiet and comforting, albeit retaining the dark finish of the rest of the album. Graham‚Äôs guitar playing is the main fixture of the song, and it perfectly matches the sad and resigned vocals from Damon. Graham also contributes some beautiful backing vocals, while Alex provides some nice bass work that intertwines well with Graham‚Äôs guitar work. Dave‚Äôs quiet and measured drumming also serves the song well.

Lyrical highlight: ‚ÄúI hope you're with someone who makes you feel, Safe when your sleeping tonight, I won't kill myself trying to stay in your life‚Äù

Musical highlight: Guitar work, bass work

Best performers: Damon, Graham and Alex

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", 'I‚Äôm able to listen to the deluxe edition of Familiar to Millions on Spotify. On the flip side though most of the b-sides from SOTSOG and HC are not available where I am', 'I‚Äôve heard of this quote before but I‚Äôve never found a primary source for it. It does sound like something George would say though', 'Love them. Graham Coxon is perhaps the best rock guitarist of the 90s and Alex James and Dave Rowntree make for a great rhythm section. Damon Albarn‚Äôs a good vocalist too, although I think in the early years his voice can get a bit grating at times.']

['Tonight, my girlfriend took me to CVS to buy my own makeup for the first time. We got home and she did me up, and let me borrow some of her clothes/jewelry. I feel amazing.', 'Thank you so much, I just need to figure out what the first step even is.', 'So.... I tried cross dressing for the first time. 
 TLDR: I‚Äôve been questioning my gender identity, and picture myself being a woman even though I‚Äôm happy identifying as male, so I tried cross dressing and now I‚Äôm even more confused. Is there anyone here who experienced what I‚Äôm going through and do you have any advice? 

My girlfriend and I are in a long distance relationship. We‚Äôve been together 6 years. I have identified as male my entire life, but have recently been questioning my gender identity. If I‚Äôm being honest, even if I didn‚Äôt realize it, it started when I hit puberty and developed a fascination for the transformation fetish. Particularly MTF transformation. I am now 24, and have begun imagining having a vagina as I masturbate, or imagining being a woman as my girlfriend and I have sex. I sometimes picture us as a lesbian couple. I find the idea of being a woman very arousing, along with the idea of wearing dresses and makeup and being told I‚Äôm pretty. I feel pretty embarrassed admitting this, even though I‚Äôm doing it anonymously. Despite that though, I don‚Äôt really experience severe gender dysphoria. Most of the time I‚Äôm perfectly happy living my life as a man and identifying as one. I find the idea of transitioning to be absolutely terrifying, and I get embarrassed when I think about being referred to by my she/her pronouns. I like my penis, and also often wish I were capable of growing a real beard. 

I‚Äôve just been very confused and don‚Äôt really know what it is I‚Äôm going through. Even though I feel masc and identify as that, I don‚Äôt feel comfortable around hyper masculine men and I don‚Äôt feel I fit in in particularly male spaces, the way I‚Äôm able to connect with women and feel comfortable in feminine environments. 

The confusion that I‚Äôve been feeling has really hit a fever pitch over the last few months and I really don‚Äôt know what to do about it. So the last night I took a step I‚Äôd never taken before. 

My girlfriend leaves a lot of her clothes at my place so she doesn‚Äôt have to pack extensively when she comes to visit. So last night, I put on a pair of her panties and her bra and one of her dresses around my bedroom. I looked at myself in the mirror and I didn‚Äôt feel the way I thought I would. I felt comfortable, but I looked at myself and didn‚Äôt think that it was really me. Even though maybe a small part of me wanted it to be. 

Am I even trans? Why do I feel this way, but why don‚Äôt I feel it 100%? I have all these emotions bottled up inside me and I don‚Äôt know what to do about any of them or who I can talk to. I‚Äôve been teetering on the edge of telling my girlfriend for weeks, she said to me once in the context of one of our other friends‚Äô partners coming out as trans that she‚Äôd love me no matter what, but I don‚Äôt know if she said that ever expecting to be faced with a reality of it. Seeing a therapist isn‚Äôt really an option for me financially, and I just don‚Äôt know what to do.', 'Thank you sm trying my best to be positive and open with myself <LINK>']

Might I ask where you're currently getting your bica? I've been looking for a good source but everywhere either needs a prescription or is sold out.", "Other musicians/singers on the sub? 
 Hey y'all, I'm curious to hear music from other NB musicians on the sub about their music and how their transition has effected it! I'm a non-binary trans fem about to start HRT and starting to record a project about my journey over the past few years with songs about the relationships, lingering religious ideology, and process of having to cut my parents out of my life for a while. Y'all know the drill :) I'd love to hear music some of y'all have made and maybe some stories about how your journey has expressed itself through your music, especially those of you who are undergoing HRT, since that can have a huge emotional (and vocal, especially for trans-masc folks) impact. I go back and forth about my voice and how traditionally masculine it is (mostly sung growly folksy stuff with my smoker-ass factory worker vocals). I've spent a long time growing into and finding my voice and even though it can really give me dysphoria at times, it's become such an integral part of my music and identity as a performer. Even if I could voice train it up, I don't know if I'd even want to or not? Anyhow, I threw a link to one of the songs I recorded with previous band during my egg phase, and I can post the new project once it's done if any of y'all are interested. Looking forward to hear some of y'all's tunes!

["Moving around in LD but also not paralyzed? 
 I can move around in my dream and it certainly feels absolutely real. However there's always this other level, where if I knew I had to, I could open my real eyes and just get up.

I've definitely experienced sleep paralysis before so I know it's a thing with me. Over the past few years I've been focusing on how to get out of sleep paralysis so I don't experience anything scary. Lately if I ever get the feeling I will use it to start an LD.

Anyways, just curious if anyone else seems to not be paralyzed but still be able to move freely in some thrid-eye way in their LDs", 'If they want the public to think it is Melania, theyd probably ask her to look miserable', 'Observation: Vibrations is Qi 
 You know when you sit really still, even while awake, sometimes if you sit super still for a couple seconds, a wave of energy passes over your whole body. I'm not sure what this energy or feeling is, but my best guess is Qi.

When I've been able to induce and LD and vibrations begin, I realized I was doing the same thing that I do when trying to feel this "rush" of energy while awake.

If I'm too awake and try to induce an LD, I feel the energy wash over me, and see some minimal flashing visuals in my vision. But if I'm at just the right point to fall into an LD, the vibrations will begin, get stronger, and slowly transition into an LD.', 'I imagine you have to "unwind" it right? Is there a way to add a stop so you can just spin it backwards really fast to make keep it from going negative? Or...can you incorporate the spring from a tape measure and rewind it automatically??']

["This talking point pisses me off to no end. If my father had been granted more access to my sister and I we wouldn't be were we are now. My sister wouldn't have done as amazing as she did in her education or gotten the subsequent job as a specialist in her field and I would be dead or living in unbearable physical pain. 

My amazing mother survived a 20 year abusive marriage then worked 3 jobs to ensure my sister and I had what we needed, my father on the other hand found a monster of a woman and went from place to place to place all over the city with her and didn't pay a cent more for us then he had to. 

As long as I can remember I have lived in some kid of pain, my mother and maternal grandfather were the only people to believe me and my shit father and his girlfriend did everything they could to prove my mother and I were lairs, that meant forcing me to exert myself to exhaustion whenever I was with them. Because of this it took 13 yeas for me to get a diagnosis, my age meant I didn't qualify for government help for a childhood illness and I still live with the issues that they delayed intervention has created.

Due to my chronic pain I had to leave high school, something my father never would have allowed, but my mother and now my sister supported me to take a different educational pathway and I subsequently gained two qualification that allow me a very high paying job, I always received glowing comments for my teacher and work placement supervisors.    

I live very close to housing commission apartments, not once but twice has there been the murder of children by their fathers after the mothers begged the court not to give them custody. One monster drowned his two children another stabbed his little girl.  

My sister is in a very happy marriage to a wonderful kind man. We haven't spoken to the man in years. He was a sadist who knowing how much I loved animals would regularly discuss in detail his hunting hobby and killing the animals in inhumane ways. The people who gave him the right to see me and my sister are just as much to blame for everything that has happened as he and his girlfriend are.", "Zofran, sometimes it doesn't work and if it gets really bad you may feel a bit better after you throw up but I have also found OTC sea sickness tablets to be helpful. 

After I take the Zofran I wait about 15 minutes before taking pain meds because even if the nausea is still there I have a harder time throwing up and as such the meds get to work.", 'What Happened To The Children of the Thalidomide Epidemic? | No Limits | Real Families (2019)', "I'm sorry, I should have worded it better, the way it came across was that you were more worried about the cost then the dog's health."]
