She'd sooner shut off the possibility than explore with her partner, which is what her fiance is annoyed about, from what I see.

<QUOTE>

In any healthy relationship, it's about both parties equally, at least when you look at the whole relationship holistically.

<QUOTE>

Speak for yourself. I'd sooner try a sex act I'm uncomfortable with than have to hold my attention on a TV show I dislike or go shopping for things I have no interest in. But if those things bring my partner happiness, I'll try my best.

The worst one for me was drawing and painting. It can emotionally break me down very easily. Yet I've sat crying for hours forcing myself to draw in order to connect with my partner and I grew for doing so.", '<QUOTE>

Adderall, Dexedrine, Desoxyn, Phentermine, Phenmetrazine, 3-FPM, Ephedrine, Methylphenidate, Ethylphenidate, Methcathinone, Benzopiperidine, 3,4-CTMP, 2-DPMP.

Plenty exist.', "I see. Yeah, we do disagree.

I think any partner would get annoyed at me if I refused to draw them but drew many of my previous partners all because of my state of mind at the time and I'd totally understand them doubting my devotion to them if I refused.

I did it because it was more important to me to see my partner happy than it was to keep myself comfortable. I see no difference between sex or any other act in this regard.

Consent in that scenario is no issue for me because I simply try. And I personally believe I do owe it to any partner of mine to try my best at whatever helps us connect.

I personally disagree with her stance, but that is only.my opinion and is different from how I would approach the situation.", "I think most people are racist to some degree and the state and history of society determines what we deemsas racist because it provides context for our species, hence the term institutionalised racism and how it differs worldwide depending in the history of each culture.

I don't think racism is determined by race in the sense that a particular race has shared genetic code that means they are more likely to hate other races, which is often the implication of such claims.

I'd like to see what is said by other races in their more native cultures with regards to other racial population increases and how that relates to the history of each culture."]

 Ex: A woman saying that open womanly spaces such as Beauty Salons are no longer safe havens because a "man who thinks he's a woman" can walk in and ruin the atmosphere. That to me is TERF talk.

["I thought about this, and I really I want them to relate to me as a woman.

I think my real reservations are that I won't pass well enough and people will think of me as somewhere in between =(", "I still find myself having moments of doubt 4 months into HRT, living full time.  I find it more funny than distressing at this point.  So you've got this to look forward to.

I've found that each time it happens it gets easier to remember the overwhelming evidence that, yes, I'm trans and this is the right decision for me.  Just think about all the reasons that got you to where you are now.", 'You realize he polls <ITALIC> dramatically better than any of the other dems against trump, right?', "I mean, this year is going to suck, but try to focus on the end goal.  Being 20 means you've still got like 60+ years left you can be yourself after this.

Try to start including things that you are going to want to do as part of transitioning anyway to keep yourself motivated.  Start practicing your voice while you aren't around your parents.  Keep yourself in shape, lots of cardio and low weight, high rep stuff to tone your body.  You can even lie to your parents about this part claiming you are trying to be more masculine if that makes it easier.  Maybe see if you can meet some others like yourself that maybe live in more accepting homes or by themselves so you have a safe place to go for times when you really can't suppress."]

['Let me preface this by saying I myself am on the spectrum. I have a personal stake in this. And I will also be responding to the concept of this being for the elimination of autism altogether, since while you didn‚Äôt claim to believe that you did pose a question towards it in the last paragraph. 

That being said, you‚Äôre under a misassumption many people have that all autism is terrible and debilitating in equal amounts. It isn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a bit of a twisting of the wires, a different way the person who has it perceives and expresses information. Some are nonverbal, some are very eloquent. Some have trouble with social or societal cues and some don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a spectrum. 

Autism Speaks sees this condition, this state of mind that is not lethal and is not physically painful, and they see it as a detriment to the people who have to raise the children. They see it as something that is a curse, a horrible affront to all decency. They want to get rid of autism, not assist people who have it or support parents who have autistic kids. 

Autism isn‚Äôt exactly a blessing, but it isn‚Äôt a curse either. The curse is people who treat you like subhuman for being born different, for thinking and acting in ways that aren‚Äôt neurotypical but harm no one. I wouldn‚Äôt want to be born any other way, but according to this organization I should feel ashamed and horrified at my own existence. 

I am not broken, nor is anyone else with autism. Supporting us and finding ways to help in day to day life is a good thing. Wanting to remove us from existing is a bullshit way of saying you don‚Äôt like how we‚Äôre different so you want us gone. 

Cancer kills people. Diabetes ruins lives. Autism makes you think and act in a different way, but it only kills you if other people do it for you.', 'I still haven‚Äôt seen a Genocide run of Undertale. Jacksepticeye‚Äôs pacifist run is enough to satiate me forever', 'I‚Äôll go ahead and pm a link to the discord, we‚Äôre short a DM so nothing‚Äôs guaranteed yet but we can set things up.', 'You‚Äôll have a bit less liquor to share but it looks damn cool']

['Mark said post your spookiest experience so here is mine 
 When I was 14 a new family moved onto my small dead end street I go to meet the mom and her three daughters ages 0, 4 and 8 I start to babysit the 4 and 8 year old. This story happens and I am about 16 to 17 the youngest girl is 2 and a half ish, by this time I had started to babysit her that night it was just me and her.

Mom and the other two girls are out from 4-10 but the mom ran late, it was about 8 pm bed time for her, now I have put this girl to bed a lot of times we had a routine I would read her one or two stories and than sing her to sleep, but this night she didn‚Äôt want to go to her room she didn‚Äôt want to get changed and she especially didn‚Äôt want me to put her in her bed after the stories. After 4 books I ask her what‚Äôs wrong and she says to be ‚Äúhe goes round he goes round‚Äù now this scared me but I have to try and calm her down and settle her so I ask

‚Äúwho is he‚Äù 

she than says ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚Äù

I try to stay calm and ask ‚Äúis he bad?‚Äù

She shakes her head ‚Äúno he watches, round and round‚Äù she mentioned him going round constantly, by now mom had called and said that she would be late. The next thing the little girl said is what truly scared me, I don‚Äôt remember word for word what she said so I will not but it in quotes, she says something along the lines of ‚Äòwhere is mom somethings wrong she‚Äôs not coming back!‚Äô But I promised her that I will never let him hurt her and that I will protect her and that her mom will be back. I don‚Äôt mention that now I am scared but even if her mom doesn‚Äôt come back I will take care of her, I had called my mom and told her that if the mom isn‚Äôt back by dawn I will bring the girl and some supplies of hers home with me and we will take care of her. she nods and goes to sleep.

A few hours later and it‚Äôs almost midnight and I hear footsteps in the house I run up to the little girl and say again and again ‚Äúyou are not welcome here you need to leave‚Äù I calm this over and over but it doesn‚Äôt stop and just like she said the steps go in circles a Roth‚Äôs house, eventually it stopped. shortly after this the mom came and I told her I was worried something might be going on she ignored me and I went home. 

For months I watched as this little girl was scared of everything and she was so scared I did what I could but she never did get better I have left for college now and the few times I‚Äôve seen her she looked alright but still I worry.', 'Thanks I‚Äôll chat with them in a few minutes I really appreciate the advice', 'Yes he does and licks my nose if I have a nightmare. He‚Äôs a good boy!', 'I am well aware it‚Äôs not the best but it kept me safe last year and I really don‚Äôt want to get hurt or something because I tried something new I just want them to respect that']

['What can a high school dropout do for work?', 'I have big trouble in social situations, and can‚Äôt sympathize very well. \n My whole life I‚Äôve never known what things not to say, when not to say them. I talk about gross shit when people are eating because I don‚Äôt know how it makes them feel. I need people to tell me when I‚Äôm doing inappropriate things because I can‚Äôt discern that for myself. A while ago my mother told me the story of how her dad (my grandpa) had many siblings, of which he was the oldest. His mom had a mental breakdown and was bedridden for 2 years and had to spend his childhood taking care of his siblings. He got my grandma pregnant when she was 18 and he was around 23(?). When my mother was born, he treated her poorly because he felt he had already raised kids (his siblings). I didn‚Äôt care. I mean I guess I felt bad because she raised me good and I wish more people would get childhoods like mine, but I feel like I should care more. I mean she‚Äôs my mom. Shouldn‚Äôt I? I heard a story about this woman who was kidnapped and raped for 20 years and I honestly tried hard to feel bad for her. And there‚Äôs another thing. I‚Äôve never understood why people feel bad after being raped. I‚Äôve heard good things about sex, I‚Äôve heard that it feels good, why wouldn‚Äôt you be happy? But here‚Äôs the kicker. I always feel empathy for fictional characters. The best example for this would be telltales the walking dead. I cried so much. At almost every death. Especially the end of season 1 and 2. It doesn‚Äôt matter if I‚Äôm in public, I can‚Äôt help myself. I watched 8-bit Ryan‚Äôs play through when I was probably around 11, then rewatched it when I was 14. Cried both times. Also at the end of terminator 2. Then again, I cried when I read ‚ÄòIqbal‚Äô, which is non fiction. ['In the original manga, he hates Yugi‚Äôs family because Yugi‚Äôs grandpa won a shadow game against his father and his father was disfigured and swore revenge. The whole thing was part of a complicated plan to force Yugi to play the same Shadow Game with his dad after smashing the puzzle.

They didn‚Äôt want to portray Yugi‚Äôs grandpa as the kind of guy who played shadow games, though, so they wrote his dad out of the show and tossed together an excuse plot, and the smashing the puzzle and starting a fire thing went to Bandit Keith under Marik‚Äôs control instead.', 'What is this weird silver-plated cup with strainer?', 'I‚Äôm curious how this would bear out across age groups - and for that matter how it would compare to other nations. A lot of young men I know are doing all the cooking for their families, and a lot of the couples I know just always call a repairman instead of doing any repairs themselves at all! vs. with the older people I know, they seem more traditional.', 'Schizophrenia is very very rare before the late teens. (I myself was an early case, but I was 13ish when I first became symptomatic. Earlier than the early teens is extremely rare.) 

It‚Äôs normal for children to hold conversations with stuffed animals and have abnormal fears, and night terrors are not generally considered a sign of schizophrenia, even if they involve relatively brief hallucinations. Sleep-deprivation-related hallucinations are also not particularly linked to schizophrenia. A good sleep schedule can help create order, which is useful for symptom management, but it‚Äôs not the same as it is for sane people, who may experience sleep deprivation related minor psychosis. 

I like seeing schizophrenic characters in media, but I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs a lot of evidence for BV - and he doesn‚Äôt show any of the nonpsychotic symptoms, a certain number of which are necessary for a diagnosis, like a lack of empathy, executive dysfunction, and emotional dysregulation. There‚Äôs a lot more to being schizoid than just seeing things.']

This helps outline some traits. How do you handle those emotions, and write down when you‚Äôre feeling them and what your first impulse would be. 

I‚Äôm not a professional, and I‚Äôve only just started trying to do this myself the last few months. You have to be patient with yourself and make sure you remember that habits are hard to change. According to my mum I exude ‚Äòfemale aura‚Äô (she thinks it‚Äôs some past life stuff, I don‚Äôt believe in that kinda thing, but I‚Äôm happy to go to whatever spiritual/non spiritual therapy things if it puts her mind at ease). And my dad agrees that I‚Äôm not yknow ‚Äòlike a bloke‚Äô in that I‚Äôm too nice about things, or can be too wishy washy and indecisive. I know I‚Äôm not the most manly man, and I am an over cautious sort. But am I too soft to be a dude? I don‚Äôt wanna be an asshole just to transition. I don‚Äôt think I need to, but am I too feminine? Or emotional? Or something? 

I do worry that I don‚Äôt have enough dysphoria, I get it every so often, once in a blue moon I guess. But also I‚Äôve had a plan in the works, I have an appointment in march to sort this out, I don‚Äôt feel bad because as much as I‚Äôd like to have been on T yesterday, it‚Äôs 5 months, it‚Äôs reachable. I think I used to have more dysphoria, but god knows, I have such a shitty memory I don‚Äôt remember and it was probably just depression. I know I get euphoria, when I got new masc jeans and I look down and in my hoodie look like a guy, it makes me happy, I have decent enough shoulders for being afab, it‚Äôs not that I don‚Äôt like my body. I‚Äôd like my hips to be narrower, but I can‚Äôt do shit about that, yeah I‚Äôd like to be flat chested, but tbh I don‚Äôt mind my chest that much, it‚Äôs only a c cup you can barely see it. 

I think I disassociate a bunch also, it had actually been a while since I hadn‚Äôt recognised myself in the mirror, I don‚Äôt know how much that factors in, for both sides me being cis or trans. I don‚Äôt really have that much of a relationship with myself, or am aware of myself, I didn‚Äôt think I needed to tbh. It probably doesn‚Äôt help I‚Äôve been having a bit of an identity crisis trying to find a name before I have to come out to more people with my last choice that I don‚Äôt like anymore. (I think I might go with Julian but i‚Äôd like peoples opinions close to me but I can‚Äôt talk to any of them about it)

I‚Äôve been identifying as some variation of not cis since 14, I‚Äôm 19 now, and I do think that‚Äôs enough for it not to be a phase. But I am still young, and that‚Äôs what worries my mum. Both my parents want me to try being a girl first, and to try a relationship because I don‚Äôt know myself until then. Mum says that she didn‚Äôt know herself til she was 20 and had her first relationship. I‚Äôd love a relationship, but I don‚Äôt see myself as a girl in it. I don‚Äôt wanna have sex because I don‚Äôt have a dick, but they won‚Äôt believe me til I do kind of conundrum. She says I seem like a cardboard cut out, and I do often feel like that, but she thinks it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm trying to be a guy and hide behind that, while I think the opposite (and just that I don‚Äôt seem to have any knowledge or hobbies tbh) 

I do want to go the full way, with T, top and bottom surgery. Change my name, just be a guy. And that‚Äôs what worries them, my dad says I can do that just don‚Äôt do the medical thing because I shouldn‚Äôt base it off what other people think (I see myself as a guy, I want T so people will take me serious and I pass (plus that sweet voice drop)).

I guess my main worry is that I‚Äôve convinced myself into it, that I learn‚Äôt about it too young. I worry that I‚Äôm doing it for the attention, to be special (in like a low-key way, to not be ‚Äòordinary‚Äô? Bc I don‚Äôt want people to like, acknowledge it). That I don‚Äôt understand what it is to be a proper man. That I don‚Äôt have enough dysphoria. That I have too many doubts. It‚Äôs all thrown me for a loop, I‚Äôm comfortable being trans, I always seem to come back to the same conclusion that I want all the procedures etc, but I just want to check in that I‚Äôm not just doing it to be stubborn? I mean no one wants to be wrong, but if that‚Äôs the case I‚Äôll go back on it, not that I think I‚Äôm wrong though‚Ä¶

Am I romanticising being trans? 

God sorry this got long, I don‚Äôt have anyone to talk to this about really, so you guys get the big word vent.", 'If the x is on the edge like that sometimes its in the water under sand']

['I‚Äôm worried that the actual problem is worse than bad period pain... Whenever I‚Äôve read about really bad symptoms (heavy bleeding, debilitating cramps, etc), it‚Äôs usually been a signifier of <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> Have you talked to a doctor about your cramps? 

Otherwise, my only goal is to sleep through cramps. I‚Äôve heard good things about yoga to relieve pain, but I‚Äôm not sure if that will help in your situation. I think edibles are perfectly valid to ease the pain, though.', 'I feel bad though by doing lots of grinding (which is what I do anyway) because I‚Äôve read that between grinding vs strokes, grinding doesn‚Äôt do as much sensation-wise for the dick. The appendage. Not the person.', 'I fell in love with my boyfriend within weeks of knowing him, but we didnt start dating until 4 months after that, and then we weren't official until 3 months after THAT. So it had been on the tip of my tongue for a long time, but I also didnt want to be that person who says it right away and comes across crazy, you feel? So I gave myself...4 weeks, I think? I told myself I wanted to be officially bf/gf for at least a month before I said anything like that. I made it the 4 weeks, and only held out a week after that. 

We were drunk and laying around talking and I said "Can I tell you something if you promise to take me seriously?" He said sure, or something, and so I told him I loved him. He asked me to tell him again in the morning, and sober.

Morning came. We were sitting up in bed watching something on YouTube or Netflix or what have you and it took me close to an hour to work up the (sober) guts, but I worked them up and told him. He said it back. Now we tell each other every day.

I didn't feel if it was the right time, although drunk and at 3 am could possibly be a wrong time. I dont believe there is a right time or a wrong time because to me, it just needed to be said. I wanted to get past the not-saying it stage and get to the part where I could tell him, with my words, to his face, that I love him. I do my best to tell him with my actions too, but saying it out loud is so important to me. So I didnt know at all when I should have said it. I just felt I NEEDED to and held out as long as I could.

As for what made him different...hes my best friend. I can bare my soul for him. He confides in me, trusts me, supports me. I've never had that with anyone else. I've never met someone who just fit alongside me. So I took that as knowing.

I'm so sorry this turned out so long but I have a lot of feelings for my boyfriend and just jumped at the chance to ramble.', 'Do you think the compensating comes into play the other direction too? Like they bring up their SO in every single conversation?']

["Please answer this, it's a matter of dife and leath. Do you prefer hountains or mills?", 'Un succo di fretta che vado di frutta', 'I had a bad dream 
 I, my mother and my sister were planning to go to the beach. I agreed, but decide to initially go by myself. 
I found myself in a supermarket in a town next to the beach, after supposedly running (or walking) 50 km on foot to get there. I needed to pay for somethings, but I realized I wasn't in line; instead, I was near the cashier, when I should have stayed in the line behind other customers. I get mad and decide to leave without buying anything.



Then I found myself in a car going to the beach with my mother and sister. Then we got fined because we were sitting turned around, even though the car had autopilot. We tried several times to outrun the cops, but they always got to us with weird movements.
Then for some reason it was night, and I tried to convince the two cops that what they were doing was right, but we were living in a crisis situation because of the virus (which is weird, why were we going to the beach then?) And if they had made us the fine it would have got terribly worse.
One of them nodded smiling but didn't change his mind. The other one was laughing and talking with his friends and asked me what I wanted.
I then lost all will to go to the beach.



After that I found myself in a restaurant (or canteen, or eating area) with some middle school bullies who were making fun of me. I tried to hit some of them but of course, as happens in dreams, I can't move.
I then went to the bathroom.
I left the door open for some reason, like some of us men tend to do.
A guy passed by and closed my door, making me feel bad about it.
I then noticed I had stained my underwear and jeans. After noticing that, I realized my wallet had been stolen and replaced with a remote controller.



I got back to the eating area asking who stole my wallet. I hit one of the bullies with my remote controller, then he got up with an angry face,like "now I'm gonna show you". Then I don't know what happened next, we were probably fighting by holding our hands and pushing, then I found myself awake.', 'Mark: "?" 
 Is that a question, Mark?']

["No, I've watched all of invader zim, it's non Jhonen Vasquez's style of animation.... it was, rounder?", "Work is a massive clusterfuck right now, and layoffs are coming either tomorrow, or the end of next week. 

I wouldn't be worried, but we're being downsized due to managerial incompetence, namely their inability to tell who on the team is capable of doing their jobs and who can't.

I just signed a lease for a nice apartment with my boyfriend, the deposits on which ate up all of my savings. I either move next weekend, or move and look for a new job.", "I have some mild to moderate anxiety, depending on how bad my stress level is any certain month. My current partner (of one year next week) was my first real partner, and when we got together we both highly valued extremely honest, open communication. One of the ways he did this in his previous relationships was that he liked, especially in the first couple of months of our relationship, to set up a time to sit somewhere neutral and talk about how we thought things were going and what we wanted.

Terrified the shit out of me, but I agreed because I saw the logic in stopping overthinking at the source. I had to completely unlearn the cultural panic button that comes from the phrase 'We need to talk about our relationship'.

Turns out a little less than a month into our relationship that was where we discussed the use of the 'I love you' phrase, what that sentiment said out loud meant to both of us, assurance that it didn't need to mean the same thing to both people but that the person saying it wanted to make sure it was being heard in the right way.

It became a really easy habit, and now at least once every couple weeks I just roll over in bed and ask 'Hey, how are you doing, really? How are we doing?' The stigma has completely gone, and it's allowed us to bring up all kinds of insecurities in the relationships, ourselves, and head-on tackle all kinds of problems from emotional, sexual, jealousy, and external stresses.

It's a hell of a way to start a first relationship communication pattern, but honestly I don't know how well I would have made it through my anxiety of 'I don't know what the fuck I am doing, this is my first real relationship past a 3rd date and I am well into my 20's' without that, or how I'd make it through a relationship that doesn't have it now.", "Part of it comes down to your other priorities too though. I have a longer commute and if you're able to not give in to road rage, I've started to view it as my 'Me Time', listening to audio books and podcasts, when I wouldn't really prioritize having alone time to read or educate myself further if I was just 'at home' those times. If you're running two side businesses and have a busy home life, having the quiet time alone can be a really good thing to help you destress, you just have to learn to identify it as such and get the most out of it."]

["I'm so happy for you and congratulations on being on HRT for 8 months", "This is so cute and no matter what I'm so happy for you", 'My mom came out to me 
 Background: I'm a trans girl who is attracte to a narrow range of masculine people and a wide range of femmes but because I would never date a man for a lot of reasons I identify as a lesbian. 
My mom is in her mid 40s and has always said some things that struck me as super gay ie. "I go to Hooters some times because the girls are so pretty" "my friend x is really attractive I'd date her if something ever happened to my husband" she also grew up in a very repressive household and her dad is a sexist asshat. 

Anyways my whole life she always kind of struck me as like definetly queer but I couldn't place it. We were running Christmas errands the other day and she started asking me question about mine and my partners relationship and my sexuality. I explained to her men yes but actually no, girls yes. Then she told me something along the lines of 
"Well I find some women attractive and have my whole life. Doesn't mean I'm gay just because I'm attracted to them. And like I would date friend x if I could. 

So I tried to explained to her like bisexuality and like how she doesn't find all men attractive that doesn't mean she doesn't find men attractive. Plus I kind of used the Kinsey scale as a descriptor and stayed away from some of the problematic parts of it. By the end of it she asked me "so I could be bisexual even if I don't find all women attractive and am mostly attracted to men?" 

It was a really pleasant conversation and I'm glad I got to have it with her. She doesn't ever plan on coming out since she's basically married and doesn't really want to come out, which is totally valid. I'm just really happy for her.', "Remember pride is inclusive and TERFs don't belong in pride or Queer circles"]

["Thank you!! \U0001f970 I'm doing really well today, especially after the positive response to this!", "It probably works fine with the stp they bundle it with, but the one I was trying to use it with was...idk too heavy? Too floppy? to really use effectively. It's SUPER stretchy and light material which is very comfortable, but it doesn't hold an stp in place at all and doesn't keep a packer tucked away. I bought these because I wanted something I could keep my stp in all day as a packer then pull it out comfortably to pee, but it didn't really do the job. It was honestly less of a hassle to just pull everything down rather than try to get the firm seal by pressing through the boxers and holding everything in place.

In conclusion: maybe with the right stp? but it was more of a hassle than it was worth to me.", "Gotcha. This has been on my mind for a while so that's really a relief. Thanks!", "Oh I have that one!! It takes a little practice (like with any STP, but this was my very first one so it might have taken me longer to master lol) but in terms of efficiency it's great. The bowl is big and has high sides to avoid splashing, and the exit hole is huge. It drains so fast you'd never have an issue with backflow. If you did the material is thin enough that you could just drill it a little bigger with a spade bit.

Like I said this was my first STP and it really does the job, but that's about all it does. It's very stiff and you can't use it to pack or roll it up very well, and it's not terribly realistic in terms of looks or at ALL realistic in terms of feel. But a fantastic starter STP and great semi-realistic alternative to like a fenis or gogirl."]

['How to improve my phrasing to be more polite/kind when talking or texting? 
 Apparently I have a problem when it comes to phrasing things and when I do say/text things it seems to come off as rude/crass/sarcastic when it really isn't my intention at all. 

While my mind knows what being kind is, it seems like my speaking/texting makes me seem like I am just so rude when I am trying to be objective.

Apparently I have poor phrasing and don't know what to do about it. 

In example, my mom asked me if I wanted something and I just say the word "No."
She said the way I said it, and just simply saying the word No isn't polite and that saying "No, thank you"is better, even though my mind prefers a simplified no versus   having to talk even more with two more words. 

In another example, I was on a forum that showed  two images and I was  just telling about what I was visually seeing and apparently the author said to read the description after I was detailing on my lack of understanding on what was going on in the picture. 

Other people thought I was being sarcastic and rude, and then I had to explain myself that I was looking at it objectively. 

How do I solve this problem of just having poor phrasing so I don't come off as crass? 

', "[Question] Scared to do anything on my channel now. How do I get around copyright claim stuff?

["Questions regarding body hair removal 
 So I've tried numerous ways of removing body hair but my results have been disappointing. Shaving causes razor bumps and ingrown hairs, and yes, I do follow common advice such as hot showers, exfoliating, conditioner instead of shaving gel/cream, etc. Epilating has been more successful due to the fact that I don't get razor burns, however, I still get ingrowns. I always stretch + tighten my skin but I keep getting ingrowns. I've heard it might be because the hairs are breaking but I can't really tell whether that's the case or not. Waxing was probably the best, but you have to let the hairs grow a bit before you can remove them and it's just unbearable to let them grow.

<BOLD> Questions:

1) Are there any tips I'm missintg regarding epilation/shaving? Anything regarding growth cycles worth knowing? Refer to the wall of text above for more info.

2) What's the difference between IPL and Laser? And are either of the two permanent?

3) Do IPL/Laser home devices actually work? And if so, what would you recommend?

4) Based on your own experiences, would you choose Laser or Electrolysis?

5) How do you minimize razor bumps and ingrown hairs? Circumvention and post-shave/post-epilation. I can't get rid of them once they've formed.

Thank you all for reading this, your input is greatly appreciated!", 'Inreresting. Did you stop binging too ? Or just purging?', "Wouldn't really say it's glorifying imo. For me personally, having an FP isn't something I want. If I could do without having certain feelings because of having an FP I would", "Oh wow I'll have to try that ! Are you on hormones? If you don't mind me asking?"]

['Ughhhh now this just sounds like the plot of a softcore fantasy porn film.', 'Hopefully people go to watch this film for Deepika and the issue is more talked about and gets attention..', 'I am a woman living in India and I am TIRED of hearing about another rape case every day. 
 This past week has been depressing. It's been one news after the other about multiple women getting raped, and some were set on fire after being raped. What the hell is going on? We are told not to go out late at night because of the fear of being raped. We are told not to speak up if a man catcalls out of the fear of retaliation. We are told to dress modestly, because again...rape or molestation. We are told not to go anywhere alone, to keep an eye on our drinks at bars, not be "bold", not have multiple sexual relationships. When do I live my life? Will I live my entire life like this? Will I lie on my death bed thinking that I basically lived a life out of fear trying to follow rules that were made up by the patriarchy God knows when and because the justice system is inefficient? If I have a daughter, is this what she will have to live through not because all men are the same, but because God knows what if she trusts the wrong man or someone takes advantage of her?

Women have been raped even while being accompanied by a man, so there goes the logic of "take someone with you so you won't be raped." Young women, babies, middle-aged women, and old women have been raped...proving time and time again that age is not a factor. Most of these women were wearing traditional clothes which checks the SANSKARI NARI box, yet they were raped. Women have been raped by their own relatives. Women have been raped by politicians. Women have been raped by policemen. Police and politicians have refused to take rapes seriously. "Come after you have been raped". Women have committed suicide because the police refused to file a complaint. SO WHAT'S IT GOING TO TAKE???? WHAT is it that will make all these politicians sit up and think women are human beings too? That women are fucking tired of protesting and living like a second-class citizen that nobody cares about? And NO "men will be men". Women are just as interested in sex contrary to patriarchal belief, yet you don't see us out and about raping men do you?

Why are these politicians shying away from making rules that hand out strict punishments irrespective of their age? Why is our usually-talkative Prime Minister silent? Why are juveniles getting away with a few years? Rapists should be sentenced to death. If someone is capable of putting an iron rod up a person's private parts and/or setting them on fire and/or raping them, they deserve to have their balls chopped off and hung in public. Why are these cases taking years and years to convict rapists in cases with clear evidence? What's it going to take? I am so fucking tired.', 'If this were a tweet, it would go viral.']

["<DESCRIPTION> <LINK> running Level Duplication. I dunno if it's as good as the SSA and Heavy Starter builds, but this is what I used to climb to KoG this season <ITALIC> after I got demoted to Legend 4 using Heavy Starter, and it did pretty well. Recycler and Undine total the number of ways into Sulfefnir to 9 like the old Transcendent Crystals Build, but you do have a little less space for tech/staples. The Skill doesn't always come up, but it makes for some spicy plays, like making Lava Golems tune-able. It helped me comeback by turning a Rosenix token into LV3 with Controller in hand, summoning said Controller, then making Dolphin.

I've been thinking about running a 2nd Cosmic Cyclone over Void Trap Hole due to the increased amount of Necrovalley users recently, though, so that's something to consider.", "Monthly Custom Build Sharing Thread <HEADING> 04: Free [Poll for next month] 
 EDIT:

The results are in! I know I'm a day or two late (just started my job haha), but it looks like we have a tie. As such, we'll try and combine the two choices between <ITALIC> UC-themed and <ITALIC> Char-themed into a <ITALIC> Char-themed UC suit. It sounds kinda redundant since Char is from UC, but let's roll with it for now haha. The sidebar will be updated to reflect this.

Also, don't forget you can add your own ideas and options to the poll! That's it for now, so see you all and your builds next month!

<ITALIC> _

It's that time again! For this month, we're back to a free theme, which means anything goes. The way monthly themes will work moving forward will be discussed further below, but for now, looking forward to seeing everyone's builds! 

While they'll always be welcome, New Gundam Breaker is coming out in 2 months on June 22, so enjoy GB3 to the fullest until then!

<ITALIC> _

With <USER>'s suggestion, we'll have a theme for every month. As mentioned during its early stages, I'll be posting a poll link to let everyone decide what theme we'll go with. With all polls, the theme with the highest amount of votes will be the theme for the following month. 

To avoid repetition, the winning theme can no longer be the set theme for following months, even if it were to be entered and win again (in which case, the 2nd highest will be selected, and so on if appropriate). For now, it's indefinite, but we can set it to be invalid for only 6 months or so. 

In the case of a tie, I'll be deciding it on a coin-flip, dice roll, or random number generator, among other random selection methods.

Unfortunately, since Strawpoll doesn't let respondents add their own choices, I had to resort to another (trusted) poll hosting service (Poal.me). With that in mind, please do read all the present choices to see if your idea has already been mentioned before adding your own option to avoid redundancy. Additionally, you can also vote for multiple options. I also don't know for how long Poal.me polls are open, but for now, we'll set the deadline for votes on April 16 UTC+0:00 if it doesn't close sooner. I will update this thread at the bottom with a screenshot of the results, as well as the final decision.

The [link to the poll is here] (<LINK>).


TL;DR Guidelines:

* Votes with the highest votes will be selected for the theme of the following month (in this case, May)

* You can vote for multiple options.

* You can add your own options (please check for redundancy)

* No restrictions, but avoid choosing something that's been done already

* Can follow any theme, not just suit based (e.g. 00 Universe, solid weapons only, must use Wing Zero EW Backpack, a Char-custom variant)

* Open until April 16, where I will check the results and update this thread with it.", "No one's gonna be insane enough to run Zero Sprite in Superheavy Samurais or for Cocytus, right?

...

Right?", 'Cocoa found a new imouto [GochiUsa x Wataten]']

["Sharing The Love 
 Tonight was a shit show at my work. I work in a coffee shop. As my Assistant Manager and I are finally closing up, I mention I'm getting baked and relaxing tonight (he knows I smoke). He asks if he can try and offers me 5 bucks. I politely decline. You guys, seeing my 28 year old Chinese, religious assistant manager stoned, petting my cat for 15 minutes without saying a thing was one of the best experiences of my life.", 'I fucking love Domination. And Headquarters. When people play the objective. And maybe cause its early, but on the 24/7 Shoothouse no one is playing the objective. I watched a teammate get a double kill on a point in Domination and then run the other way instead of pressing for the point. Infuriating.', 'Late to the party but here goes. 

I went to a popular vacation destination and I bought a ton of cool stickers (like 45 dollars worth) to slap on my skateboard and of course some for my skate crew. I went out to dinner with my girlfriend of the time, went to a movie, came back and the stickers were gone. And I knew where they were. I messaged a group chat with a photo of them on the side table saying "can't wait to see y'all in a week. Got y'all some stickers", put on my jacket and left. Came back and they were gone.

I tore that room apart (not literally) looking for them. Channelled my inner Karen, went to the front desk and asked them to talk to the cleaners or whoever would have been in my room. They never found an answer. Pissed to this day.

Still salty any time anyone brings up that city.

 Fuck you Canmore (but not really you're a nice city I guess).', "23/M/Canada 
 Hello beautiful people of the internet. My name is Stan, and I'm from Canada. Alberta to be exact. I love to write but I never have a reason to anymore. So I'd love to start writing to a couple people to keep me writing! I've been through a bunch of stuff so I can tell some pretty interesting stories. My interests are:

-Music. I love almost everything except pop or country. Just cant get into them oddly enough
-Serial killers. Legit. Like I know way more than I should about them. So that's a good dinner table topic I guess
-Food. Like legit send me your recipes and stuff and I'll share mine
-Coffee. I work for Starbucks and I have a little coffee cup tattooed on me so yeah I really love to talk about coffee
-Movies. I always love new suggestions and suggesting stuff to people

And really I just love hearing people's life stories and stuff they've learned and all that jazz. So yeah lemme know if you wanna start writing.

Hit me back just to chat,
Your biggest fan,
This is Stan."]

["I'm not sure why you'd ever give someone medical advice without being willing to provide primary sources to back it up, but go off I guess? I did the research, but there's a lot of conflicting data, such as this 2017 study claiming that low dose estradiol on its own can normalize hormone levels in transgender women to cis-female ranges.  <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> 

Also, I'm not really looking for high levels, I'm non binary and was originally considering bicalutamide monotherapy, but decided to add low dose estrogen just to be safe (didn't want a hormone deficiency). I'm just curious as to why my body hair seems to be growing thicker after starting both an NSAA along with estradiol.", "Getting a bicalutamide prescription 
 Anyone know of online/telemedicine options for getting a bicalutamide prescription? I live in Richmond, VA and all of the HRT providers I have been able to find only prescribe an Estradiol + Spiro regimen, but I'm non-binary and would like to retain some testosterone production as well as fertility and sexual function, which bicalutamide seems like the best option for. Any ideas how I could get a prescription or know of any sources to get it without a prescription?", "Wow, thank you so much for the sources! I'll have to read through them later. ['I 100% relate to the ‚Äúinstinct‚Äù part. I never thought about sex, I hated tampons (only used them when I had to which happened a lot since I was a lifeguard), and NEVER thought about masturbating until my last ex told me I should. He was sexually and emotionally abusive and manipulative so that‚Äôs a whole other story. I realized, as you mentioned, the desire to jack off last year. I had never thought of it before because I had no interest in anything concerning sex/genitals. Once I realized that though, that‚Äôs when I started to question. I have always been very detached from my parts and had for years assumed my disconnect and disinterest was asexuality, now I‚Äôm questioning that again. 

As to the ‚Äúrepression‚Äù, I‚Äôm 22 now and only came to realize I was trans about 8 months ago. Growing up I was an extreme tomboy, except I had LONG hair (like to my thighs). I didn‚Äôt usually get confused as a boy in person but my name is neutral so I often did online and what not. I secretly liked it but would often feel bad about liking it so I would act like it was a joke or act offended. I went through a girly phase, but not like super girly. No dresses or makeup but some girlier clothes and nails. I also went through puberty very early (I think I was second in my grade, after my sister) and pretty much immediately I hated it. I was ecstatic after my first period because it lasted 3 days and then didn‚Äôt come again for 4 months. I hated being told I had to go hang with the girls, or be more ladylike, or do my hair/nails because others would be jealous and it was so pretty. I tried to fit in with girls a little more in high school only because I would get yelled at so much for being so boyish, and I was trying to fit in and be who my parents expected me to be. I definitely had some times were I felt ashamed of liking the way people called me sir in emails, or being boyish, especially when I was told that I had qualities other girls would kill for. 

Now I have to figure out how to come out.', 'I just turned 22 this past week and just started realizing it. I never considered gender in anyway at all growing up. I was a tomboy through and through growing up, all my friends were guys, I hated doing my nails or hair and I refused to wear ‚Äúfeminine‚Äù clothes. Found myself reinventing myself every time I moved (about 7 times) but usually always staying more androgynous. I did have long hair, I didn‚Äôt like shoulder length and was afraid to go shorter. My stepmom came into the picture and wanted me to be more feminine so I was (barely) and hated it. I cried when I got my first period and always tried to pretend I wasn‚Äôt really getting it. Tried to avoid wearing bras (other than sport) until my mom wouldn‚Äôt let me anymore in high school. I would pretend being a boy in my room, but stopped when I realized that probably wasn‚Äôt normal and repressed it until recently. Wore a lot of baggy clothes to hide my body. Eventually went through a phase of trying to get the perfect female form (never did and it‚Äôs ok). I got a boyfriend because I thought I needed to and I quickly realized he wanted a lot more than I did and I was very uncomfortable. But he made me feel I had to do things as a girlfriend (later I‚Äôd realize how shitty he was). We broke up and I went back to my baggy clothes. I‚Äôve never dated anyone since. In college I stayed comfortable in my baggy clothes, joined an athletics team and became more sporty. Loved wearing suits for work. I dyed my hair purple, came out as aroace (may be because I can‚Äôt imagine myself with anyone as a female and don‚Äôt feel any attraction as I am now). Now I‚Äôm in grad school and living alone and been exploring myself more. Realized if I think of having sex I don‚Äôt want it as a girl, but want a penis. Realized I hated my chest and felt euphoric when I could get it mostly flat. Started telling my friends I was questioning and just felt right. Bought a bunch of men‚Äôs clothes and felt more comfortable than ever. Finally, yesterday I cut my hair off (all of it, it‚Äôs nearly buzzed on the sides and longer on top) and everyone noticed how much happier and more comfortable I immediately felt in my own skin. 

Sorry this was long.', 'This is how I have felt my entire life but I had never realized it was dysphoria until last year. Now I‚Äôm trying to find a way to come out to my family after 22 years of them thinking that I‚Äôm someone else. 

That person in the mirror was never me, the eyes were all I could see sometimes. My body was just my way to get around and sometimes when it was going through large crowds I‚Äôd completely check out, and all of a sudden realize later that I was somewhere else, kind of like when you‚Äôre driving and you don‚Äôt remember the turns you took but you ended up where you were supposed to. I thought losing weight and dressing different would bring connection but it tended to just make it worse. Standing in front of the mirror trying to convince myself that I was ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù and that there was nothing wrong with me. Now I can see who I am a little better, and he is easy to see as ‚Äúhandsome‚Äù but sometimes I still slip back. 

Dysphoria makes me depressed and anxious, and it‚Äôs hard for people to understand which makes it hard to cope with sometimes. My friends try to help by telling me I look good but on days when I can only see ‚Äúher‚Äù, their words don‚Äôt do much to help. 

This is the best I can explain it.', 'I‚Äôm starting to wonder the same about my asexuality.']

['Not disclosing your ID to law enforcement here is a misdemeanor and police can detain you for up to 48 hours automatically until you have been positively IDed.  

After that a judge can order your lock up if you are deemed dangerous until identified.', 'Seriously, I love Fel Reaver. 
 Arena.  My Aggro-Control Jaina against Thrall.

Turn 1: I pass.  
Turn 1B: Thrall coins out Haunted Creeper.    
Turn 2: I play Mad Bomber (no other 2 drops, only other plays were ping or Mirror Image).  Mad Bomber hits me and kills the Creeper.  Oops.  
Turn 2 B: Thrall trades the Spiders for the Bomber, taps and gets the Health Totem.   
Turn 3: Play Spellslinger and get Windfury.   
Turn 3B: Thrall plays Ironfur Grizzly.   
Turn 4: I play Fallen Hero, ping away the totem, Spellslinger trades with Grizzly leaving him a 3/1.   
Turn 4B: Thrall plays Refreshment Vendor...   
Turn 5:  FEL BUDDY!  Go face with Spellslinger.   
Turn 5B:  He goes face with Refreshment Vendor?? (Should have killed my Spellslinger of course).  Plays Tauren Warrior and Totem Golem.      
Turn 6: Kill the Warrior with the 3/1 Spellslinger.  Dragon's Breath on Golem.  Windfury on Reaver and face twice Thrall now down to 11. Play Mirror Image.   
Turn 6B: Thrall draws his card, emotes "That was a mistake" and concedes.  Heh :p   
   
That one felt so nice :)  Beat Thrall with his own card :p  
  
(And yes my fav class in Ranked is Priest indeed...  Kill you with your cards muahehehe...)', "Peppers aren't actively harmful.  Sure they give a burning sensation but they are not really dangerous in normal amounts.  Note:  Even water is dangerous in too large quantities and water poisoning exists.  I don't even mean drowning.  

So I'd say peppers are just edible.", 'It does change!  However the moon only moves around the Earth once every 28 days.  So in any given night the visibly lit part of the moon only changes by 1-54th of the surface.  Too little for us to easily see.']

["I'm thinking of the nurses with kids they need to provide for, or nurses with a mortgage", 'Tell them for sure! It sounds like you like them a lot.', "If I planned to have children, I would do all of that without the they/them pronouns part. I plan to use the pronouns that are associated with their sexes. I am nonbinary so they will see that it is okay to be outside of the gender binary. I just feel that a person needs to go through that self discovery, it shouldn't be made for them. I feel it's a lot of pressure to put on a child that they need to find themselves like that. 

But that is only my opinion. How I see it is that now, this child who will likely identify with their agab is now being forced to use pronouns that may not fit them. Yes this gives them the freedom to decide, but I fear a child cannot understand completely. They cannot consent to this. They do not get the choice. Which is why I feel it's better to let them choose later, after they already know themselves. It's how I found myself. I know that, had I been raised using they/them pronouns, I would have had a happier childhood. But is my child, who likely wont want to use they/them pronouns, going to suffer how I did? Feel trapped in a gender they do not want? Would this child resent me for using those pronouns for them? 

This is all very hard to decide. Those who decide to raise their children like this, I applaud. You are very brave as you know it will be hard. Schools will be difficult for both you and the child. Work, doctors, social media. They will all make it very difficult. So if this is how you raise your child, I hope it all goes well. The world will be watching to see how they turn out.

Edit: I'm glad I didn't get downvoted to hell, lol. Thanks for hearing me out!", 'Is it not normal to spend several hours trying to fall asleep at night? I do that nearly every night..']

["I use tretinoin as recommended by my derma. I had horrible breakout 2-3 months ago so I started going to the derma. Skin type is oily acne-prone.

PM:

<BOLD> Cleanse:

Nivea Micellair water and LowPH Cleansing Gel

<BOLD> Tone:\- Isntree Hyaluronic Acid Toner

<BOLD> Serum: Iunik Propolis Serum

<BOLD> Treat: Tretinoin OR Benzoyl Peroxide (I alternate them for 6 days straight, and then take a break for a day)

<BOLD> Moisturize: Celeteque Hydrator / Rosehip Oil (or both)

I use BHA and AHA once to twice a week only when I'm using benzoyl peroxide. I've had minimal purging but the type to leave a mark. I generally don't have sensitive skin but this routine might be a lot for some people, but it works for me!", "Hello! How are you finding 3CE's velvet lip tint in Taupe? I have that in my Shopee cart. Haha.", "I feel this way! Especially with skincare üò¢ key ingredients just isn't the same as ingredients list.", "I think it's best to start with the basic routine and let it settle muna. Maybe 3-4 weeks (skin turnover) then slowly add products like a chemical exfoliator, then toner, targetted serums, etc.", "I think there are two variants. I have the cream variant (comes in white tube). It's very emollient so it feels thick but not heavy. Not sure if that makes sense but basically: emollient. The lotion variant, I heard, is thinner and creamier.

Note that I live in a hot and humid country so my standard for thick moisturizers is quite thin. Haha."]

['Thank you!! This was my first mother's day. My wife is warming to my truth and she surprised me with a new dress and necklace and did my makeup and told me "Happy Mother's Day". That wasn't easy for her, but it just proves how much she really truly loves me. 

It's literally the best day I've had in years, and it was the greatest gift I've ever gotten in my entire life! 

I hope everyone, both current and future mother's, have a very happy mother's day too ‚ù§Ô∏è', "I'm doing my best. As you can tell I'm still conflicted on a lot lol. I'm growing. Trying to be myself is hard when I've never been permitted to. Learning every day :)", "I've been full time femme for 6 days now!!! Never got misgendered once so far, even at the beach in my one piece! It's been amazing, and I'm so grateful for my wife for encouraging me to come out and be myself! Never going back! :)", "Thank you. Thats all I can really say. Thank you so much.


I don't know you, but I love you for your words. I'm all sorts of messed up, but I am open to learning and changing. I have years of hardcore Christian upbringing, right wing politics and abusive parents that I don't feel I can move past. But I am learning.


I want so badly to support the LGBT community, because if I'm trans, then that means their struggles are just as, if not more valid than mine. Since I've come more to terms with this, I've stopped judging so harshly. I hope that through this process my heart can soften more and I can let things go. I'm struggling with my upbringing, I understand that. It's hard to move past sometimes. 


You may be different than me in belief systems, politics, or any other number of ways. But I love you Sister. Thank you for welcoming me as your sister despite my differences and prejudices. I won't forget it.  <3"]

["I'm sorry for all the pain and stress that this is bringing to you. It must be very difficult to have all this happening at once. Today is just one day, there's lots of time to figure yourself out. You'll be okay.", "Fear and Grieving for Lost Food 
 I had my gallbladder removed in my early 20's and was immediately diagnosed with IBS-D, and told that was normal for many people having their gallbladder removed.

I'm 32 now, and it's been many years since I've experienced really bad IBS symptoms, and suddenly last Friday I had some of the worst pain I've had since the gallstones, and now I can barely eat anything without sharp and gnawing pains and bloating and gas... I'm down to almonds and rice and a few fruits and veggies.

But I spent the last few years learning how to cook and I'm good at it! And I just bought a fancy new knife... and... I'm just overwhelmed with grief for what I might be losing as I see stories of people having this kind of pain all the time.

Maybe it's a small thing to harp on, but garlic??! I can't lose garlic! How will I make anything taste better? My beloved Caesar salads! 

See, the thing is, I had an eating disorder. A really, really severe binge eating disorder. And I learned how to cook to manage it, at my therapist's advice... This just blows all that recovery out of the water and my first response about dealing with it is eating, so that's out, and my second is despair, which I reject, so I'm just floundering.

I just went hunting through my recipes and found ONE that I can make again. It's a ray of hope in what has been a painful week where I had to cancel everything, slept through all the evenings where I could have been with my husband... 

I'm feeling panicked and raw and lonely. And I'm trying to see the other side. It's been a really, really hard week.

Words of encouragement would be appreciated, if you can spare them from your own suffering.", "Have you looked into the Theology of the Body? I think you'd greatly benefit from some of the wonderful teachings there. Check out Christopher West and the Theology of the Body institute, if you haven't already! 

God bless you in your obedience. We are all called to be chaste, thank you for deciding to accept that call.", "Maybe next time he'll think before he cheats."]

That image will forever be in my mind. Her sparkling blue eyes, full of love, her salty wet hair, her comforting smile.. it was amazing. And on top of that, the rain stopped and the most beautiful rainbow I have ever seen formed. We went on to have what would be one of the best nights of my life.

Thank you so much for sharing all of this with me', 'Too many people mistake equality with equity and that is not fair to people who suffer more social problems. ["Did your opinion on parts of yourself switch after you started considering transition? 
 Hi! I'm questioning mtf, and I realized something the other day.

I'm 5'5, and every day of my life I hated being so short as a guy because I felt lesser in a way, or that I wouldn't be taken as seriously, or just uncomfortable that I was so much shorter than my male peers.

Once I stared seriously considering transition, though, I stopped hating it. I actually kind of like being so short because It fits my image of what I want to look like as a woman better. 

So my question is this: If I was <ITALIC> really trans, wouldn't I have always liked being so short? Is this something other people have experienced, or is it not normal? Thanks!", 'Thinking about transitioning, but no dysohoria 
 This is kind of uncomfortable for me to post because I feel like I'm stuck at a crossroads between transitional to female and maybe being happier, and staying as male and maybe getting over it in the future.

I want to get right into it. I don't feel dysphoria, atleast not how I've seen it described. I recognize that right now, I am male, my body is male, and my brain is male. This isn't a pot shot at people who think otherwise that have/are/will be transitioning: it just has nothing to do with me.

The reason I want to transition, or why I think I do anyway, is because I think I'd be happier as a girl. For the past couple years whenever I saw a woman acting in a feminine way, even just the way they stand or look around, I get jealous. I realized I wanted to stand the way they do, to laugh and look and act like a woman. In those past couple years, I've given up on being a masculine guysy guy because I figured I was just more effeminate than typical. Most of my friends are woman, I like cute things, etc, but I'm still jealous. I want to have long hair and stand in cute ways.

I know I keep coming back to the standing thing, and I know it's a small detail, but it's what made me initially realize I was interested in becoming a female, so I just keep coming back to it.

But I really don't think I'm dysphoric. I don't think I'm a woman trapped in a man's body. Again I have absolutely no problem if you do feel dysphoric in this way, it's just not what I feel about myself. I recognize that right now, I'm a guy, but I think I'd like to be a girl. It's a shame there's no trial or demo, haha.

I've thought about cross dressing before, because I think that's as close to a "demo" that I could get, but when I think of myself wearing the makeup and the clothes and a wig and staring into the mirror I don't think I'll like it. It feels wrong, but I'm not really sure why I guess. I think it's because I still identify as a male, and so I don't want to see my male self dressed like a girl. (as an aside, I don't like seeing myself at all, but I think that's more of a self image problem)

Ive spent the last couple days looking at both <SUBREDDIT> and <SUBREDDIT>, because I like seeing both sides of it, and it honestly scares me. I understand that one sub is full of people who have had/are having happy experiences transitioning, and the other is full of people who are regretful, but its making me very nervous. Will I really be happy as a girl? Will I be OK with taking pills for the rest of my life? From stories on detrans I've kinda decided against ever getting surgery, and I think I'm kind of OK with that, if a bit let down.

 I really just wish I was born a girl. I wish I had my childhood as a girl, grown up as a girl, gone to high school as a girl, etc. Although I guess a lot of people want that, haha.

I'm any case I'd really appreciate any insight on my situation, whether you're trans or not, supportive or not. I dont really feel comfortable talking about this to people I know irl, but I really really just want to talk to <ITALIC> someone about it. Thank you, and I'm sorry of any of my comments felt offensive. I just want to say again that everything Ive said is about me, and I have absolutely nothing against the detrans or trans communities or people who have / have had gender dysphoria.

TLDR: Not sure if I'm dysphoric and I'm scared of making the commitment. If you have the time, please read the full post. Thank you', "Thank you for your perspective! I'm glad it's a normal thing to feel. I guess my brain is literally looking for any excuse for me to not be trans", "Oh, I didn't even notice there was no h, sorry! That's a really interesting reason, though!! Thank you for teaching me a ton about the name :)"]

['This is amazing and I love everything about it!', "Finding people who genuinely like you is not always easy, but it is definitely worth it! It took me nearly 25 years to find a hobby out of home that I genuinely love, for example. Never would have imagined it, but it happened.

Pff, man, I just turned 26 and I had this sort of small existential crisis... Who even am I?! I've spent literal years of my life masking so much of my behaviours and anxieties, to my own detriment. And now I am getting actual help, from people that know a whole lot about ASD, so I'm trying to dig through all of that, to maybe find a small part of who I was before it all went topsyturvy.

We are a minority, neurodiverse amongst the neurotypicals. That's why places like this subreddit are so important, because here we have people who actually understand what it feels like :)", '[For Hire] Pen and ink or watercolor (character) portraits', "Creating my first Player Character and could use some help 
 Last summer I discovered the amazing and wonderful thing that is LARP, it was love at first sight.
Since I was on a bit of a tight budget, and am usually a bit on the careful side when experiencing new things, I decided to join as an NPC.
It was a great decision!
In a matter of days I got to be a scared villager, deranged minion, zombie, semi-Skyrim-Viking queen and so much more. On my second event I got to be a paladin for mostly the entire weekend!
(and I also discovered that where LARPing is concerned, I am far less careful than I normally am! Something wich slightly shocked and scared my boyfriend at the time; as he'd hoped to gently ease me into it).


Now that I am a little more familiar with the setting of my LARP and with the hobby (lifestyle?) as a whole, I decided it was time I experienced the other side of it as a player.
For the next two events, I'll still be an NPC, but after that I want to be my own character. 


Now, I've written some stories in my day and I've created some costumes for renfaires (or whatever my local equivalent of those are); but doing these things for LARP is something on an entirely different level! (As in I will actually have to BE this character, maybe for a couple of years if I'm lucky).
I have some idea where to start, but I could really use some advice of more experienced LARPers!
Like what are some definite don'ts when creating a first character? Are there certain things I should avoid (especially seeing as I'm not entirely great at improv-acting yet)?


Do you guys have any tips in the costuming department? I have several months to create this costume (and I have some fabrics that I think will do nicely), so time is not a problem.
Is there anything I should or shouldn't do as far as my costume is concerned? 
I've only ever created costumes that I only had to wear for a couple of hours, so if they weren't entirely comfortable that wasn't really a problem...


Furthermore, are there some general hints, tips or tricks that I might not be aware of? Or that could be useful even for NPCing?
"]

It's basically just a back stitch and then the thread is looped through each stitch after.", 'HELP! Large blackheads, dermatillomania, and dry/oily skin! At a total loss of where to even begin on a skincare routine or how to use products! 
 So the tl;dr of this is that I just want to get some suggestions and advice for what to use and how to use skincare products because no one taught me this stuff and when I walked into the shop the other day there were so many options and I have no idea even where to begin!  

I am looking for a <BOLD> low cost care routine that's reasonably <BOLD> simple though I am willing to put work into it!  A nightly 30 minute to 1 hour routine really won't work right now but something that's 15 minutes or less nightly would probably be manageable. Doing a 2x or 3x a week longer thing to add into that would be fine too!  

I don't know what to ask for because I have never used 90% of these products and don't know what they do!  I am hoping the information below might help get me pointed at least in the right direction!  To those of you who help, thank you SO MUCH in advance!  Even dropping links to resources to read would be super helpful!  If there's anything I'm currently using or suggesting that is a big NO, please tell me!  


<BOLD> Products I am currently using:

* <BOLD> Alba Botanica Acnedote Face & Body Scrub, Maximum Strength 
   * In shower, every other day.  Seemed to help at first when I got it in 2016 but doesn't seem to do much now in terms of controlling breakouts? (But maybe it would be worse if I didn't?)
   <ITALIC>  Yes I am a trash monster and don't wash my face every day ahaha.  I.... think that would probably help too but all my soaps dry my face out!  The scrub is nice but I don't know if I should be using it daily?  I feel like a general face wash would help but they all seem to make me produce more* oil.
   <ITALIC>  I use my hands to wash my face right now, no scrubbers or cloths or anything like that.
 <BOLD> Hard Candy Lite Bright Whipped Brightening Concealer with brush
   * only when having bad outbreaks that need covered (usually spot treatment - 1-2 times a month)
   <ITALIC>  I would like to switch as local shops don't carry this anymore and I know it's not that high quality.
 <BOLD> Tony Moly Green Tea Face Mask & Green Tea Eye Mask 
   * got as a gift with a <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>
   * used one each of the face masks and eye masks and enjoyed them!
   * face mask seemed to help condition of skin
   * used eye mask 3 days later but felt that my cheek area where the mask rested broke out
   * No idea how frequently I should be using masks or what masks are good for my skin
   * I have one of each left so I am open to trying something different!

My <BOLD> previous experiences with skincare products have been with <BOLD> Proactive which caused me to break out way worse.  I kept with it for about three months and the moment I stopped my skin cleared up within a couple weeks.  This was about 5 years ago.  




<BOLD> Products I think I'd like to use:  
<ITALIC> These are items that I've heard talked about but I don't know how often, how much, or safe/good brands to use or if my skintype would dictate if I should or should not use something!

<ITALIC>  Someone recommended getting a <BOLD> personal microderm?  Does anyone have experience with this and would you recommend it for someone prone to having lots of blackheads on the nose and cheeks?
 <BOLD> Facewash \- I have heard that African black soap mixed with shea butter can be great?  But?????
<ITALIC>  <BOLD> Toner \- there's been a lot of mention about witch hazel?   Is this a good product to use?
 <BOLD> Tea Tree Oil \- for pimples.  Should it be mixed with a carrier oil?  If so, what?  How?  How frequently do you apply this?!
<ITALIC>  <BOLD> Face Lotion \- just.... help!  ahaha
 <BOLD> Face Masks \- I like these!  I just don't want to use something that will make my skin worse!  

If you think there's anything I am missing please don't hesitate to mention it! And for all for all of this - exactly how often should I be doing this?  I know it's going to vary person to person but I just don't even know where to start!

  


  
<BOLD> -------  The Background Post -------    (read this for more detailed information)

I'm 30 years old and until now didn't really put any effort into my skin.  I have mild dermatillomania which I tend to focus on my fingers and chest rather than my face (fortunately?) but it will migrate when I start getting pimples and such.  While I know hot showers are bad for my skin they're one of the few things I have that seem to calm a host of other issues and allow me to relax and get a reasonable night's sleep.  (I tried going cooler back when my hair was colored but while my color lasted longer, I got less sleep and my anxiety/stress skyrocketed). Because I have curly hair and oily scalp, I wash my hair about once every 4-6 days depending on how my hair is feeling.  I use a dry shampoo usually once within that period if my hair seems greasy but my forehead acne and hair/scalp health has majorly improved since switching to this routine two years ago. 

SO, hot showers dry out skin.  I then have oily skin (probably due to an overproduction of oils to counteract the dry skin from the showers).  I started using <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> in the mornings but my face seemed to just get worse and my breakouts and clogged pores were terrible.  When I stopped, it seemed to fade.  However, I hate how dry and stretched my skin feels despite also leaking oil.  It's gross and my pores are clogged anyway.  I do break out badly whenever I start my period as well.

I know staying hydrated is important and I'm not a huge fan of water but drink about 64-130oz of tea a day.  The tea is whole loose leaf tea brewed in low temp water with no additives (it's very high quality tea, brewed gongfu style usually, and at a lower temperature \~160-170F so by time I drink it it's usually around or below 120F).

I rock climb and do a variety of classes (ROM, CoreFit, Yoga, Swimming (less often)) and do drink just water during those, usually going through about 32 oz of pure water.

I am """"dieting""" and by that I mean, eating healthy and just trying to lose weight.  I am not following any specific diet plan but most of my diet is based on Japanese style cooking with Mediterranean and Eastern Asian cuisine thrown in.  Lots of seafood (usually salmon and shrimp), chicken (moving away from thigh to breast) and veggies (broc, sweet potato, kabocha, cauliflower, leafy greens (kale, spinach, collards), carrots, etc).  I portion out my rice as well when I make it in bulk so I usually end up with about 4oz in a serving.  My main goal is to stay under right around 1200 calories per day.  I eat when I am hungry and stop when I'm full and it generally seems to work out.  I do eat sweets but only occasionally.

Currently, I do not wear makeup much (beyond some crappy concealer when blemishes are really bad and I have an event at work).  

I sleep on a silk pillowcase (curly hair works better with it) and I know I should wash it more frequently.  I just got a second one and while I was going about 2 weeks between washings but I would like to get to it 1x a week at least now!  It's only been about a month since this changed but I'm not sure I'm seeing any skin changes at this point.  As for sleep habits, I get about 6-7 hours of sleep a night - I try to get in bed by 11:00pm each night and be attempting to sleep at 11:30pm.  I wake up at 5:45/6:00am.  Sometimes if I'm lucky I can get in bed by 10 but that's rare.  

Lastly, I'm afab (assigned female at birth) but ID as nonbinary.  I am looking to start on low dose testosterone and I suspect that's going to mess up my skin (it's basically second puberty).  I may have to alter whatever routine I start now but I figured it's better to get into good habits now than put it off.

  
\-------

<BOLD> I'll try and sum all that up as best I can

<ITALIC>  30 years old
 AFAB (not yet on horomones but looking to start testosterone within the year)
* Dry skin that produces a LOT of oil to make up for it 
   <ITALIC>  HOT SHOWERS 
 6-7 hrs sleep per night / silk pillowcase washed 1x a week
* Decent hydration 
   <ITALIC>  Mostly tea though, which counteracts some of that
 No makeup on a day-to-day basis
* Healthy foods and regular exercise




<BOLD> IF YOU MADE IT THIS FAR BLESS YOUR SOUL and thank you so much!  I've started getting the rest of my life healthier and I think it's about time my skin got the same attention.  I appreciate any advice or links to help with this journey!']

['Top surgery... at home? 
 [TW: self harm] (I wasn‚Äôt sure if I should use the suicide flair because it‚Äôs self harm, so let me know if I should change it)

Edit: thank you guys so much for your kind words. They helped so much. Even though it‚Äôs only been one day I‚Äôm feeling a lot better now and I‚Äôm practicing meditation. Again, thank you so much, your words mean so much to me. :)

Hey y‚Äôall. I self harmed today and drew blood for the second time, ever. Of course, I didn‚Äôt try and give myself top surgery (this shows up later), but I left over 10 cuts in my hip/thigh and every time they sting it reminds me of how worthless my body is. I hate it. I hate it so much. It‚Äôs so frustrating. Self harm is honestly the only way I cope since I‚Äôm closeted. I could never tell anyone about anything that goes on in my life. My self harm, my dysphoria, my anxiety, my depression, my nervous breakdowns, it‚Äôs all kept to myself. I have trust issues, so that probably contributes to my ‚Äòkeeping it to myself‚Äô plan.
I just wish I was a real man, but I‚Äôm not, and I never will be.(not that you aren‚Äôt a real man if you are a trans guy, it‚Äôs just me because I‚Äôm a fucking idiot.)

Not only that, I had a nervous breakdown yesterday in the shower and almost gave myself a DIY top surgery right then and there with an old pair of those weird dull toddler scissors. Giving myself top surgery comes across my mind every hour. It‚Äôs always floating back there, since my dysphoria is mainly focused on my chest. Just thinking of not being able to get top surgery for YEARS since I‚Äôm only 13 brings tears to my eyes. I want to be in my bed with fresh scars across my chest and just be able to think ‚ÄòI‚Äôm finally flat‚Äô. But I‚Äôm nowhere near there. I have a chest binder from a friend, and I want to wear it 24/7, but I know better than that.

I mean, what is ONE night sleeping with a binder going to do? If it‚Äôs just one time, it can‚Äôt be that bad... right?

Idfk. I honestly just want to disappear and never come back. I have to stay though, of course.
To cope other than self harming I‚Äôm thinking of writing a poem. Maybe I‚Äôll share it here. That sounds nice.

Anyways, y‚Äôall have a nice day. Y‚Äôall are lovely. ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Pet rats in Brussels? 
 (I posted this in <SUBREDDIT> but I thought it would be ok to post it here as well, hope that‚Äôs alright )

Hello! I‚Äôm possibly moving to Brussels in a few months (I‚Äôm with an embassy), but it depends on what happens with COVID-19. Either way, I‚Äôm moving in a few months and was wondering if it‚Äôs ok to own rats in Brussels.

I‚Äôm planning on getting two fancy rats soon after I arrive, but I‚Äôm unsure of the laws. Can anyone help me find resources or tell me about any laws regarding pet rats?
Plus, if anyone knows of any rat breeders could you tell me about that?

Thanks! Stay safe! :)', 'Second time drawing blood. 
 (Note: I wasn‚Äôt sure whether to flair this as rant/vent or lgbtq+, so if I need to change the flair let me know)

I‚Äôm so frustrated with myself. I cut for the second time today using (Idk if this makes sense) a line of staples that were still stuck together. It wasn‚Äôt very sanitary...
I left a ton of cuts, while the last time I only left three. It didn‚Äôt bleed that bad, but it still stung a bunch.
I feel like I deserved it, but at the same time I have a feeling I didn‚Äôt. I cleaned it up in the shower with soap, hydrogen peroxide, and I put two bandaids to cover the long line of cuts up. (I cut on my hip/thigh) 
I‚Äôm so frustrated with myself. I stared at myself in the mirror after I did it, and I kept on thinking, ‚Äòidiot. Idiot. Idiot‚Äô. I just hate the fact that the only way I cope is through self harm at this point. The problem isn‚Äôt even my fault. 
I can‚Äôt help the fact that I was born the way I am. (I‚Äôm ftm transgender but still in the closet) Honestly at this point taking scissors and giving myself top surgery has come across my mind every hour. I almost did it during a nervous breakdown yesterday. I don‚Äôt want to wait so many years to get top surgery, I really don‚Äôt. The only way I get my anger and frustration out at this point is cutting. 
The first time I cut I didn‚Äôt feel guilty while doing it, but then I feel guilty afterwards so I do it again because I deserve it. It‚Äôs an endless cycle that I can‚Äôt stop. It‚Äôs frustrating. 
I might try venting like this more often. It feels sort of nice. I‚Äôll look for some other subreddits I can vent on. 

Anyways, sorry for clogging up this subreddit with my useless chatter. I hope you have a nice day. ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'They are so pretty! This is lovely :)']
