['Questioning 
 I know you guys get this a lot but I‚Äôm honestly so confused. Just recently I‚Äôve started questioning my gender identity. At first I thought I was just overthinking it and I usually do, but I‚Äôve been having continuous thoughts about possibly being non-binary. Like when I or any other person refer to me as a woman I cringe a little inside. However I still get bothered when people refer to me as male, admittedly not as much though as being called female. It was so subtle to me though that I just thought I was being weird about myself and it was no big deal. In terms of pronouns I‚Äôm honestly not too bothered by she/he pronouns, but I feel a sense of ease in my brain when I want to be referred to by they/them pronouns. I don‚Äôt experience extreme dysphoria like I‚Äôm mostly fine with my body, but I don‚Äôt like showing off my body shape to people. I do have some voice dysphoria though I want it to be lower it sounds better to me. I‚Äôm just wondering if this is maybe a sign or if I‚Äôm just over exaggerating it?', 'Talking to strangers advice 
 So I‚Äôm an AFAB agender that leans more masculine, but I still have some feminine traits to me so I look fairly androgynous. ['Game to get to know each other better? 
 Is there a game you could play with someone to get to know each other better? (simple things like favorite color, food, drink, animal, etc)', "Feeling bad because I look weird in the clothes I want 
 It's so hard to buy the clothes I like. I look so weird in most feminine clothes. (I like both. Just depends on my mood. Sometimes I want masculine, sometimes feminine clothes) But I really hate how weird I look.", 'I am a bit bothered by how you worded that statement (but wait a sec, I'm not here to hate on you. That comment is definitely dumb, they probably don't understand dysphoria)  
Now what bothers me is how "general" it is. I am non binary and I am letting my hair grow longer because it gives me euphoria.  
So don't get me wrong. If you say that chopping off your hair is satisfying, that's totally valid. Because that's how you experience dypshoria and euphoria.  
But whenever I see that I too wish that haircuts weren't so gendered.   
Not justifying that comment tho.   
Tumblr works a bit differently than reddit - this is your blog, you decide what you post and no one should hate on you for that.', "Worried about a non binary friend 
 A while ago I made a post for them (because they are still in the closet and can't risk being seen here) and we found out that their binder might be too small for them. It has caused them chest pain and now they are comlaining about shoulder pain while wearing it. I told them to stop but they don't want to. I don't want to be insensitive because I don't want them to feel dysphoric but I think they should get a new one so they don't cause permanent damage to their body but right now they won't listen to me. So is there anything they can do to feel less dysphoric while we try to get a new one for them? Their family shouldn't find out and they don't have a lot of money so I told them to try to get a free binder from one of these websites that give out free binders."]

["Should I quit my job? 
 I'm starting graduate school in a 17 credit program for teaching (next semester possible double masters in English/creative writing). I have a job at a bakery. It blows. I am funded by financial aid and I hate to admit it but my parents (for rent) but I like to have my own money for food n' going out n' stuff. Right now they have me on the schedule at my job for three times per week (on two days I have classes and Saturday).

I'm about to receive a 3,000 financial aid check and will be getting paid 250 to help my professor with editing at some point. I'm really overwhelmed by my courses and it's only been a day. Is it okay to quit? Should I, or just cut back?", 'Why does it hurt in my jaw when I breathe? 
 I have muscular based TMJ disorder. I get frequent cavities and have an issue with my bite (open bite). 

The past three weeks it has hurt to breathe in my upper jaw area. Sometimes when this happens my eyes also water. Went to the dentist, fillings look fine and no cavities (I think he could be wrong honestly). Went to the TMJ specialist and he wants to give me Botox for my muscles. BUT it makes absolutely no sense whatsoever why it hurts to breathe in my upper jaw. My ENT ordered a CT scan of my sinuses. Can someone please help?', 'To shorten my sentences when long sentences (besides this one) are my JAM.', "That's very true. That will also test how strong the connection is. Thank you :)"]

Give me the noob treatment, because that's what I feel like right now. It's very shocking.

e: okay, I guess I need a wheel. Unfortunately I legitimately cannot afford one right now, unless it was literally ten dollars including tax and shipping. I can change my technique, but I can't change not having a wheel, so I appreciate any feedback on things I <ITALIC> can change", 'you should go read up on executive dysfunction, adhd, and maybe talk directly to some people with mental health struggles or shitty home lives. in the most blank, objective, lacking nuance view yes, the solution to your problems is to take care of yourself and keep a basic self care routine that doesn't come at the expense of your body and goals.

but, goddamn dude it is just not that easy. and telling people the thing that they know they gotta do and are struggling to do with a really oblivious attitude of "go do it" is really unhelpful. sometimes all your energy for the day goes to just getting out of bed at all, or just not sobbing all day. ive been in those places before, and that was at 16 with a decent life and just absolutely horrible untreated mental health issues. forgive the phrase but homie you gotta check your privilege here and realize effectively what you're doing is talking down to people who really just need something uplifting instead of oblivious and patronizing. hopefully that helps you understand the negativity.

['Yes it was most likely disassociation. I am going through the same thing but farther along than you. I didnt care how long I lived, if I had died the next day I would not have cared, I was excited by the thought of what happens when you die (the last great mystery!), I didnt have the lung capacity to run or jog or even ride a bike for any length of time, my teeth were so freaking yellowed from smoking, I didnt care if I was chubby going on fat, I just didnt care at all. I thought I was a hopeless ugly unlovable mess because if I hate me no matter what then who could ever love me. I shaved my beard I had grown since I was a teen and now I cant stand the sight and feel of even a little stubble! I always had long hair and couldnt bear the thought of cutting it short but never could figure out why. I was having stress related rapid aging symptoms (hairloss, creaky achy crunchy joints, no energy or passion for things, frequent heartburn, and so on), and now many of those are going away with everything I do to improve myself in preparation for HRT. But just wait for the dysphoria to hit, its super reaffirming but still sucks, the euporia is awesome though! Maybe I'm just being weird but it causes a little uptick in my dysphoria when I think about it.

['I‚Äôm unemployed, so no work insurance. I‚Äôll be going back to full-time university work in the fall so having a full-time job (for the benefits) with an infant/soon-to-be toddler and therapy and all that...... I don‚Äôt know that I could handle it. I do have Medicaid as a secondary insurance, though, so I think I could update/reapply to make my primary should I get kicked off my mom‚Äôs.

Unfortunately I think my mom is a bit too privy to my financial situation and knows I wouldn‚Äôt be able to pay for my own car insurance and cell phone bill. But tbh I almost don‚Äôt care anymore. \U0001f937üèª‍‚ôÄÔ∏è', 'Why the fuck did no one tell me it was going to be THIS complicated?!? 
 First post, on mobile, looong post, first time mom, a bit of a lurker, etc. etc.

Honestly could‚Äôve flaired this with breastfeeding, medical woes, and fuck everything but emotional rollercoaster probably encompasses all this shit. Just need to rant. 

I gave birth to my beautiful baby boy at the end of October last year (oh right, it‚Äôs 2020 now!). He‚Äôs now almost 10 weeks old. I was dead set on exclusively breastfeeding him from the get go, because that‚Äôs what our bodies were built for, right??? Well...

I took the breastfeeding class, read the breastfeeding books and pamphlets and websites, thought ‚Äúhow hard could this really be?‚Äù But no one could‚Äôve prepared me for how difficult, taxing, demanding this whole process has been and how abandoned I‚Äôve truly felt.

I was induced, hemorrhaged more blood during delivery, and baby was jaundiced following delivery (needed bili lights). My milk was late to come in, I really didn‚Äôt feel like I had much colostrum, and baby‚Äôs latch was so painful my nipples were rubbed raw and scabbed. The hospital lactation consultant casually mentioned baby had a ‚Äúslight tongue tie‚Äù but left it at that. I thought nothing of it, just that maybe I was failing at something that should‚Äôve been ~natural~ and biologically destined for the both of us. Anyway, I broke down in the hospital after a night of continuous hunger crying and gave him donor milk, and we gave him formula the first nights home because of the same issue.

Despite almost exclusively breastfeeding him now (my partner feeds him 1-2 bottles of expressed milk or formula a day so I can sleep) we‚Äôre still barely getting to the bottom of our nursing issues... but not because of the guidance from doctors, the lactation consultant, or nurses (shout out to the moms in the FB group I‚Äôm in for being so helpful!).

The LC I saw 2 and 3 weeks PP gave me such a judgy, all-or-nothing attitude with respect to breastfeeding that I gave her a hearty Fuck You when she told me to cancel our 3rd appointment if I decided against exclusively putting him to breast (like, no bottles, no pumping AT ALL). She didn‚Äôt seem bothered to help with my supply (weighted feeds showed baby wasn‚Äôt transferring enough) other than telling me that all I needed to do was EBF. Ha, yeah right... Both times I left her office I felt more disheartened than before. And she wondered why I was showing signs of PPD...üôÑ 

Well, after weeks of personal research, the FB group, and rough home assessments, I‚Äôm convinced our problems with low/barely enough supply, painful and shallow latches, extended feedings (sometimes over TWO HOURS and ALWAYS over 45-60min), and trouble transferring milk are due to that goddamn tongue tie and possible lip tie. NO ONE told me this was something that could devastate our breastfeeding relationship, despite being a relatively quick revision. NO ONE bothered to look beyond blaming me for giving him bottles as the reason for having a lower milk supply. And here I am, over 2 months PP just beginning to piece this shit together on my own while dealing with PPD.

I just feel so fucking screwed over by the people that are supposed to be experts, supposed to help you figure all this VERY NEW shit out. I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve agonized over breastfeeding my child, feeling guilty for giving him formula, being saddened by a meager pump output. The pediatrician, the hospital nurses, the lactation consultants, etc. all emphasize how /important/ breastfeeding is and heavily encourage it, but they leave you hanging when any problems other than a simple latch issue arise. Well, how the FUCK else was I going to know?!? It‚Äôs not my job! My only job is to keep this precious little human alive and fed and loved and content but I can‚Äôt do that properly if you can‚Äôt help me identify WHY it‚Äôs all so hard!!! 

My rockstar of a partner has aided in all the research, scheduled an appointment with a pediatric dentist to check for those mouth ties and other possible oral motor issues, is going to schedule baby in for bodyworking sessions, and has overall been as supportive as humanly possible as the non-breastfeeding parent. Seriously, bless her fucking heart. I hope the combo of these things, as well as finding a new LC, magically fixes things, but only time will tell. 

All I‚Äôve learned from this is that you have to be your own and your baby‚Äôs biggest advocate, because sometimes the people that should give a fuck about your problems don‚Äôt actually care to look beyond the surface. 

Breastfeed, combo feed, formula feed. Do what‚Äôs best for you and your LO. Don‚Äôt let anyone pressure you into feeling like shit for choosing any one path. Your mental and physical health matters just as much as your baby‚Äôs, and you‚Äôre allowed to change your mind as much as you need!!!

The end and thanks for reading lol.', 'Chubbyemu made a great <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> about this exact case!', 'How to cut them off... I‚Äôm done with the toxicity. 
 If it weren‚Äôt past 3:30am I‚Äôd probably have the energy to write a long winded post of all the reasons I want to cut my parents off, but the long and short of it is that I‚Äôm 100000% done with their Trump-supporting, racist, homophobic, transphobic, classist, ableist BULLSHIT. I am non-binary and bisexual and my partner is a non-binary trans woman and bisexual and we‚Äôre both still closeted to them. We do want to come out to them, even if it‚Äôs not the wisest. 

I just don‚Äôt know how to even initiate cutting them out of my life, especially since I am young (22), unemployed, and still relying on them financially (I‚Äôm still on my mom‚Äôs insurance, they pay for my car insurance and cell phone bill - off the top of my head). I‚Äôm willing to lose that financial support (even though I really need car insurance for appointments and returning to school in the fall) if it means getting them and their toxicity out of my, my baby‚Äôs, and my partner‚Äôs life. We‚Äôre currently living with my partner‚Äôs mom and stepdad who are breaths of fresh air compared to my parents. They‚Äôre even building us a studio apartment out of their garage for us to live in until my partner finishes her masters (she graduates undergrad in a couple weeks) and I finish school. 

Anyway, I don‚Äôt know what to do. Do I draft out a long letter? Do I send a short and blunt text that hints at more to come (I <ITALIC> do want them to know all the reasons why I want them out of my and my family unit‚Äôs lives - that their behavior is abhorrent and directly negatively affects us). They‚Äôre expecting to come and visit us tomorrow to see the baby (and it‚Äôs my dad‚Äôs birthday) and I want none of it. I appreciate any help.', "I'm sure this is for first dates, but staying in bed and watching The Office. Or Game of Thrones. My boyfriend and I do that a lot."]

["I was made uncomfortable because I was gay 
 TLDR; <SPOILER> A guy at work showed me the outline of his penis because I'm gay and he didn't get in trouble

This was a few years ago, but after reading a few stories here, this keeps popping back into my mind. I used to work in the food service industry at a certain chicken place. I was in the cold room stocking the salads, when one of the cooks came in. Let's call him BH for butthead.

BH: Hey LiteraryLesbian, look at this!

I turned around and BH was showing me the outline of his penis through his pants.

Me: Wtf?

BH: It's okay, you're gay so it doesn't matter.

(I had just come out in that past month)

After this I complained to one of the managers. BH was told not to talk to me anymore, but was given no warnings or punishments because the head manager liked him. Luckily I moved a few months later and never had to deal with BH again.

My biggest issue is not that he wasn't reprimanded, but that he thought it was okay because I was gay. Like wtf? My sexuality does not change the fact that he made me feel uncomfortable with his genitals. This was over 7 years ago now, so there's not any point bringing it up legally, but I had to get it out.", 'A friend telling me about their base jumping exploits', 'Well that hit really fucking hard, so thanks for that', 'Little girl sells her art to pay for her cancer treatment']

This story comes from the first DND campaign I was ever part of, playing a 3rd edition half elf fighter/barbarian. We had a lot of other party members come in and out, but for this story the only one who matters is our human cleric, let's call him Steve since I've got a story about a game he GMed as well and I like having names for reoccurring characters.

So, first off Steve was the GM's son, which might be how he got away with some of the shit he pulled. He claimed to have read every book for 3e and 3.5 but never cited the sources for anything he used to my recollection. I know he had the Rebuke Undead ability and he had some feat or variant or something that allowed him to take control of undead he successfully rebukes with no apparent limit as to how many he can control. He almost instantly got 5 skeletons under his command and he eventually gave them bows, he later got a wraith and two undead minotaurs. He referred to this collection as "The Army of Dorkness". On top of all of that, he eventually got a spellcasting bear as a mount, so, already he can stomp things using just his army and mount.

But that isn't all, he also acquired some +2 full plate, a +2 tower shield, and a cloak of displacement, so, nothing can hit him and anything that does has a 50% chance to just not. Then he acquired what he referred to as a replica of Sauron's mace from the start of the first Lord of the Rings movie. It was a +3 large (he had monkey grip) that imposed a DC15 fort save to not be knocked back 10 feet and, weather you pass it or not, a DC15 ref save to not be knocked prone, as well as 1d6 damage of any type other than slashing, piercing and bludgeoning, which can be changed as a free action. I believe he also had winged sandals but the party collectively had like 4 pairs of the things so that wasn't too special.

With all of this (plus some suspiciously high stats and good rolls) he was already strong enough to fight the entire rest of the party and win, with some hit points to spare since he never multiclassed and so was still getting cleric levels, giving him plenty of wound curing. But that wasn't enough for him, he did some kind of ritual to become half fire elemental, dealing damage to anyone who came in physical contact, becoming immune to fire and gaining the ability to cast Fire Storm and Wall of Fire at least once each per day at his divine caster level. At that point the party were just an afterthought to him, he didn't need us and none of us were having fun since he would just singlehandedly steamroll everything.

 A few session after he became a fire elemental and promptly retouted the entire campaign to the elemental plane of fire for reasons I don't remember the GM got fed up with his shit and canned the campaign entirely.

TL:DR: GM's son abuses rules and probly does some homebrew that he claims is legit and becomes so strong that the rest of the party are not needed, since the GM wasn't mean enough to the rest of us to build encounters only he could have any chance of handling.']

['I don‚Äôt want a relationship just not to have a wrecked friendship', 'I'm not trans but... 
 I wish pretty often that I was a guy. I like girls much more than guys, (despite my current crush being a guy) and I participate in male-dominated activities in my school, such as the marching band where I'm one of three not counting the color guard that rehearsed across the field. 
I alw felt that if I was a boy I'd be able to make friends easier. I look at packs of male buddies and I think, "man, I want that so badly." I can never build up the courage to try to build these friendships with boys, because it feels like alien territory. Mostly all my female friendships feel vapid and fake. 
If I was a boy I'd be able to date more girls. My current dating pool is about four people big and I can't stand any of them. Also it's more acceptable for a guy to make the first move. I could go on forever with reasons I'd like to be a boy. 
But I'm not one, so I lean pretty hard into my femininity. I play the token girl role whenever I can. I like being feminine, but I don't hate being masculine either. I think ab this sort of thing, about how if I was born a boy I'd be happier, but I have no disphoria or desire to transition. Being non-binary would solve none of my problems, because boys would still see me as "other"
Any other girls or boys, especially LGB people, do you relate? Do you find your daydreaming of seamlessly flowing into the social.groups of the opposite gender, but you're pretty sure you're not trans?', 'The worst is when you made a good joke but they don‚Äôt get it because they don‚Äôt know what one of the words on a card means, so they google it like three rounds later and laugh their ass off but a much worse joke won the round, and it was all in vain', 'I‚Äôll add you. I‚Äôm from the US, so when we reach that level of friendship we could exchange regional Pok√©mon']

['i still wobble on my gender identity sometimes (due to my agenderness but some possible genderfluidity? idk, i‚Äôll get back to u)

started questioning alongside when i was questioning my sexuality (what else is a dude to do?). i guess bc i was discovering that fundamental things about myself were not necessarily what i‚Äôd assumed them to be.

i didnt feel a connection to any binary gender and after realising this i tried describing myself (in my head) as non binary and the word just felt so  s o o t h i n g yknow, like balm. same goes for they/them pronouns. 

the realisation that gender meant nothing to me allowed me to experiment with labels and pronouns til i found ones that fit :)', 'thank you for your affirmation.

just to speak from my own experience, i want to transition (socially) because of the gender euphoria i feel when they/them pronouns are used for me. this is my primary motivator, as opposed to the varying levels of discomfort i felt when i knew people assumed me to be my assigned gender because of things like my hairstyle.

in my understanding, this is where transmeds/tucutes disagree. transmeds believe dysphoria is necessary because they view it as the only possible motive to transition, whereas tucutes recognise that both dysphoria and euphoria can drive someone to transition (whether that be medically or socially).

if i‚Äôve got that wrong, please let me know. i‚Äôm just going off my own understanding here :)

also, i understand that the whole ‚Äòi just wanted to be a different gender‚Äô thing has been used to belittle us. but honestly, why the fuck is that not how it works? i wish we lived in a world where we could define ourselves for ourselves, instead of having to ‚Äòprove‚Äô our transness. in my opinion at least, ‚Äòi want to be a different gender‚Äô sounds pretty fucking trans to me.

anyway, thank you for your affirming words and your input. have a good day :)', 'heh pleased to meet u, wishing u the merriest of cakedays :D', 'the stuff we‚Äôre taught in school is - drumroll - grossly oversimplified and erases marginalised identities, as usual. sex has never been a binary: intersex people have existed forever and continue to. gender is unrelated to sex, and since gender has nothing to do with biology, its not taught in biology?? srsly tho if u have any questions u wanna chat or smth']

['Friend (19F) who rejected me (19M) genuinely thinks she hasn't - advice needed! 
 Hi guys,

I could use some advice on a situation of mine. 

Recently, I caught feelings for a close friend and expressed my feelings to her. She said that because of her antidepressants, she isn't able to feel emotions too well and wishes to stay friends until she can figure herself out. I took that as a soft rejection and proposed that we should take some time apart so that I can move on from my feelings and maybe we can be friends after that.

However, things appeared to have gone differently than I had planned. Over the 2-3week period we weren't supposed to be talking, we each broke the silence occasionally, sometime by accident and sometimes on purpose. Recently however, she commented me on a Snapchat story of mine and we started talking. All of a sudden, she messages "I miss you, when can we meet?"

I was shocked at this and wanted to know why but I didn't have time to text and find out so I said we could talk later if she wanted to come over after my shift. Well, she didn't. So I was like "cool, I set aside some time for you come and say your piece, but i don't want anymore bullshit, so please don't mess me about."

She asked to meet the next day, I took some time to think and agreed, one of my friends said it would be better to have this talk in public incase she tries anything. We had a nice catch up then we had the talk. 

According to her, she didn't reject me. She just said that she was in a bad place and didn't want to get into anything. She said that right now, she misses me and wants me there to support her, that she broke up with the other guy she was seeing and didn't want to label us. This sent me into a bit of a mental tailspin so I kinda shut off and got defensive, insisting that it was a rejection and that while I care about her, I am doubtful of my ability to move on while being close friends. After some more emotional back and forth and going in circles, we agreed that now isn't the time for either of us to make decisions as she wasn't feeling great and I was stressed from work. I work in an emergency department.

I think right now I do want to be friends with her, but I need to set the pretense that I am trying to move on from her, so there will be new boundaries and a bit more distance than before.

What do you guys think? I really think that she is an amazing woman, and if she wasn't in a dark place, she would be the perfect person for me to be with. I do want her in my life, but I am aware there are landmines, the main one being her depression.

Any advice is appreciated!', 'I fell for a close friend, and now the friendship has ended, and I hate that it came to this. 
 To start this, we are both 19. She is probably the person I trusted the most and we shared to much personal shit and were vunerable with each other so much. We grew really close and I enjoyed every minute of the time I had with her. She is an amazing woman and I would love to have her back into my life but I don't think that possible anymore.

Naturally, over time I started to fall for her as we got really close. And I thought it was mutual. We started hugging all the time, hanging out at each others, holding hands, hell, she even slept with me(no sex) on Halloween rather than get a taxi home. I really thought things were pointing that we could start dating. But she could tell something was up with me and kept pressuring me until I confessed. At first she was shocked, and told me that she doesn't want a relationship right now but despite that she wanted me in her life and still be close. 

I took this as a rejection and said that I'm going to need time to process my feelings and start moving on before we can be friends again. I just don't think it can be healthy when one party wants more than the other is willing to give. She said okay and that was that. 

Fast forward a week and she asks if we can meet up because she misses me and is going through a hard time and needs me. I agree to meeting for coffee so I still have an escape if I need. Turns out, while I've been away she spiraled down into depression and got worse. I told her that I am here if she needs me but I'd prefer if she leaves that to emergencies because I am moving on. She asked why and I replied that because she rejected me, I need to deal with my unrequited feelings before we can be true friends. She proceeded to tell me that it wasn't a rejection, that she didn't want to label us and why can't we just go with the flow. She gave me hope and that was my mistake.

I met her again a couple days later because I she was having a breakdown and came to me for help, so I went to help. I also went over because I had something I wanted to talk to someone I trust about. However, once it was solved and the conversation evolved, it became clear that I had hot my hopes up for nothing. I slept on it and decided to message her: "I needed to do my own thing for a while, I'm sorry if you feel I have wasted your time but I need to get over you before we can be friends".

She blew up at this and had a meltdown. She blamed me for being selfish and being childish because I didn't get what I wanted. I realized she didn't care about me. She didn't take into account me while she melting down.

All in all, I regret the way this whole situation played out. I wanted to say that I just needed a break but she took it out the ballpark. I wanted to be able to be friends once I sorted my feeling out but that doesn't seem possible.

I'm thinking about sending a Christmas card to her once the dust settles in the hopes that maybe when we are more mature, maybe we can be friends then.', 'I agree. As a student, I would always get up early to eat breakfast and while it took me a whole to get a hang on the water front, I now drink somewhere between 2-3l of water a day and I have genuinely never felt better', 'How sustainable is my quantity over quality playstyle? 
 Hey guys,

Just started my first play-through of Stellaris and went along a materialist, militaristic and authoritarian ethics. As I started off, I focused on my resources and research. It just seems coincidence that most of nearly all of the military research was fleet capacity. 

As the campaign started progress, one of my neighbours declared war (first war, yay!) on me so I activated the grand fleet edict and filled capacity and sent them off to battle. Despite them having superior tech fleet tech, I had greater production and resources so I managed to win by ships coming off the line as soon as another was destroyed. Sheer numbers allowed me to cede all their planets and take their race into slavery.

My question, is this combat playstyle feasible later on in the game or is it only effective in the early stages of the game?']

['People that bought lots of toilet paper: why?', 'Loving this new feature that spams a lot of bugsplats from the client', 'Why you shouldn't look at how much time passed since the last fap, nor care about it 
 This logic applies to any other addiction you have; if every day that passes you just look at that growing number with excitement for when it becomes 2 digit, 3 digit etc. It means deeply inside you're still addicted. 

Picture an alcoholic, just counting time since the last beer he drank; he is still thinking about alcohol by moving his attention to not drinking, and that is a dangerous habit especially if you're at the beginning: try focusing on other activities instead. When an addiction or an habit is forced out of our daily life it creates a big hole in it, that hole has to be filled with something else, so read a book, study, find a new hobby, take a walk, there is plenty of actions you can do instead than thinking "oh yeah! Two weeks and not a fap!"', 'What is something someone you have known for a long time does that surprised you either in the good or bad way?']

["Thanks! I picked them up for sale at Champ's bc they looked so cute! But I don't wear them as much as I want to üòû", "You're not alone in this. I'm 17 and AMAB, and I feel the same way. Looking back on it I realized that I've been showing signs my whole life, whether it was crossdressing with underwear and what not or looking up gender quizzes every once in a while. Throughout high school I tried to bury it by playing basketball and football. I settled on just doing track for my junior year, but some of my football teammates want me to join football again. I've built myself up and now I hate myself for doing it, I can't pull anything feminine off anymore. I came out to my parents around a month ago that I thought I was trans and that didn't end super well, so I'm going to have to keep thinking about it for another year until I turn 18. With the social part, I have a small group of friends, but none of them invite me to do anything and when I invite them they say they're busy almost every time. Then again, all I do in my free time is sit around and play video games and do nothing because I have no motivation. I look at girls and I want what they have, not just the body but the close knit groups and their social life. I'm still questioning, so I don't know, but hopefully you can figure that out. I'm constantly fluctuating with how I feel all the time, sometimes I feel like I want to be more feminine, sometimes I want to be a masculine badass. Just make a decision once you truly know what you want to do. And if someone tries to discourage you, make sure you do what's best for you. I'm hoping you can figure all this out and live your best life.", "Need help with my NMD_R1 Japan Triple Whites. 
 So I've had these NMD R1 japan triple whites for around a year now, and they've gotten really dirty, to the point where they seem gray at times. I've tried using shoe cleaner and all that but none of them have worked. I'd really like to get these back to their original white color or close to that. Does anyone know anything that can help? (And yes, I did put shoe protector on them when I got them)

<LINK>", "Thanks. Good luck when you come out to your family, hopefully they'll surprise you and be more accepting than you think ‚ò∫Ô∏è"]

['Does anyone with anxiety use benzos? 
 For context I am doing better with my drinking but still struggle. I am in a weird stressful moderate drinking a couple days a week pattern, but much better than my old habits!

Anywho, I have a ADHD, anxiety, and depression. I‚Äôve never had any issues with abusing my prescribed meds. I recently weened off an anxiety med (wahoo!) but still have acute issues. So my doc gave me Ativan.

I almost took it yesterday because I was feeling nervous, but didn‚Äôt want to use it as a crutch (I know this thinking doesn‚Äôt make sense, it‚Äôs just hard with anxiety brain haha). And I wound up getting some beer. Now I wonder if I‚Äôd taken the med if it might have helped me get over that hump.

I don‚Äôt want to become reliant or dependent on it, but like I said, I‚Äôve only ever had issues with booze. I have never abused by Adderall, and never abused other meds. But I‚Äôm still a bit nervous for some reason. I plan to discuss this with my counselor today but wanted to see if you all had any insight. Thanks!', 'You could still be a trans man even if you like to dress more femme! Of course only you can decide how you identify - if non binary fees better that‚Äôs great! Some folks identify in ways like NB trans masc. 

The way dress is not the same as your internal identity, which is definitely confusing! Does one term feel better for you?', '1. Your mom is wrong.
2. You look amazing.', 'Does anyone use/prayer meditation beads? 
 My mom has been crafting like crazy during quarantine. She offered to make me prayer beads for my altar which I‚Äôm super excited about! I incorporate some Buddhist influences into my practice, so I was considering requesting 108 beads. However I am eclectic (recently starting working with and honoring Loki), so I don‚Äôt really have any specific requirements.

Does anyone use beads for meditation/prayer? If so how do you incorporate this? Any materials you prefer? My mom has some wooden beads and I like natural materials (as much as I can) for my altar). Either way they will be special since my mom is making them.

Given the nature of my witchy practice, I was considering asking my mom to make whatever she felt was best for me. However her intuition guides her! She is Catholic but is very supportive of my practice and my spirituality as well. Any insight is appreciated!', 'It sounds like you are being supportive which is great. Given Jon‚Äôs history with believing they are another race, I definitely understand your concerns. And I think you are right that this situation is somewhat atypical.

While you explained what being transgender means, have you asked Jon what they think it means? It seems like they understand transitioning, but you mention they are also uncomfortable with being a female. I will say I don‚Äôt think the terms are unusual for a teenager to use. Teens are definitely more knowledgeable and open than when I was younger (I‚Äôm a bit older than you). So non binary might be their attempt to understand their feelings.

Does Jon have a counselor? It sounds like that would be the best bet in working through these feelings they are having. It really does seem like a tough situation. I will say even though you believe this might be more of a fixation than a genuine desire to change their gender identity, I might not mention that to Jon, because that could be invalidating if they are confused about their gender.

Keep in being supportive! Your confusion is definitely understanding and to me it sounds like it is coming from a place of genuine concern.']
